title: Very comfortable stay. Approved!
text: The hotel service was very good. The reception staff are very friendly and helpful, especially Kerven. The location is good. The closest station is Columbus Circle, about 3 blocks from the hotel. The rooms are new and the bathroom has a blindex structure in the shower. Great shower. Approved bed linen and mattress. Access to TV with American channels and you can log in to Netflix streaming through your profile. Breakfast is an advantage, however there is no variety between days. For a long stay you end up getting sick of it because it's the same food. But everything served is of excellent quality. Regarding the elevators, it is important to say that they have been changed and are very fast. I would definitely stay again if I return to NYC.

title: Need to be refreshed
text:
Very decent hotel. Renovation work to be planned. Room 217. Torn blind, very, very noisy ventilation.
Very high price at the bar, nice bedding in the room, nice bathroom
Very pleasant staff.
Very decent breakfast

title: Special mention to the excellent service provided  by front desk Mr Raihan
text:
Very good hotel , services, and location.
Confortable, clean, quiet and close to best of Manhattan
Marriot Fairfield has good standards between their units
 Would like to include a special mention to the excellent service provided  by front desk Mr Raihan that helped me a lot

title: Lovely quiet hotel
text:
My sister in law and I stayed here in February. The hotel is small and slightly out of the way. The rooms are spotlessly clean and the breakfast buffet was an extra bonus.
Our room had no view at all, and purely from it's location and the height of the building, I'm not sure if any of the other rooms would have an outstanding view.
We had a room on the 1st floor so we didn't have any issues with lifts as we could walk up the stairs if need be, even though we chose not to after a long day walking.
There are 2 lifts which seemed to work fine when we were there, although I should imagine there would be more of a wait in busy periods.
The reception staff are extremly friendly and helpful, assisting with directions or any query we had. There is security by the door that leads to the hotel rooms, so extremly safe. The female security guard was lovely and very friendly. 
We had one drink at the bar the night before we went home. These were very expensive, but I should imagine no more expensive than anywhere else in New York.
Central Park is about a 10 minute walk away, but very easy to get to. There are bars and restaurants just up the road, so plenty of places to eat. All walking distance.
We found the location great, we were close enough to walk everywhere, but far enough away fron the hustle and bustle of times square. 
If you're looking for a quieter hotel away from the main tourist trap, then this place is for you. 10 minutes from Columbus Circle with the shops and restaurants. This is a great little hotel.

title: A good value and alternative to Times Square & Lincoln Center
text: This is a good, reasonably priced alternative to more centrally located Midtown hotels with some trade-offs that worked for me.  On the plus side, I found the room to be very quiet and comfortable.  I was satisfied with safety measures (key entry to the elevator and security posted in the evenings)--important because of the location in Hells Kitchen between 10th and 11th Avenues.  Be mindful that it is not an especially short walk to the nearest subway stop (Columbus Circle is 0.5 mi, about a 12-minute walk).  I was OK with that, and the size of the room, mainly based the proximity to Lincoln Center (0.4 mi).  I also want to give a shout-out to Rebeeka at the front desk for arranging an early check-in.

title: Amazing Hotel
text:
Fantastic hotel, this was our second visit to our favourite city.
Close to Central Park and Columbus Circle,lots of shops and restaurants.
Staff are very welcoming on arrival,hotel is spotless clean. 
There is lovely seating area outside to have a cocktail or two.
The bedrooms are quite small not much storage for cases and not much wardrobe space. 
Bedroom and bathroom spotlessly clean.
It is great that there is a fridge in the room along with coffee maker and iron.
We were there for 6 nights and our room was serviced every day. We left $3 per day for the housekeeper as they work very hard.
Breakfast is included which is buffet style,all staff were lovely ana worked very hard.
The lifts are quite slow,however ibeliwve this is caused by staff using these for moving their trolleys around.
The door going to the lift area needs to be opened via your room key and swings into the opening of the bar which must drive the staff crazy. I would suggest that it is changed as it is very annoying.
When we checked out we were able to leave our luggage at reception and go explore the city for one last time.
The staff booked us our own transport back to JFK which cost $95 was ideal as we didn't want to take several suitcases back on underground and the Air Train especially when we were travelling on The busiest day of the year "Thanksgiving Eve".
Thank you for a great stay and we will be booking to return in 2025.

title: Hotelvisit in February 2024
text:
The Hotel had a very good service 
Johnnie was always really helpful und nice to us :)
Beds where pretty comfortable cause we were sick and lay all day in bed
It was clean and a pretty room.
All in all a pretty good hotel and we would definitely come back :)

title: NYC stay + wedding
text:
Good services... a great bed in the "guest room", very well connected (10 minutes walk from the metro and central park) a nice breakfast where pancakes with Nutella and maple syrup would have been missed by example but otherwise nothing to complain about we will come back and many thanks to Kerven for his professionalism and kindness!!
Anthony and Jessica from France 😉

title: Good hotel, great staff
text: Nice location, 10 minutes walk from Columbus Circle, easy to walk around. Good places to eat and shop around the hotel. Rooms are smaller, but well maintained, staff at reception was very helpful and efficient to provide all answers to our questions. Great breakfast, both selection of items and staff were fantastic, one of the best in Fairfields Inn we have ever stayed. Worth to recommend this hotel!

title: NYC for the second time!
text: Excellent place located in Hell's Kitchen, blocks from Central Park and the Columbus Circle station, I could move anywhere and return to rest in the comfortable room, every morning with breakfast included and the excellent attention of the staff, particularly Rosa who When he realized that we were Hispanic, he made us feel comfortable speaking with us in Spanish and making our transit through the hotel much easier for us, thanks Rosa and thanks to Marriott

title: Great Hotel and great Location in Manhattan
text: Amazing experience. Front desk was very welcoming, courteous and accommodating. Room was clean, well equipped and the bed was extremely comfortable. Breakfast was very good with choices for all comers. Staff throughout the hotel was always, kind, caring and smiling. We were especially grateful for Adnan, the manager and Kerven, Johnnie and Rabeeka at the front desk. They made everything so smooth for us. The hotel is on a quiet street (A major plus for Manhattan!!) but also very conveniently located. 5-10 mn walking from Columbus Circle and Central Park. 3 mn walking from the Hudson River. We will come back and tell our friends about our experience.

title: great experience
text: The hotel staff are superb. everyone from check in the check out - including the desk staff, breakfast buffet staff, security guard , bartender and. housekeeping staff are super friendly and efficient at their jobs . It was a pleasure to stay here - we travel to NYC frequently as our daughter lives there - we will never stay anywhere else. Clean, quiet , spacious for NYC rooms - nice breakfast buffet , nice lounge area. for drinks and a clean gym . we will definitely be back

title: Mi aspettavo di più
text:
Hotel nella media. Ciò che non mi è piaciuto:
- posizione: 13/14 min dalla fermata della metropolitana non sono pochi.
- colazione: se qualcuno non ama la colazione americana auguri! 
Ciò che mi è piaciuto:
- la gentilezza e la disponibilità del personale. Risolvono i problemi nell’immediato.
Ciò che mi è piaciuto così così:
- pulizia giornaliera non approfondita

title: Poorly maintained, NOT close to Central Park dismal hotel in Hells Kitchen
text: I don’t expect large, spacious accommodations in NYC. What I do expect is a reliable elevator, heat and hot water in my room and honest staff. Upon arrival to this hotel as a Titanium Elite Member, I was put into a corner room that had limited space and no heat. I requested a room change but they were sold out. “No problem, we will have maintenance come to repair while you’re at dinner”. Told upon return it was fixed. NOPE! Next morning, requested a room change while heading out for work. “OK, pack and bring down your belongings”. I did mention the poorly maintained, slow elevator earlier. I had a meeting to attend so I requested maintenance AGAIN. That night it was even colder so I had to strip the sheets from the other bed to stay warm.  The next morning I did pack up and I was provided a warmer room with at least some space to walk around the bed.  After paying $2,800 for a 4 night stay, I surely felt taken advantage of. Even the breakfast was mediocre at best. I stuck with the watery oatmeal. Yes, Fairfield is the low end of the Marriott food chain, but this management is only in it for the $$. Stay anywhere else.

title: decent spot for NYC
text:
Decent location--walkable to many tourist places and points of interest. A little tricky getting in and the elevators were small. The breakfast buffet was decent but not great. 

I was with a group tour but would go back and stay there on my own.

title: Worst hotel in NYC
text: Worst hotel I’ve ever stayed…not one good thing about it. Filthy rooms. Trash operation outside any rooms ending in 01 all night and hotel staff apparently couldn’t hear it although it went on for 6 hours. Elevators take 10-15 min so plan ahead! Couldn’t pay me to stay here.

title: Way too expensive and not a really comfortable hotel, however a great location.
text:
Way too expensive compared to what you get. Simple room with bad indoor climate and narrow bathroom. No relaxing areas and the breakfast capacity is not even close in meeting the requirements. 
However the staff is very helpful and friendly, trying to make you feel welcome. In this hotel you only pay for the location which is central and close to Times Square.

title: FREDDO
text:
albergo in posizione abbstanza comoda . 15 minuti a piedi alla fermata della metropolitana di columbus circle , zona central parck sud ovest. 
Colazione da mensa , abbiamo avuto grossi problemi con il riscaldamento della camera , molto freddo e non abbiamo avuto acqua calda in camera per tutto il soggiorno nonostanze la nostra richiesta di sistemazione. purtoppo non posso consigliarlo . amici un un altra camera venduta per 4 persone hanno avuto comunque freddo e i 2 letti nella stanza sono molto piu piccoli di quelli che consideriamo da una piazza e mezza.  peccato , soggiorno problematico .

title: 4 nuits décembre 2023
text: Nous avons séjourné 4 nuits dans cet hôtel (1 adulte et 2 adolescentes). Chambre petite mais très bien équipée. Ménage fait tous les jours. Petit déjeuner varié et copieux, il y a tout ce qu’il faut (fruits, salé, sucré, boissons, céréales…). Personnel très sympathique et accueillant, très serviable. Possibilité de laisser les bagages à l’accueil gratuitement si vous souhaitez profiter de votre dernière journée et que votre vol est le soir. Plusieurs commerces autour de l’hôtel (cvd pharmacy, target, restaurant, boulangerie…). Metro colombus circle a 10 mn à pieds.

title: Excellent Room Layout
text: I find that other NYC hotel rooms are so cramped but this room was excellent!! Front desk staff Raishan was very hospitable to me and my guests. The layout of the room was perfect and the manager left a snack in the room with a cute little note, so thoughtful.

title: Good stay in NYC
text:
This was a very good hotel, excellently located for all the tourist activities that we wanted to see.  Our room was very comfortable, however there was a distinct lack of storage for clothes etc we brought with us.  An bigger wardrobe or drawers would have been handy, however this is not a deal breaker.  The lounge area was very comfortable as well, with soft seating to enjoy the most expensive drinks I have ever had in my life.  Bar is drastically over-priced.  The breakfasts were very good, very much enjoyed the coffee and orange juice with the food being good as well.

On the downside, it's now four days since we checked out and there is still no sign of the $200 we paid as a security deposit being returned.  This is out of order and needs to be investigated.  

I would return to the hotel, but in future would pay the deposit in cash and expect the same in return

title: Our stay in Fairfield Inn & Suites, New York Manhattan/Central Park
text: The bedrooms have everything you need. Fluffy pillows and really comfy beds. Great shower and location as we did The Big Apple Half Marathon on the Saturday morning. Johnnie on Concierge was very friendly and helpful and got us a ride back to JFK Airport. Fantastic stay.

title: My stay in New York 2023 Dec
text: Pleasant staff , comfy beds , small lounge area , pricey drinks n food in bar , breakfast was good plenty , tea n coffee not nice from machine , orange juice is nice   , good location for easy reach of Times Square, had to to put 250 dollars as deposit on room in case of breakages ( shows as pending in your bank) restaurant git very busy at times .

title: New York New York
text:
The location was excellent for walking to all of the sights we wanted to see.
Diners/ restaurants for dinner were slightly outwith the centre and as such more ‘authentic’ and reasonably priced .
We booked a double room and a king room.
Two mothers., husband and wife and a 5 year old.
No bed for the 5 year old and when asked about it was offered a toddlers travel cot type thing.
Was told if we wanted another double for the bed , then it would be an upgrade at $40 per night.
The 5 year old stayed in the double. With both grandmothers.
Shower in our room was never more than lukewarm …..
When asked , was told that the boiler is on the roof , so to leave it running for a while….. the temp never changed the whole trip .
Breakfast is a bonus and absolutely fantastic and a credit to the hotel and staff.
I would return , if I could have a hot shower

title: Schöner Aufenthalt, sehr gerne wieder!
text: Sehr schönes Hotel mit sehr freundlichem Personal. Die Zimmer sind klein, aber zweckmäßig eingerichtet. Die Lage ist ruhig, in der Nähe befindet sich die Metrostation Columbus Circle. Im Hotel gibt es vergleichbar gutes Frühstück inkl. frischem Obst.

title: Superbe première expérience New Yorkaise
text:
Séjour parfait au sein de votre bel établissement. Nous avons séjourné 7 jours en famille avec 2 grands enfants dans une chambre à part.
 Le personnel est  toujours très souriant et avenant, une mention spéciale à KERVEN soucieux de notre bien être à l’accueil qui parle français et également à KARIMEA au petit déjeuner qui nous a accueilli avec un sourire  solaire , c’est très agréable de débuter la journée ainsi.
Le petit déjeuner est copieux et  varié chacun y trouvera son bonheur avec du salé ou du sucré, nous avons beaucoup apprécié.On s’est senti  un peu comme à la maison. 
La surface des chambres est réduite mais suffisante et satisfaisante nous n’y étions que pour dormir.un espace de rangement plus grand serait idéal.
Localisation  centrale proche de CENTRAL PARK 10mn , à 30 mn de TIME SQUARE nous avons découvert Manhattan uniquement à pied , ce qui nous a permis de nous immerger intégralement dans la vie des New yorkais.
Le fait que le ménage ne soit pas fait tout les jours ne nous a pas dérangé, il faut être un peu organisé et tout se passe bien.
Je signalerai juste une climatisation une peu bruyante dans la chambre. 
Très belle expérience pour notre premier séjour à NEW YORK je recommande cet hôtel  situé dans une rue calme ( c’est important)

title: Bien mais sans plus... Ne convient pas pour un long séjour à deux... Dommage car très bien situé...
text:
C' est la troisième fois que nous venons à NYC et la première dans cet hôtel très bien situé, au petit déjeuner copieux et à la literie au top. Nous avons particulièrement apprécié M. KERVEN non seulement parce qu'il parlait français mais aussi pour sa patience, son efficacité et sa gentillesse. les autres employés de l'accueil ou du bar ont été tous aimables et souriants. Le personnel d'étage faisait notre lit tous les jours
 ( nous y sommes restés 10 nuits), mais oubliait souvent de passer un coup de balai sur le sol...
Nous avons par contre beaucoup moins apprécié la petitesse de la chambre, sa situation sur l'arrière avec un bruit d' évacuation incessant toutes les nuits (!...) et surtout, surtout , le manque de rangements pour un séjour assez long... avec un placard à vêtements ridiculement petit.Et cela met un gros bémol à l'ensemble...

title: Peu mieux faire
text:
Parlons dans un premier temps des points noirs concernant l’hôtel :
*les ascenseurs : ce n’est pas possible de faire pire. En effet il faut très fréquemment attendre au moins 10 minutes pour avoir un ascenseur qui daigne se présenter. Et quand il est là il s’arrête quasiment à tous les étages. C’est encore pire quand les employés prennent le MÊME ascenseur que les clients. Il faudrait revoir la synchronisation de ceux-ci (en dédier un aux étages pairs) et un autre aux étages impairs et prévoir un ascenseur de service. Enfin régler ce problème de grincement.
*la facturation des extras, bar entre autres (prix assez élevés en plus) . En effet lorsque vous passez par une agence pour la réservation il n’est pas possible d’avoir le détail de ce que vous avez consommé.
*la considération. Il y en a aucune même si vous restez plus de 10 jours.
*Le nom des employés d’accueil sur les badges n’est pas lisible et il faudrait indiquer qu’elle langue ils parlent.
A part ça l’hôtel est bien situé sur la 58th et est très bien desservi niveau bus ce qui vous permet d’être à Time Square assez rapidement.
Les chambres sont confortables

title: Good, affordable spot for short trip
text:
The hotel is located conveniently;
it’s only a couple of blocks from the subway station and easy to walk to Times Square and Broadway. Kerven was awesome and helpful - accommodating my later flight with a late checkout.

title: Superb Week In New York City!!!!
text: The trip was mainly positive, every room contained a TV, a fridge, lovely scented soap and the most fluffy pillows. The buffet was mainly good it had berry compote, chocolate chips and the classic continental offerings. The elevator however took a long time which is inconvenient for handicap people. We felt very accommodated, especially as many of us had allergies and we stayed well. The staff were super supportive always helping when they can especially since we went with a school. Overall we had a brilliant stay, felt at home even though we are hours away (in England) and miss it to this day.

title: Breakfast in the restaurant
text: In the restaurant where I had breakfast I would like to mention the employee of Karriema.  Her charming smile,desire to help,answers to my questions, and her explanations made me completely delighted!

title: Superbe merci
text:
Un super séjour dans cet hôtel très propre , avec un super petit dej et literie impecable. Le personnel est très agréable et disponible . Mention spéciale à Karriema qui nous a accueillis chaque matin et a été très douce avec notre fille qui l'a adorée !
Je recommande !

title: Dissapointing and not worth the money
text: The location is great, the staff nice, and the included breakfast was quite good.  However.  I've stayed in many hotels in NYC, and for the price of the room there should have been a little more space and at least one bureau.  The room looked directly into another building which I was told by the front desk "that is how all the KIng Rooms are".  Again, can be typical NYC but not for the money. At busy times of the day wait times for the elevator can be upwards of 10 minutes and after that there are usually stops on every floor so add a few more minutes. Doesn't seem like a big deal big after a few days it becomes annoying.  The weekend we went the hotel they decided to do some major work on that patio they are proud to show so many pictures of.  The work was super loud and necessitated blocking off the patio on the Friday, and then for the rest of the weekend the main entrance via the patio was blocked off.  Here's a novel idea, if a property is going to schedule work, they should discount the price. Not only was the patio mostly unusable, the blocked entrance meant you had to go out via the side which meant you had to walk by all the smokers. Yuck.

title: Cute Gem of a hotel in the heart of the city!
text: This a great hotel in a location close to central park and in the heart of the city! From the cute bar in the lobby where you can enjoy a cocktail and some laughs after a day seeing the city to the attentive staff who greets you with a smile, you feel like family. Yan was especially helpful as my room had some  minor issues and she quickly moved me to another room and went above and beyond to ensure I had a fantastic stay while at the hotel. She is the epitome of excellent customer service. I will definitely be back!!

title: Nice hotel for a visit to New York.
text:
We spent a few nights at the Fairfield Inn & Suites by Marriott, New York Manhattan/Central Park as a couple in September 2023.
The hotel is centrally located, a good 10 minute walk to the metro (Columbus Circle and about 2 minutes to the bus). Restaurants and supermarkets are also available in the surrounding area. Unfortunately, it is also very noisy in the area because there is a hospital a block away, but if you want peace and quiet you shouldn't travel to NYC, we were aware of this and therefore it didn't bother us. The rooms are adequate for a couple and there is a small closet in the room. Other amenities include a safe, ironing board, iron, TV and USB ports. All in all sufficient and very clean. As has often been mentioned here and in other forums, long waiting times for the elevators are to be expected.

The breakfast is typically American and sufficient, but unfortunately it's all just disposable dishes.

At the reception we only experienced friendly and very helpful employees who answered every question patiently and friendly. A special thanks to Kerven for his tips, advice and hospitality.

Conclusion: Our next New York vacation will also take place in this hotel, we have nothing to complain about the hotel.

title: Friendly and Spotless
text:
We had six nights here recently with friends from England. The downside is that the rooms are very small, but this is NYC.  There are only 2 very slow lists for 18 floors which at busy times is really frustrating.  But overall the hotel is well located, the staff are very friendly, including front office and breakfast and bar staff.  To be honest we were pleasantly surprised at how spotless the rooms were.  Their cleaning staff are first class.
You are walking distance to a lot of the major sights in midtown and upper esta and west side, but the hotel is located on a very quiet street which is great for sleeping. A nice place to stay.

title: AVOID
text:
Gave the hotel ample opportunity to sort an issue with them throwing some of our belongings before we even got back to the UK but here we are. Accidentally left a shoe at the hotel ... called the staff as soon as we spotted before even getting home ... told to call later. Called again ... "We've thrown it in the trash". I just find this ridiculous and you've thrown personal belongings in less than 48 hours. Never heard from the apparent 'investigation'. Absolutely useless and for a Marriott, I expect better.

Aside from this; breakfast was terrible, rooms were on the small side and won't be staying again.

title: Excellent
text: Excellent stay. Room and hotel were very clean. Staff were amazing. Johnnie took very good care of all our needs!! Breakfast every morning was very good and a wide variety of foods. I will definitely stay again my next time in New York City!!!

title: Surpreendente
text: O Hotel é bastante acolhedor, de fácil acesso, confortável, possui ao seu redor vários tipos de lojas e restaurantes para facilitar nosso tempo. Os funcionários da recepção me fizeram sentir muito bem recebido e meus especial agradecimento ao  Sr. Ler em, além da equipe do café da manhã que são muito receptivas, tornando um local bastante agradável!

title: Breakfaset Server Karriema
text: The server KARRIEMA was the best breakfast server and host I have ever had in over 40 years of travel!!  She was bright and cheery.  She welcomed all guests and truly invited them to enjoy a great start to their day.

title: My favorite New York Hotel
text: Fairfield Inn & Suites Manhattan/Central Park Has a super friendly staff that is very helpful. The rates are reasonable and it is in a great location. Liked the breakfast options as well. Will stay here again!💖

title: Unfreundlich und schlecht gelegen
text:
Unfreundliches Hotel zu überhöhten Preisen. Nie wurden wir in einem Hotel schlechter behandelt. Wie wir von unserer Bank erfahren haben gab es einen Fehler im Bezahlsysystem des Hotels! If Grund dieser Tatsache ging unsere Visa Karte nicht! Sofort wurden wir wie Obdachlose behandelt! Später wurde uns gesagt, dass alles ok wäre. Am nächsten Morgen wurden unsere Karten gesperrt und wir kamen nicht mehr zu unseren Sachen ins Zimmer! 
Keine persönliche Entschuldigung.
Und das bei über 400€ pro Nacht! 
Die Entfernung zur Metro ist für Sportler angegeben! Mit Gepäck den Hügel rauf dauert deutlich länger. Die Aufzüge sind zu klein und zu wenige, so dass wir morgens 20 min bis zum schlechten Frühstück brauchten und 29 min wieder zurück.

title: Zentral, sauber, freundliches Personal
text:
Es ist ein Mittelklasse Hotel, das 10 Minuten Fußweg vom Central Park und der Metro Station Columbus Circle entfernt liegt. 
Wir waren 7 Tage dort. Unser Zimmer lag im 9. Stock mit Blick auf das John Jay College. Wir waren zu viert (2 Erwachsene und 2 Teenager) und fanden das Zimmer sehr klein dafür, aber zum Schlafen reicht es. Unsere Klamotten breiteten wir auf dem Sideboard gegenüber der zwei 1,40m breiten Betten aus. Der kleine Schrank zwischen Bett und Bad ist hoch, aber winzig. Den nutzten wir für die Jacken, weil es keinen Halen im Zimmer gab. Insgesamt hätten wir uns mehr Stauraum gewünscht. Damit sah es immer unaufgeräumt und chaotisch bei uns aus. Wie gesagt, zum Schlafen reicht das Zimmer und wir fuchsten uns ein. Die Betten waren aber schön weich. Die Kaffeemaschine mit den Kaffeepads haben wir nicht verstanden - das Wasser lief vorbei, aber vielleicht waren wir auch zu blöd 🫣 War aber nicht schlimm, weil es ab spätestens 06.00 Uhr schon frischen Kaffee vor dem Frühstücksraum gab.
Dass es zu Stoßzeiten an den Fahrstühlen länger dauert, können wir bestätigen und empfehlen, die Treppen zu nehmen. Runter zumindest und je nachdem, in welcher Etage das Zimmer liegt. Wir haben es im wahrsten Sinne des Wortes sportlich genommen. 
Das Frühstück ist halt typisch amerikanisch. 
4 verschiedene, warme Speisen: Rührei und immer 3 andere, wechselnde Speisen (mal Bacon, mal eine Spinat Feta Quiche, mal ein herzhafter Muffin, mal Burger Patties…) 
Obst: Äpfel, Bananen, Orangen
Aufstrich: Butter, Frischkäse, Marmelade, Nutella und (oberleckere) Peanut Butter.
Das Porridge war ungesüßt und konnte mit den verschiedensten Toppings (Nüsse, Schokostückchen, getrocknete Früchte, Haferflakes etc.) ausgarniert werden. 
Im Kühlschrank gab es viele Joghurtsorten, kleine Flaschen Milch.
Der Kaffee schmeckte gut - verschiedene Milchvarianten (inkl. Hafermilch) gab es auch. 
Aufschnitt: 2 verschiedene Käsesorten (Cheddar und eine andere).
Gemüse: Gurkenscheiben und Möhrensticks.
Süße Teilchen: täglich eine Sorte, die variierte (Muffins, Waffeln, Pancakes etc.)
Das Hotelpersonal war super freundlich und hilfsbereit. Besonders möchten wir hier Karriema hervorheben - sie begrüßte uns jeden Morgen mit einem netten Small Talk. 
Den Hotelflur auf unserer Etage fanden wir immer etwas möhlig, weil manche Gäste ihren Müll vor die Tür stellten oder die Wagen des Room Service an der Seite standen. Ansonsten war alles sauber.
Das Gym ist mit Cardiogeräten (Laufbänder und Stepper), einer Hantelbank, Matten, Gymnastikbällen, Desinfektionsmitteln, kleinen Handtüchern und einem Wasserspender ausgestattet.

title: Very good hotel for access to Lincoln Center and Central Park West.
text: Very comfortable room in a great location for Central Park and Lincoln Center.  The area is mostly residential and quiet - solo walking back to the hotel at 11pm felt safe.  Room size is OK for NYC - not generous.  Bed was soft and comfortable and the room and bathroom were spotless and modern.  Breakfast is included and had a variety of hot and cold foods - good but not gourmet!  Lots of restaurants nearby with colleges and a hospital within 1 - 2 blocks.

title: New York autumn break.
text: This hotel is in a good location, subways close by and a 15 minute walk from Central Park. The staff are all very pleasant and helpful. A special mention for Karriema and Janeel who were very kind to me when I was unwell during my visit. Thankyou ladies.

title: Poor and bad experience
text:
, i am very disapointed wirh this Hotel that charged value withou my knowlegde and also do not give cancel the deposit 

I have to wait 30 days  to release my uad 250 deposit 27 sept 2023 at Hotel farfield in  Suites by marriott NY central Park ar 538 w 58th st New York  16 sept to 23rd sept 2023.

I will never go back to this Hotel my experience was poor. And very bad experience.

title: Great location and services
text: This hotel is at a great location, and their staff provide excellent services as well. They have good breakfast and room is very clean. I would also like to shout out to frontdesk staff Johnnic who has done excellent job, Johnnic is very approachable, always willing to help and very friendly!

title: Booked a day room and it was great
text: I booked a day room via Dayuse for this hotel. The service was great at check in. The room was spacious (it was an accessible room) and perfect for the few hours we would be in the city. Room was clean and the bed comfortable. The location was perfect for Manhattan Cruise Terminal, 10 minute walk and around 20 minute walk to Times Square. Perfect for what I wanted to see with the few hours I had.

title: Mrs boyle
text: We stayed here for weeks at the start of sep.hotel is lovely staff are so nice and helpful.brekfast is grand to.the only problem was not enough cupboard space or drawer space.only a few hangs.plug in bathroom won't work so when drying hair you had plug in bedroom.when you tryed to use mirror hair dryer would cut out.took a few shakes to get it working.could do with extra mirror in bedroom. But either than them few problems hotel was handy to central park.uber and taxi into time square around 25 30 dollars.

title: Mittelklassehotel
text:
Uns hat das Hotel sehr gut gefallen. Das Personal ist überaus freundlich! Die Erfahrung mit den langsamen Aufzügen haben auch wir gemacht, aber wenn man nicht mit allen Gästen gleichzeitig fährt geht es. 
Das einzige, was wir schrecklich fanden, und daher nicht volle Punkte: Das Frühstück! Nur Plastikgeschirr, -besteck, alles in Plastik verpackt. Als Europäer blutet einem das Herz. Unser Ausblick vom Zimmer war leider auf eine Hauswand, das war jetzt auch nicht so toll. 
Aber die Subway sowie der Central Park sind nur 10 Minuten Fußweg, von daher sehr zentral. Kleiner Tipp: Links um die Ecke fährt ein Bus, das sind nur 2 Minuten. Der fährt immer am Hudson River entlang. Den haben wir sehr oft genutzt.

title: excellent stay
text:
this hotel is in a great location, 10 minutes walk to the nearest subway and Central Park. It is very clean. Staff are friendly and helpful and complimentary breakfast in the morning was great.
The room size was good and the bed was so comfortable, and we had a great view from the top floor.
Nice seating outside which you can take a drink from the bar with you.
Overall, my friend and myself would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again

title: Reservation
text:
Hello and good morning - hopefully you can help me - can you share a contact email address - trying to make a group booking reservation with people arriving on different days and trying the website from the UK is problematic.  I look forward to hearing from 
Thank you

title: Buen hotel con desayuno gratuito.
text: Estuve una semana,colchon bueno y almohadas tambien,ni muy gordas ni muy finas,dos por persona.Tienen un microondas al lado de recepcion para todos los huespedes,nosotros todas las noches calentabamos la cena que comprabamos en el super cercano y la tomabamos en la habitacion.Tienen otro microondas en la sala de desayunos para calentar la leche que es fria,tienen leche de avena,muy rica.Tienen fuera de la sala de desayunos unos termos con cafe y leche para llevar si vas fuera,pero solo estan puestos  el tiempo del desayuno.

title: Great choice, location and value.
text:
This is a great place to stay in New York City. It is within east walking distance to a major subway station and close to restaurants, bars and Central Park. 

Our room was small, but had what we needed. It was clean as was the property in general. The breakfast each day was great with many hot and cold options.  

I would have given them a 5 but the shower in our room did not work. We found this out our first morning. I had to resort to washing my hair in the sink. I told the front desk and they said it would be fixed quickly however when we returned later that afternoon nothing had been done. I went back to the the front desk and we were given a new room. I was disappointed that 1. They didn’t seem to know the shower wasn’t working (the lever on the valve spun around and didn’t connect to anything) and 2. When we returned they had no idea that no one had fixed the issue. We did get a new room but I believe their should also have been at least some discount for the first night. 

Hopefully this was an isolated incident. The staff was friendly and they also had a white board by the front door with several good recommendations of close restaurants and places of interest. 

If I were to go back to NYC I would stay there as the location, property, value and free breakfast is compelling.

title: Pros/Cons & Staff to go to
text:
Fairfield by Marriott is a nice hotel in mid Manhattan.
Pros :
1-You are walking distance to myriads of options whether sightseeings, food, activities,etc.
2- Rooms are clean and modern 
3- Offer decent  breakfast space with okay food options for the included free Morning meal.
4- They have Janeel Brown who should lead the customer service team of this hotel. She is friendly, attentive and smart. She goes the second mile for whoever approaches her. 
She is a real jewel and star of this hotel.

Cons:
1- Because of space limitations & design.If your room faces the 58th, then noise from Patio may reverberate or echos to your room. Specifically by night
2- 2 functional elevators which in busy times, might delay your lift or descend. It also travels very fast (might make vulnerable dizzy because of sudden air pressure change) from the 5th to the ground.
3- No ice station on any floor 
4- Staff except Janeel & two other individuals have a huge area for improvement. 
Quite a few don’t speak or understand English (house keeping, staff servicing breakfast area) or willingly don’t listen to the guest or have a limited ability to comprehend guest needs or at times ignore you especially on the phone.

title: Staff
text: Breakfast staff, especially Karriema was fantastic with the kids.  She helped them find what they need and made them happy!  The hotel in general was really nice and the front desk was always helpful with all of our needs.

title: Fantastic service
text:
The room was clean, comfortable, and well maintained. Location was excellent for our needs and off-site parking was very close by.
Breakfast included was a huge plus! The staff was excellent, they kept everything well stocked despite the rush of people. 
Shout out to Karriema during breakfast for going above and beyond to help my son find something he wanted to eat. He was shy and overwhelmed at first but Karriema helped him feel comfortable and was truly a blessing that morning.

title: Best Hotel including Breakfast in a great pricepoint!  Fairfield treats you LIKE FAMILY!
text: I have been staying WEEKLY at The Fairfield since 11/15/2222-6/30/23.  The staff and hotel have become my family.   Complimentary breakfast is amazing with Diana and team!  They welcome me like I am family each week and give me my favorite floor and rooms.  If I ever need anything they jump!

title: Nice NYC Hotel Near Central Park
text: A really nice hotel in an awesome location that is close to Central Park and other key tourist attractions in NYC. Includes a complimentary breakfast with excellent service provided by the staff, especially the friendly, helpful, and lovely Karrieme. Highly recommend this hotel!

title: Good choice for NYC
text:
I had a spacious corner room on the 10th floor; I *highly* recommend paying for the high floor upgrade. This is a noisy part of the city, and you'll want to be as far removed from that as possible. 
The room itself was comfortable, large by NYC standards, and clean. Updated with amenities I needed. Bed was VERY comfortable and bathroom was large enough for my use without being cramped, especially for a room in NYC. Plenty of light and great views! Climate control worked well, and I had good water pressure. 
Free breakfast with plenty of seating. Good shopping and restaurants within a few blocks. 
I will say that the noise level on my second night there was very loud - there was a jackhammer doing a repair most of the night on and off. I don't think the hotel can do anything about that - it's just how it is.

title: Muy buena ubicación
text: Muy buena ubicación, estás cerca del metro. Lugar privilegiado en Manhattan . Excelente la atención, la limpieza. Habitación con buena calefacción. El desayuno es abundante. Tiene un plus que si compras comida te permiten usar el microondas y el comedor.

title: Cosy hotel in a big city !
text:
Bedding very comfortable . Room very clean . Staff at reception very efficient especially Johnnie who was very nice and qualified . 
I will recommand that hotel .  
The air conditioner was very noisy and we had to switch it off but windows could be open !!! so that was not a problem .

title: Wonderful staff, great service!
text: Loved staying here!  It's a no frills hotel but the staff is amazing and super helpful!  I had an admin emergency and they helped me out and I couldn't have been more grateful! Both Johnnie and Ashley are absolutely wonderful, kind and helpful!  I would absolutely stay here again - service is everything!

title: Small town car in big city hotel
text: Small town care from a big city hotel. Great staff. Johnnie went the extra mile when I needed a receipt for car service. Great location. Close to Lincoln Square, theaters, and Central Park. Felt safe. Clean rooms. I had a great time in NYC. Thank you!

title: Thank you Fairfield Inn & Suites New York/Manhattan/Central Park!!!
text: Great location and great service, especially from Francisco and Johnny. It has everything to be comfortable while exploring New York City. Would highly recommend if you are prone to walk either uptown or midtown. Complimentary breakfast above my expectations. The rooms are minimalist but comfortable.

title: Great experience
text: This hotel is perfectly located - near Hell's Kitchen and Upper West Side. Our room was cozy (not large, considering the area) but well laid-out for four of us. Breakfast was good. There was a nice sitting area right outside, and a bar inside. Served our needs well.

title: Hidden Gem on W. 58th
text: We always choose this Fairfield when visiting family on the Upper West Side. Convenient to Central Park, Riverside park, Lincoln Center, restaurants, shopping. Staff is friendly and supportive. Special shout-outs to Raihon at check-in, Diana for yummy hot breakfast, and Johnny for billing questions. Rooms are small (it’s Manhattan!) but white-glove clean and beds are comfortable. Highly recommend!

title: Nice hotel in the center of New York City
text: Very nice and clean room and very welcoming people (Jhonnie in particular). Good breakfast and they even have a mini market to buy snacks. My experience at this hotel was a 10 out of 10. we’ll come back for sure!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

title: Pros and cons here
text:
Lots of ups and downs here. My room was quite small and faced the a/c unit which provided a fair amount of noise. No food on site except for bar food. Toiletries in the shower which was good, but no body lotion.

But, you can walk to a number of things, and there are plenty of places to eat. Lots of plugs.

I’d stay here again but ask for a different room.

title: Nice hotel but several negative issues
text:
This isn't the stardard you would expect of a Marriott though there are some nice features. The rooms are small but have all the features you'd want like nice shower, sockets by the bed and coat hooks. But it's noisy and the air con is too loud to use at night. Security is good and everywhere is very clean and in good condition.
They lose points for 3 reasons. 1. For $400 per night they only service rooms every other day - that's cheap. 2. They have no real evening food as their bar food is just cheap snacks. 3. Worst of all the quantity of plastic waste at breakfast is completely unacceptable.  A major company like Marriott should have a far better environmental record and invest in a dishwasher. Pity as otherwise not a bad hotel for New York though obscenely overpriced as they all are in this town.

title: Lo mejor es la ubicación
text:
Es un hotel agradable e idealmente recomendable para un buen descanso luego de un día ajetreado en NY. La habitación es acogedora y las camas bastante cómodas. 
Nosotros viajamos en diciembre y en esa fecha, hacían el aseo de la habitación día por medio, si bien no nos agrado mucho esto, se nos explicó que era dentro del contexto de la pandemia y para no exponer a los empleados, lo que fue perfectamente entendible. 

El desayuno, no nos gustó mucho, sólo la fruta era natural, todo lo otro era procesado  o envasado, algo a lo que no estamos acostumbrados, pero que dentro de todo era una opción de comida aceptable y en buenas condiciones, además siempre había disponibilidad . El horario del desayuno no me gustó, creo que debería existir un margen más amplio, además no todos los días era el mismo horario. 

El personal era muy agradable y siempre dispuestos a ayudar.

Si sólo hablas español y nada de inglés, te contamos que no hay trabajadores (desde la recepción, hasta el bar o aseo) que hablen español, sólo hablan inglés y el inglés básico no sirve para nada. Así que te recomendamos, descargar un traductor. Ellos tienen la mejor disposición para ayudarte, independiente del medio que elijas para comunicarte. 
Y lo mejor de todo, es la ubicación. A pocas cuadras del metro, del Central Park, de museos, centros comerciales, restaurantes y supermercado.

title: Average at best
text: The hotel is fine, but there were a few things that just were bad. The air conditioning in the room was so loud -- like, louder than the TV!  Between that and the hard bed, we barely slept.  The room was clean. The staff was very helpful and friendly. There are only 2 elevators for an 18 story building with many rooms -- that makes elevator use very difficult. We didn't try the breakfast, nor did we patronize the bar area. The location is great. Overall, an average stay.

title: Please feel free to book this hotel. Rest at ease and enjoy the beautiful city of New York.
text:
We had an excellent experience with this hotel. The staff greeted us on entry and from there on everything went as and above expectation. It's in a great location (within walking distance to Central Park, Broadway, New York Harbor and a short Uber ride to anywhere else.
Note of appreciation to Yan Chung (GENERAL MANAGER) and the staff for finding and sending me an Apple Pen that I left in the room. 
Such a classy move.

title: Rough start, stellar finish
text: The location of this hotel is perfect if you like to walk to your attractions....minutes from Central Park AND Times Square.  There is a wonderful little bar in the lobby which serves as a nice community gathering place in the evening after a long day of sightseeing.  The first couple of days, we had some SERIOUS elevator problems (hence the four stars instead of five) and we swore we'd never come back.  However, the Operations Manager, Ashley, listened to our issues, had the elevators repaired ASAP and went above and beyond to make sure we were satisfied.  She is a gem of a hostess / manager, and I hope Fairfield realizes what they have in her!  By the time we left, we felt very much at home and the staff felt like family.  The rooms were a good size (bigger than many I've had in NYC) and I would definitely stay here again.

title: A pleasant stay and looking  forward to another visit .
text: Great front desk service by Johnnie. Courteous and made check in effortless. The other fellows Raha and Francisco also welcomed other guests graciously. Rooms were comfortable and clean and quiet. Every one at the front desk helped with directions to each place we needed to get to.

title: Good stay at Fairfield Central Park n.y.
text: Very friendly staff. Especially Johnnie, Raihan, Ashley, and Alissa. Good location close to Columbus Circle, and for Central Park and the several museums etc. good restaurant within one block, and short walk to subway.

title: Great proximity to Lincoln Center
text: Stayed here one night in April 2023. Yes, the rooms are small, but if you are looking for a “quiet” area close to Lincoln Center, Hell's Kitchen, and even Times Square, this hotel is a great choice! The walk to Lincoln Center was about 8 minutes. Times Square is about 15 minutes. The staff was super-friendly, and when we had trouble with our TV someone was up to fix it in 5 minutes. There is a bar, however, it’s tiny, and not exactly remarkable. I appreciated they didn’t charge us to hold the luggage for the day. Many NYC hotels have started to charge (which is ridiculous). When visiting NY, my husband and I often stay in the heart of Times Square, but this was a wonderful alternative. If you are looking for parking, there is a garage around the corner. It was $60/night (we may have been over-charged though). Overall, highly recommend.

title: Great location and hotel
text: This is an amazing location & the front desk staff especially Ansley was so welcoming when we checked in we felt right at home. Our room is perfect for our visit to Fordham which is right next door. Great location and hotel

title: Would stay again
text: The room was clean and quiet. For a hotel room in the city, it was more spacious than expected. I was able to check in early and got a room far away from the elevator. It was tucked in a little nook. I liked how you could open the windows slightly for fresh air, since I'm sensitive to the smell of cleaning supplies. I also liked how the rooms had dark wooden floors and not rugs. The staff I checked in and out with were professional and courteous. I'd stay there again.

title: Near Central park
text:
Great staff, good breakfast, clean rooms - only bad part is that the elevators are extremely slow 
Was able to leave luggage after checkout 
Parking  garage close by
Near subway station
Cute outdoor sitting area

title: Worst hotel I have ever stayed in NYC.
text: Hotel is located near nothing. So no food options nearby. Staff was some of the rudest people ever dealt with. Waiting 15+  minutes for elevator was the norm. Rooms were tiny, old, and Wi-Fi was almost nonexistent.  Loud noises and doors slamming every night. Stay anywhere else.

title: Great Location and Customer Service !
text: Excellent location and the Hotel team was outstanding.  There were very good restaurant options and the subway within easy walking distances.  Specific Shout Out to Johnnie who gave us outstanding customer service !  Will return !

title: Look no further! Just book it.
text:
We cruised out of Manhattan Terminal and this hotel was awesome! Super close, off a quiet street so easy for us to unload our vehicle, and had parking associated at the bottom of the street (under BMW dealer). 

Hotel was small, and very clean. We have stayed in many hotel post-pandemic and most do not feel clean. This one was excellent! Staff were great, hotel had an included buffet style breakfast, which I find rare for downtown NY. 

We would stay here again even if we weren’t cruising. Had some places to eat within walking distance and was a clean/safe feeling area walking around the hotel. 

Johnnie and Raihon (hope I spelled correctly) were great staff at the hotel. 

For those cruising out of Manhattan Terminal, I wouldn’t waste my time shuttling from areas way outside of NY to get to the pier. This hotel would be the only one I’d consider again (stayed in a handful in and around NYC). Not that all past hotels were bad, but this has some features that are really convenient for our family. Parking at the pier was a breeze to get to from the hotel and is only $400 for up to 14 days, and you can park right beside the ship. 

Reasons to stay here:
Great staff, very clean, free buffet breakfast, parking very close by, walking distance to Manhattan Cruise Terminal, close to Central Park, parking lot associated to the hotel almost beside the hotel and not several blocks away, tucked in just off the really busy streets of NY, which allowed us to pull-up, park, unload, check-in, and then go park our car. 

Reasons not to stay: we don’t have any.

Thanks for the great stay, 

Ryan

title: Not close enough to be called Central Park
text: Best part is parking is right next door and relative closeness to Central Park. Was given a room key even though our room was t ready. Walked into the room with the staff still cleaning. And the cleaning agent that they used was extremely strong and stayed with us for the stay. As others said elevators small and long waits. This had to be the smallest hotel room I have ever stayed in. The sound of the ac/heating unit was intrusive. Only stayed the one night. Will not stay here again.

title: Ashley, Yolanda, and Raihan are thee best!!
text:
It's my first time traveling the city alone with my daughter.  Usually, my husband comes with us and he's a more comfortable traveler.  I'm a nervous traveler, especially with just my daughter.  I had an issue with my credit card checking in and Yolanda and Raihan were so incredibly accommodating and helpful.  They went above and beyond out of their way to help me resolve the issue I was having, which they didn't have to because the error was on my part, not theirs.  I really needed their calmness because, again, nervous traveler here.  Yolanda also gave me daughter a small treat and that made a huge difference to me. (Thank you!!!)

When we got to the room, it was surprisingly "too clean" smelling for my very sensitive nose.  I could smell the cleaning products and I knew it would aggravate my asthma overnight.  Once again, Yolanda and Raihan were right on top of it and got me into a new room.  Ashley even got involved and made me feel totally comfortable requesting the change even though I felt like a nuisance.  I was just afraid of getting sick with just my daughter. The new room is just as clean, only without the scent of the cleaning products, which I appreciate.  The room is also  well-appointed and surprisingly larger than I expected. 

Lastly, Ashley  made excellent recommendations for food and my daughter and I are enjoying our stay. I am in town for work but now that I know how close the cruise port is, I will definitely come back and stay here again when taking a cruise! Zero concerns or complaints!!  Ashley, Yolanda, and Raihan are the exact team I needed to ease my concerns for this stay.   I hope corporate sees this! 

Thank you!!!

title: Bit far downtown 10 min walk to subway rooms needed some TLC But Staff were Amazing
text: this hotel is a little basic,  quite far downtown so everything is a walk to subway or 30 min walk. The room was clean but the aircon unit was very noisey and kept making loud banging noises. The view would have been nice but there was a bin store and this spoilt it, the skyline over New York in the evening was good. The bar was small and the menu limited in evening. The breakfast was superb with so much choice and the Staff went above and beyond to help with everything and were very knowledgeable about the area. A nice touch was the map they gave us and showed us areas to visit.

title: Excellent
text:
C'est la 2ème fois que nous prenons cet hôtel, toujours aussi accueillant.
Services irréprochable, personnels de la réception, du bar, du breakfast, des chambres très sympathique.
Toujours aux soins du client.
Nous nous sommes d'ailleurs mariés dans cet hôtel.
Merci à toute l'équipe

title: LOVE THIS HOTEL. Closest to Mount Sinai West
text: Perfect. Immaculately clean, utterly quiet room. Friendly, helpful staff. Breakfast is good. Love the toiletries! Wish they sold them at the front desk! Bed is comfortable. My new fave Manhattan hotel.

title: First timer in NYC!
text: Great hotel! Fantastic friendly staff very helpful. 10 min walk from Central Park 20 min walk to Times Square. All round a great experience and value. Would recommend to anyone! Only niggle was the bedding, especially during winter months need a decent duvet. Will return to NYC next year and wouldn’t hesitate on staying at this hotel again. And to the agent Johnnie Thanks again! 😊

title: Fantastic hotel
text:
The wife and I have just stayed here for 4 nights. What a pleasant experience.
- The staff we're friendly and helpful.
- The breakfast was fantastic, as well as the staff in the morning.
- The rooms we're lovely and comfy. As well as the view was scenic.
- 10 minute walk to Central Park / 15 minute walk to Times Square.

All in all an excellent experience was had here. Would highly recommend.

title: Our 1st choice for any hotel stay in NYC
text:
We have stayed at this property several times, as has our daughter.  We cannot say enough about how kind, efficient and accommodating the staff always is. Yolanda and Betty at the front desk, were so incredibly helpful when we needed some special accommodations for a late check out and when our daughter came on an emergency visit. The manger, Yan,  is so guest centered and cooperative!
In addition to the the incredible staff, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfast is exceptional. They will even provide GF options! 
The room temperature is comfortably adjustable. The location is great...near everything!
If we or anyone we know needs a hotel in Manhattan, this hotel would be our top recommendation!

title: Great find!
text: Great location, nice staff, clean and well priced. We were pleasantly surprised and will certainly return.  Small rooms, buy its NYC so expected! So close to everything, easy to walk everywhere. There is a small bar downstairs and some renovations.

title: No good!!
text: Hairs in the bathroom. Bags of dirty laundry and garbage lining the hallway.  Terrible experience!!  They did not inform us that they would not be cleaning the room. Terrible location. As platinum members we were not happy with the experience!!

title: The best staff and team that you could ask for!
text:
My extended family and I all stayed here for a weekend. Wow, where to start?! It doesn’t look like much, and the rooms are small, but don’t let that deceive you— this place was EVERYTHING entirely because of the heart that runs it. Every single person that we met who worked there truly went above and beyond and the little bar on the first floor has so much great character. 

From Eric and Derrick going so far out of their way to ensure my mom and I could figure out how to turn off the AC (she and I had completely missed the power button right in the center of the dashboard). While it was entirely silly that she and I couldn’t figure it out, they couldn’t have been more helpful, kind, or accommodating! 

Johnnie went out of his way when we were figuring out something with the parking lot, he could have just sent us on our way, instead he offered to place a call to the parking lot and balance helping us while getting so many people checked out.  Not only that, when the folks at the parking lot didn’t speak English well enough to understand the specific request we were trying to make, rather than just leave us to figure it out, Johnnie pulled out his phone to continue helping us and doing google translate.
 
Janeel and Johnnie worked as such a great team helping us watch our (huge quantity) of luggage while we spent some last few hours with our family after we’d already checked out.
The women at breakfast, whose names I didn’t catch unfortunately, even found me gluten free baked goods! 

My whole family— parents, cousins, nieces and nephews etc.— will all be back for many future trips! 

Thanks to the whole team and staff for making it such a great experience!

title: A great way to start our day!
text: The experience at this hotel was wonderful. The front desk attendants were very polite and helpful. Our room had an excellent view, and its cleanliness was pleasurable. The breakfast was very fulfilling but what stood out to me the most was a young lady name Karriema. She was very helpful, polite and attentive to my sister and I along with other guest. She made our breakfast experience very enjoyable, making sure we had all we needed to enjoy our meal. We will definitely be back to visit.

title: Turn 21 In New York
text:
Arrived for our first visit to New York to celebrate my daughter’s 21st birthday and arriving to this hotel wasn’t a disappointment.
The staff were very friendly and helpful especially Wendy who helped us to navigate the subway and on the plus side she made the most delicious cocktails 🍸 
The room we were given was on the 17th floor and the view was amazing.
The room was very clean and the bed was extremely comfortable .
The Tv had a good choice of films and programmes, Had iron and ironing board , Hairdryer and toiletries were provided in the shower. The only small fault was the lack of enough storage space but we made do.
The breakfast although buffet had a good choice and you were allowed to take it back to your room if needed.
The hotel is in a excellent location for visits to Times Square,Broadway and Central Park.
(Photos View from the bedroom window)

title: Fairfield not so fair
text: Stayed here from Dec 8 - Dec 12, 2022. The room was small and so was the bathroom, but it's NYC so that was expected. The sink was clogged the 1st night and someone came to fix it shortly after I reported it - so that was good. What was not acceptable is one of the elevators. We were stuck twice and on one occasion when it stopped and not aligned to the floor causing one of us to trip while entering elevator. We let the front desk know about the elevator and because they saw our frustration, they promised to give us a discount for one night's stay. In the end, there was no discount. This is not the Marriott quality I expect. I will not stay here again.

title: Would stay somewhere else next time.
text:
The hotel is pretty central and the staff are nice. 
The rooms are small with extremely minimal storage space. Like minimal! Lived out of our cases for the week but I can live with that. 
My issue lies here - Only one out of two lifts work. We waited for an hour outside the lift when we first arrived to get up to our room. It didn’t bother us too much for the duration of our trip as we used the stairs to get up and down. 
However.. on the final day and going to check out at 8am we waited for 50 minutes with our cases outside the lift. We had something nice booked for our last day and we’re in bit of a hurry so we decided the only option was to try and get the cases down the stairs. 
My suitcase split halfway down the stairs and was broken with all of my belongings all over the place. I ended up in floods of tears of upset and frustration and the staff just seemed perplexed, not offering much of a solution in fact they completely ignored what had happened. I don’t think I’ve ever stayed at a hotel where I’ve ended up crying my eyes out due to how rubbish their amenities are, as I’m generally very chilled out and not much bothers me enough to leave a bad review.
So unfortunately no, I wouldn’t stay here again in New York. We were glad to leave in the end.

title: Hotel VERGOGNOSO !
text: Mi chiedo se le persone che hanno prima di me recensito questo Hotel siano state in questo Hotel o nell'altro che ha lo stesso nome ma è a Time Square......Mah !!!! Dire Hotel pulito è da brivido !!!!!! Iniziamo con ordine : NOTE POSITIVE  L' Hotel dista circa 15 minuti a piedi dalla Metrò Columbus Circle e Central Park e questo non è da sottovalutare.La colazione è semplice con pochissimo salato. Per noi italiani si trova sempre marmellata e nutella, succo d'arancia e mela, caffè e latte non male.Arance, mele e banane sempre presenti. Personale educato e gentile. NOTE NEGATIVE: la camera viene pulita a giorni alterni, ok se questa è la regola mi adeguo, ma se al mattino non chiedi il riordino nessuno per giorni entra a pulire, quindi mi chiedo  cosa scrivete sul foglio che consegnate al check-in che le pulizie vengono fatte a giorni alterni se poi NON venite????? IL giorno che vengono cambiano solo gli asciugamani e sistemano il letto. IL pavimento NON viene aspirato e lavato MAI,vi lascio immaginare cosa ci sia dopo 6 giorni per terra e sui mobili........Camera e bagno piccolissimo per 2 persone, ed alloggiavamo in una KING room,i nostri amici che erano in 4 avevano 2 letti a una piazza e mezza, x fortuna sono magri......Presenza di topi che stazionano h24 davanti l'ingresso dell' Hotel,visti con i miei occhi seduta ai divanetti del Bar. Consiglieresti questo Hotel? ASSOLUTAMENTE NO

title: Outstanding Value in NYC
text: Our third stay at this hotel and we loved it once again.  Great location.  Walking distance for us to both Lincoln Center and Rockefeller Center.  Friendly staff and room is always ready early when we have visited.  The rooms are smaller but we don’t spend a whole lot of time in it anyway.  Very clean hotel as well.  Added perk is the free breakfast in the morning. Great selection of hot foods as well as bagels, cereals, fruit etc…. Very reasonable price per night for NYC.  We will continue to stay here when we visits the city.  (Only caveat on this visit was that one of the two elevators was out, so it was a decent wait at times.  We asked for a low floor and walked the stairs most of the time. However, if that is not an option, you will need to be patient until the second elevator is repaired.

title: Amazing birthday trip with family
text:
Came on 27 November for my birthday for 5 night with my mum and younger brother. Beds comfortable but not much room when I’m 5 ft 8 and sharing with my mum. Staff were so helpful and welcoming, especially the lady at breakfast - sorry I didn’t get her name but she is an absolute credit to this hotel. 
Also the reception staff were amazing, greeting us every time we came back to the hotel.

I was charged $100 deposit on arrival which i still haven’t received back into my bank, can I be advised on when I should receive this please?
Thanks, Karla

title: Karriema saved my Breakfast
text:
I have a lot of allergies and can rarely eat anything at complimentary breakfasts but when I asked Karriema if they had anything gluten free AND dairy free she promptly returned with several options and was cheerful and welcoming and I had a delicious breakfast - Thank you.

Rooms are clean and well organized.  Staff is friendly and polite.

title: Awful staff and awful communication
text:
The most awful experience checking into this hotel after a 20 hour trip to get to New York. The lady at the front desk continued to shout ‘I can’t hear you’ persistently after everything we said even though she made no effort to try hear us. 

She then went to on ask for a $50 a night deposit, $250 which we wouldn’t get back for ten working days after we leave our trip. We were absolutely blind sided by the payment and expected a $100 deposit like any other hotel I’ve stayed with before, or a credit card that they would charge should anything happen or be charged to our room. 

We were persistently told that our booking would have the ‘fine print’ even though I showed them our full booking confirmation which had no sign of this information. The manager then agreed to bring the charge down to $150. 

As it’s a special occasion, I called up twice before we arrived to reserve a room with a city view. This was confirmed over the phone but when checking in she told us all the rooms were gone. The worst service for a hotel I’ve ever experienced, not an accommodating atmosphere whatsoever. We were also told repeatedly to ‘cancel our booking’ as any solution to anything we were unhappy with. 

The hotel is run down and not worth one penny that we paid. Nothing worth damaging for that $250 deposit. 

The elevator is also very slow, with three different hotel guests telling us waiting that it takes about 20 minutes to get downstairs in the morning. Ridiculous.

Don’t waste your money.

title: Travel agent review
text:
Service - Everybody in front desk, bar and breakfast were amazing, very helpful and always nice to my group. Special thanks to Johnnie, Francisco, Antonio, Yolanda, Eric, Wendy, Juneel, Yan, Jbovain, Betty, Eli, Ashley, Jade, Kerime, Diane, Rose, Keiha and Jeniyc.

Location - A few blocks behind Columbus Circle and the Entrance of Central Park. About ten minute walk to a subway station. Very safe place and far from the noise, which makes a great night sleep.

Complimentary Breakfast - Very good. Yougurt, bacon, eggs, croissant sandwichs, different kinds of bread, fruits, cereal, juices, coffee and milk.

Room - Standard NY size, which means not big, but manageable. Room could be better used. There are some spaces that could be better managed making more room to bags. Upside of the room is there is a small fridge that guests can use. The bathroom is not good...the sink is very small and there is a huge empty space next to it. The room and bathroom could use some hooks for coats.

Would recomend and would stay again.

title: Tolle Lage und freundliche Atmosphäre
text:
Nachdem ich bei früheren New York-Aufenthalten immer in älteren Hotels in Midtown Manhattan gewohnt habe, war ich von diesem hier richtig begeistert.
Es liegt sehr schön in der Westside zwischen Hudson River und Central Park, die nächste Subway (Columbus Circle) ist drei Blocks entfernt, von dort kommt man überall hin. Viele gute Restaurants in unmittelbarer Nähe, im Stadtteil Hells Kitchen.
Nach einer langen und anstrengenden Anreise wurden wir von dem super freundlichen Personal am Tresen empfangen und eingecheckt. Wir bekamen ein sehr schönes Zimmer mit Blick auf den Dachgarten des John Jay-College. Für New Yorker Verhältnisse war das Zimmer geräumig. Es war sehr sauber, alle zwei Tage fand Zimmerservice und -reinigung statt. Das Frühstück war in Büffetform angeboten und bot genug Abwechslung für jeden Geschmack, so dass man satt und gestärkt in die City aufbrechen konnte.
An den Aufzügen gab es zeitweise Wartezeiten- auch das war mir von den anderen Hotels vertraut - und als ein Aufzug defekt war, wurde dieser recht schnell wieder repariert.
Insgesamt war das Personal stets freundlich und gut gelaunt, so dass man sich einfach nur wohlfühlen konnte. Definitiv würden wir hier wieder einchecken.

title: Très bon hôtel situé à Manhattan
text:
Je suis parti pendant 1 semaine aux États-Unis avec ma femme.
Cet hôtel est parfait pour les courts séjours, le personnel est serviable d’ailleurs quand nous sommes arrivés nous avons eu la traduction de toutes les règles de l’hôtel en français. Ce qui nous a facilité notre arrivée.
Le petit déjeuner était très complet.
L’hôtel est très bien situé puisqu’il se trouve pas loin de Central Park et du métro Columbus Circle.

title: Friendly staff, convenient location
text: This is a lovely little hotel in a great location, walking distance from Lincoln Center and the CBS Broadcast Center. All of the front desk staff were friendly, welcoming, and friendly. Betty, in particular gave us special help when we left a garment bag behind after checkout. The free breakfast options were plentiful, varied, and tasty. Diana, who works in the breakfast area, was a ray of sunshine, greeting guests and helping with special requests. Will definitely choose this Fairfield Inn again.

title: très bel hôtel
text:
les chambres sont très propres , la literie formidable et le personnel souriant et serviable .
Le petit déjeuner est très bien même si il manquait tous les jours de beurres de cacahouète ! dommage quand o. est au USA! mais le personnel de cuisine était génial surtout une femme formidable qui s’appelait KARRIENA elle était super serviable souriante et très agréable. merci pour votre sourire tous les matins et votre gentillesse.
Angelique

title: First timer and Excellent Stay
text: I was skeptical about staying at this hotel but I am so glad I booked my trip here. Jeniyah who is the Front Desk host has such an awesome energy that when you check in you feel super welcomed. She goes above and beyond to make sure you get all of your accommodations. She also gave me a list of restaurants that were walking distance. I was there for the New York marathon so I didn’t want to walk around to much. The hotel room was small but comfortable the only problem I had was the shower handle I had to fiddle with it to turn the shower on and off. Oh and the elevator is the absolute worst because it’s slower then molasses but I would still stay here again because besides those two minor complaints everything else was great. When you check in make sure you have Jeniyah she is the BEST!!!

title: NYC Marathon Weekend! Great Location
text: Stayed here to cheer on family member during the NYC Marathon. Blocks from Central Park and near the finish line.  Easy access to subway to get to other viewing points. Rooms are clean.  Johnnie at the front desk was very friendly.  Small friendly bar and great courtyard with couches.  Breakfast was basic, but works!

title: Not a 4 Stars Hotel
text: First of all I would like to clarify that the hotel is a 10 minute walk from the first subway and although 10 minute walk is a short walk I can assure you that after walking miles and miles around the entire city , museums etc. the evening walk from the subway to the hotel was eternal . The hotel absolutely does not reflect a 4 star , the first impression I got is is of a family run Imbiss . None of the employees have uniforms and the bar in the lobby consists of a bare 2-meter desk.  The breakfast although quite varied and  abundant is served in a basement. The buffet is served in plastic plates , glasses , cups and cutlery .  The rooms are of normal size as well as the bathroom , comfortable bed and cleanliness .  Our room overlooked an inner courtyard so to see what the weather was like we had to go outside because you couldn't even see the sky. Since we used the room only to sleep sleep this fact was not a big problem for us. The big problem consisted of the 2 elevators that were supposed to transport the guests to the 12 floors of the hotel as well as their internal staff.  The waiting time for the elevator especially in the morning was ridiculous to say the least , one morning I waited 24 minutes to reach my room.

title: Close to great, except the elevators
text:
This is a newer property and the location was excellent as I found it to be just the right distance from the faster paced areas like Columbus Circle, but still an easy 10-15 minute walk to just about anywhere and the subway lines.   

The staff was excellent, very attentive and always with a smile and hello.   When I arrived on a Monday night to check-in there were at least 10 people in front of me waiting, but the check-in counter was fully staffed with 4 people and I only had to wait 3-4 minutes.  A very nice surprise given how it goes at some check-ins.

The rooms were well done in terms of decor and comfort.  A bit small (as all NYC rooms tend to be) and it was a bit tight in terms of doing anything other than laying in bed.  But I liked the room style. 

The breakfast buffet was well staffed, stocked and convenient.   

My only issue were the Elevators!   There are only 2 elevators for this 18 story property and they are extremely slow to point of being almost unusable.  I waited 5-10 minutes at times to get the elevator and get to my room.  These elevators are clearly broken in terms of they seem to "get stuck" before opening and sometimes pause for 20-30 seconds.  I also experienced several times where the elevator dropped a few feet and seem to hang/pause between floors.   

I tried to take the stairs but found that the stairwell actually isn't straight up/down once you get to floor 10 or so - it goes through a labyrinth of internal hallways/rooms and to be honest no clear sense of when it ends or how to get to the ground... Not sure it would meet a fire inspection TBH. I had to abandon my attempt after spending 15 minutes trying to get down from 16 to floor 1 - couldn't do it simply via stairs. 

The last thing that was awkward is the entry to the elevators from the lobby.  Never in my life have a seen such an odd, hard to use and strange ingress to the elevators.  There is this large glass fire door you have to unlock with your key before getting to the two elevators.   This door thou is actually in the middle of the lobby bar and so when you open it, it swings very wide, hydraulic and often hits patrons seated at the end of the bar.   Both days I was there this happened and watching guests come in and out multiple times it was always awkward and caused guests to be concerned of hitting somebody.   To add a little drama, every day the same guy (hotel employee) was sitting in a seat next to the door telling people how to unlock it...  A door setup so complex, you need a guy there to explain it! 

So the bottom line - a great property, great staff, nice location - but trying to get the door open to get to the elevators and waiting for what felt like hours to get up the elevator really destroyed the user experience!   I have to believe this can be fixed - get your elevators fixed and have the layout of that lobby door changed.

title: One Night in NYC
text: If you are catching a cruise and want to stay a night near the cruise terminal, the Fairfield by Marriott Manhattan/Central Park is a great place to stay.  It is well positioned to hit the park, see the Intrepid or just check out the shore before your cruise.  The rooms are pretty small compared to other Fairfields in which I’ve stayed.  However, the front desk people are super friendly, knowledgeable and helpful.  When I went to the complimentary breakfast, I found out just how popular this location was.  While there were a lot of people, the set up was such that it flowed quickly.  The food was good.  In fact, I asked Karriema if they had gluten free bread.  She checked on it and they did.  She was, like the rest of the staff, super helpful, kind, knowledgeable, friendly and always smiled.  Great start to my trip!  Thank you!

title: Positive Stay for Work will Return for Pleasure!
text: Really enjoyed this hotel, conveniently located to a conference I was attending and b'way theatres and various sites. The whole world of NYC is just a step outside. Friendly staff, clean and comfortable, delightful breakfast, and just right rooms.

title: Amazing breakfast staff
text: Special thank you to Karriema for taking such good care of us, she would go above and beyond, for example we were late for breakfast and we were starving, she cooked us up a great breakfast just out of her good spirits. Thank you so much! We enjoyed our time in New York

title: Très très bien
text: Nous sommes venus à l'hôtel fairfield pour notre anniversaire de mariage. Une surprise nous y attendait. Personnel au top, disponible, souriant, situé au calme, à proximité de central park, restaurant et commerce à deux pas. Le lit est très confortable, petit déjeuner avec du choix, je recommande à 200%.

title: Great Stay
text: Karrienna was awesome, helped us get breakfast and was simply great to work with, she is awesome!  Really appreciate that she took time to let us get food on Monday 9/26, thank you for staying open a little later than normal.

title: Amazing Stay
text: Had a fantastic time! Rooms were well kept and staff were very attentive. Great location - walking distance from delicious food. Front desk staff had great recommendations. Couldn't have asked for a better experience. Would absolutely stay again!

title: Overnight stay
text: Small room but clean. First time in NY and traffic is crazy. Lots to see and do. Going on to Canada from here if nothing happens.  New York is a great place to visit if that's your thing. Hotel has breakfast,  a bar and lots of other amenities. Hallways are small also but you can't have everything

title: New York Vacation
text:
We had a wonderful 8 day stay!! The Mgrs, Ashley, and Francisco were very helpful, friendly and accommodating to us. Jade,Jeniyah, Janeel, Yolanda, Johnnie, Antonio, and Axel were wonderful!!  They were all very helpful to us in mapping out directions, whenever we asked, to places we wanted to visit and bus routes to take. They were all very friendly and happy that we were enjoying NYC!!
 We enjoyed the full hot breakfast each morning, and the friendly kitchen dining room staff Karriema, Rosie, and Natashia! They were great! The Bartenders Wendy and Eli were very nice and friendly to us when we chatted with them at the end of the night while having a nightcap! Overall our experience staying at this hotel was awesome! We give the hotel and entire staff 5 stars ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ and look forward to staying there when we vacation in NYC again!!! 
Thumbs way up 👍👍👍👍👍!!!
from Stephanie & Judy in Michigan! 😀😀

title: Agréable séjour
text: Nous avons passé un agréable séjour, personnel très agréable et souriant. Petits déjeuners inclus dans le prix de la chambre, on y trouve pain, muffins, céréales, yaourts, œufs brouillés, lards, et même hamburger ( mon fils en mangé tous les matins..). Un distributeur se trouve dans l’hôtel. Un système de voitures privés existe aussi sur simple demande à la réception..

title: Quarto minúsculo, mas conveniente
text:
A estrutura nova do hotel, cordialidade dos funcionários e café da manhã cortesia são os pontos positivos deste hotel.
