Em contrapartida, os quartos são absurdamente pequenos, mesmo para os padrões de Manhattan (nem pense em ficar aqui se for quarto triplo ou quádruplo!) e poderiam ter mais atenção com a limpeza.
A localização é boa para quem prefere ficar numa área tranquila, sem barulho, mas ao mesmo tempo acaba não tendo nada de interessante extremamente perto em especial à noite, tudo fechado. É convenientemente acessível ao metrô  (uns 10-12 minutos a pé) e ao Central Park (uns 15min a pé). Para a Times Square é possível ir caminhando em cerca de 25min. Num geral, se você for ficar num apartamento single ou duplo e conseguir uma boa tarifa, pode ficar sem medo.

title: Consigliato!
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in quest’hotel 5 notti a fine luglio con il nostro bimbo di 2 anni e mezzo. 
Hotel moderno, camera al 10^ piano (senza vista) con doppio letto a una piazza e mezza (molto alti, infatti non ci siamo fidati a far dormire il bambino da solo), piccola ma ideale per un breve soggiorno. Le pulizie in camera vengono fatte solo su richiesta, nessun letto rifatto o cestino svuotato se non espressamente richiesto. 
Negli orari di punta, ad esempio per la colazione, l’ascensore è molto affollato, bisogna aspettare qualche minuto e sperare di non fermarsi ad ogni piano nello scendere alla sala.  
A colazione gli alimenti sono per lo più confezionati, ma c’è molta scelta sia dolce che salato, yogurt, frutta, latte e caffè ed è sempre rifornito dalle cameriere; comodo soprattutto con i bambini. 
Personale gentile e disponibile. 
Unica pecca per noi: l’hotel si trova a 10-15 min a piedi dalla metro e se questo tratto viene fatto più volte al giorno (oltre ai km macinati durante la giornata) magari con bambini o passeggino può essere stancante..per il resto, consigliato!

title: I can’t thank you enough Mr. Johnnie Bovain
text:
Dear Manager of Hotel Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan / Central Park

I want to inform you that we were very happy with your treatment at your facilities during our stay in the US
I want to make a special thanks to  Mr.Johnnie Bovain for being aware of our requirements. 
and especially for being more human, he has a clear American accent, he is patient and professional, of course, all the staff was really kind and helpful to us, especially to my mom who can’t speak English :) 
 
we could see from day one that the hotel service has great quality, both because of its comfortable and appropriate facilities, as well as service and constant concern for our comfort.

I am writing to express my appreciation for the quality of service you offered me and my mom during the days of our stay at the Hotel Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan / Central Park

It was a good decision; I enjoyed the peace and quiet we needed, offered in all the facilities of your hotel. This definitely added to the excellent service of the staff I want to give a special thanks to Mr.Johnnie Bovain I can’t thank him enough for his time and his efforts.

Thanks again to Mr.Johnnie Bovain that made our stay a good time, comforting, and secure. We are sure that when we return to your city, we will go back to your hotel, hoping to find him again.

We will definitely recommend your hotel to friends and family, Thanks again, see you soon.

title: A very good option
text: Incredible warm and friendly team working there. They attend all your demands and the situation is nice to visit Manhattan with a bus stop near to go to Columbus Circle. Rooms are comfortably and clean and the shower fantastic after a hard day in NY!

title: suffisant pour un court séjour
text:
Chambre confortable, mais pour un séjour de plusieurs jours ne pas compter à ce que les chambres soient faites d'un jour sur l'autre (même en le demandant).
L'hotel fais le job pour 3/4 nuits.
Le petit déjeuner est à fuir... préférez aller vous acheter quelque chose à la boulangerie la plus proche.

title: Una estancia estupenda
text:
Viajamos a NY en junio por nuestro aniversario. Atención por parte del personal de diez, especial mención en el equipo de recepción a Francisco y Ashley, fuisteis encantadores y nos ayudasteis mucho. 
Ventajas del hotel: localización (a 10min de metro Columbus Cr y Central Park), los amenities dispensadores dentro de la ducha con acondicionador para el pelo también que es un punto a favor, el desayuno incluido que aunque escasea fruta y fiambre al menos se incluye desayuno cosa que en otros hoteles no lo tienes, el colchón es increíblemente cómodo, dispones de Netflix en la TV, la limpieza diaria de la habitación si la solicitas en recepción, el tamaño de la habitación es muy bueno para la media de Nueva York (nuestra hab era de 21 metros2).
La parte negativa: ascensores, lentos y habiendo dos solo funcionaba uno, las almohadas eran mejorables, podrían poner más armarios y estantes en la habitación porque no hay espacio para dejar tus cosas al deshacer la maleta, faltan perchas para colgar las toallas en el baño, podrían poner mas fruta en el desayuno. Pero todo esto son críticas constructivas, si volvemos a NY volveremos 100% a este hotel porque nos ha gustado muchísimo todo en general. Una vez más gracias a todos, porque nuestra estancia fue magnífica. Saludos!

title: ....near central park....
text:
the only positive thing is that the hotel is close to central park, for the rest:
1) elevators waited up to 20 minutes, always full of people despite the prohibitions
2) non-existent masks
3) chaotic breakfast, too many people, nobody disinfected their hands and many people touched things with their hands. Continental breakfast very poor.
4) very small rooms for 4, with two "double" beds where two children could sleep well but not two adults.
5) you had to book the room cleaning (????)
6) reception ... any request was subject to a fee, even a simple loaned umbrella

title: Location A; everything else C
text: I really wanted to love this hotel; it is very close to our son’s apartment. First, the good: the bathroom was clean, and the room smelled fresh. I liked that the floors were hard and not carpeted. The bed was comfortable. As others have said, the room was small, but not unusually so for NYC. The closet was especially tiny- about 12 inches across. Upon closer inspection, there were greasy fingerprints on the tv screen, and the floor was not vacuumed well enough. The floors in the hallway were noticeably dirty and needed to be vacuumed. None of these issues were dealbreakers, but there are not enough elevators for the hotel. We had asked to be on a lower floor so we could use the stairs if needed, and we were glad. We had to climb up and down. Finally, on a good note, the breakfast buffet was better than I expected. We would stay again for a short visit, because of the location, but we canceled a future reservation for a longer stay.

It was ok. Room was very small. Felt like i was on a cruise ship. Bar has 4 seats. Breakfast done at 9. Like can breakfast be til 10 please. And no cushions on the outdoor furniture as shown! Ridiculous. But it was clean. No ice machines on floors u have to call down and they bring it to you. 
Staff was fine.

title: Great location and staff. Nice and comfy
text: I was there for 5 days with my mom and sister. Location is perfect, near the subway and not noisy. We had a great experience, all the staff was really kind and helpful with us especially to my mom who can’t speak english :) great bed, room not so big for our 3 suitcases but we made it work! very nice breakfast with many options and kind staff. Diane and the girls at breakfast were amazing to us!

title: Tiny rooms, no views and poor Marriott member recognition
text:
Tried this hotel earlier in the week for 2 nights. As a Marriott Titanium Elite member who requested a high floor, I was given a tiny shoebox of a room on the first floor ?  It was one of the smallest rooms and worst locations I have ever had. The breakfast room had some fair options, but was so crowded you could not get a seat. 

Will not stay here again

title: Fantastic!
text:
Absolutely fantastic staff! General manager & reception - perfect work! Hotel organized beatiful surprise for my daughter: welcome card and gift with her favourite cartoon characters. It was so cute!
Comfortable room with super view.
Coffeemaker, fridge, clean bathroom.
Location in the real NYC center - close to Columbus Center (shops, restaurants, bars)
Everyting was 10/10!
I recommend with all my heart :)

title: Hotel favoloso, personale disponibilissimo
text:
Tutto perfetto, dalla posizione al rapporto qualità prezzo eccellente, alla colazione straordinaria.
Menzione d'onore al letto davvero comodissimo e al cuscinoa, ho problemi di schiena e cervicale e non ho mai dormito meglio.
Gentilissimo il personale alla reception che mi sta aiutando a trovare il materasso e il cuscino da acquistare per casa!

title: Great Property that became not enjoyable because only 1 elevator is working!
text:
I stayed previously at this property and really enjoyed the location near Columbus Circle. 

The room and bathroom are small but for New York are the typical size you normally get. All amenities that you need are there, even a mini fridge. The only thing I would suggest is to place the safe at a more convenient location as it is located on the bottom shelve and you have to be on your knee to use it. 

This time I did not take advantage of the complimentary breakfast as Paris Baguette was at the street corner and their French pastries are so yummy! 

The only negative point on this trip is only 1 elevator was working out of the two elevators. Brought long wait time and line up. Was the joke among guests waiting or in the elevator.  My room was on the 12th floor so was using the stairs down and only used it when I was going up. 

I would probably recommend at time of check-in to ask if both elevator are working. If not, to ask for a lower floor room so that you can use the stairs instead of the elevator. 

I enjoyed my stay as I was able to let go the elevator inconvenienced and would definitely go back! 

Regard!

title: Hôtel parfait pour couple
text:
Très bel hôtel. Des services (bar, petit dej, conciergerie) tres appréciable. Bel accueil, le petit déjeuner à volonté est tres bon et varié. 
La chambre pour un couple est plus que satisfaisante. Nous y avons passé un bon séjour. 
Bien situé, le secteur est très calme et le métro a une dizaine de minute à pied.

title: Terrible stay, let me count the ways.
text:
Only good think I can say is staff were nice. What went wrong? Let me count the ways.

1.  I’ve never been in a Marriott property as poorly maintained as this one. Ensuring that things work as they should is an after thought at best:

2.  One expects elevators in NYC to be slow, small and over-crowded to a degree but it regularly took 10 minutes or more to have one stop that was not so overcrowded that you can board.  On the last day one of the two elevators were out, causing even longer delays. Ended up walking up and down 6 flights, last time with luggage, and I am a senior citizen.

2.  Electronic room keys often didn’t work at all, requiring a trip to the front desk to change the code, and even then it would take several tries for the door to unlatch. One time a maid was able to open it for us with a master key; she tried our key and it didn’t unlatch.  Family members in other rooms, we had 3, had the same problems.

3.  The shade for our room was operated by a remote control but only would go down in closed position but not go back up in open position.  We reported this to the front desk; they sent a maintenance worker up to fix it.  He said he did, but you guessed it, he didn’t and it malfunctioned again.

3.  An alarm in the lobby area was sounding for at least 48 hours; nothing was done to silence it.  I can’t imagine how the staff could work with the incessant noise.  And one has to question the safety implications of an alarm sounding that wasn’t or couldn’t be turned off and was being ignored.

3.  Housekeeping is non-existent for a 3 night stay.  On day 2 I asked for overflow bathroom trash to at least be emptied.  The front desk staffer called housekeeping and they promised to empty it and refresh towels with a full cleaning the next day.  Returned to the room that night and you know how this turns out, neither was done.  On the morning of day 3 I reported the problem to the front desk person and she checked and said housekeeping was not scheduled for me and must be requested 24 hours in advance.  I said it had been requested the prior morning; it somehow didn’t end up on the schedule.  They said they would try to fit me in for service but would at least empty the trash.  When we returned later the trash was emptied; never got the full service requested.

I have stayed at Marriott properties world wide and this was the worst ever.  Stay away.  I feel for the staff working there.

title: MOYEN MAIS BIEN PLACE
text:
Hôtel proche de Central Park et pas trop loin du métro pour New - York. Chambres minuscules, ménage jamais fait si vous ne le demandez pas vous même à la réception tous les jours, climatisation très bruyante.
Petit déjeuner décevant, manque de produit, rien de frais et personnel pas à l'écoute des clients.
Dernier point: ne pas être pressé si vous devez prendre l'ascenseur, il faut vous armer de patience.
Bref, ne vous attendez pas à quelque chose de bien, c'est très moyen pour le prix.

title: Good location but painfully slow elevators and very small rooms.
text: This hotel is priced accordingly because of 2 major issues that will not be resolved: first, the two elevators that service an 18 story hotel are snail slow and painfully inadequate for the number of rooms; second, the rooms are small with no place to unpack, store, hang clothes and store your luggage. The breakfast is typical with preprocessed breakfast items found in similar hotels. Ice is only available from the bar. Cleanliness suffers at most hotels because of staffing issues. We like the location but it is several blocks removed from Central Park. Staff are courteous and friendly.

title: Séjournez ailleurs
text:
Du côté positif, le lit était comfortable , le petit déjeuner est acceptable (à peine) et l’hôtel est à 10 minutes de marche du Lincoln Center. Mais
— les chambres sont minuscules
— une seule chaise pour s’asseoir, ce qui oblige une personne à s’asseoir sur le lit pour manger si on commande à la chambre
— bar minuscule
— lobby minuscule et encombré
— seulement deux ascenseurs , qui servent aussi au transport des marchandises, des déchets et du linge souillé
À US$400 par soir(taxes incluses), c’est le pire rapport qualité prix que j’ai connu á New York.

title: Great place for what it is
text:
I found others’ reviews of this hotel helpful and wanted to share my own. 
I stayed there for 3 nights mid-April.  
When reviews say the room is small, they aren’t kidding. The door into my room barely cleared one of the beds (double bed size). There was less than 18 inches between the two beds, and about the same between the bed and the window wall. 
I had a city view room, which was beautiful at night. 
I did not have breakfast there, so can’t speak to that. The staff were all lovely.  There is a wait for the elevators during the morning when people were leaving, but it was not a problem coming and going at off-hours. 
The neighborhood is very quiet, nothing like staying in midtown, but it was a short walk to Columbus Circle, Central Park and Lincoln Center. 10/10 would stay here again.

title: For what I paid I couldn't expected more.
text:
The hotel is in an excellent location, less than a 10-minute walk from both Columbus Circle and Central Park.
Overall the staff is polite, friendly and very efficient.
The beds are very comfortable, but the room dimensions are quite small, 
It's very difficult to fit two people's suitcases in the room, and in our case it was only one per person (65 cm). As the closet only has space for 2 or 3 coats, it was necessary to leave the clothes in the suitcases and opening them became a very difficult task.
Breakfast is enough to start the day, but  very basic, inconsistent and, by European standards, even 3 stars, with low quality products (loaf bread, microwave sandwich, packaged pastries, etc.)
There were days when there were waffles, others not, on some days there were eggs, others not, on some days with very sweet juice, on others almost only water, etc.
As for the room housekeeping, it is necessary to ask the reception, otherwise there is no cleaning.
Of the 7 nights we stayed at this hotel, we spent the first 4 days without cleaning the room and changing towels, although I asked, right at check-in, for cleaning every other day. Apparently there was a miscommunication and after a more emphatic complaint the situation was resolved and the cleaning, which became daily, was impeccable.
The Hotel charges, or pre-authorises on the credit card, a security deposit of USD 50 per day that will be refunded (or not charged) if there are no incidents. In our case it would be $350, understandable, but a bit of a stretch.
Overall the experience was not bad and for what I paid I would have no problem repeating this hotel, but if I didn't pay a promotional price, given the usual rates I would probably choose another option.

title: Primera mala experiencia en Hotel de Marriott
text: La habitacion que recibimos no había sido revisada previamente, pues no servía la caja de seguridad, el televisor ni el aire acondicionado. Después de reclamarlo todo se solucionó. Otra cosa que nos molestó es que nos hayan dejado sin hacer limpieza 2 dias consecutivos a pesar de haberlo solicitado previamente. Y por último, aunque lo más importante: es que den solannente de 7am a 9am para desayunar en el hotel. Deberían extenderlo al menos una hora más, ya que dicen que son cuidadosos con el Covid pero juntan a todos sus huéspedes en una habitaci6n cerrada sin ventanas donde todos se quitan las mascarillas para comer. Segundo, no disponen de tanto espacio para que una pueda comer con su burbuja o grupo familiar, sino que separados todos pegados a la par de otras personas. Tercero, me parece muy pesado que a las 8:59am comiencen a sacarnos del lugar del desayuno, pues apagan luces, recogen todo y comienzan a pedir que uno se salga. Esa experiencia es desagradable. Hay que tomar en cuenta que los huespedes Ilegamos a esa ciudad para turismo, regresa uno tarde de pasear, de caminar con niños, se levanta tarde uno cansado pero con el estrés de que ya van a quitar el desayuno, qué horror. Paguenle a su personal al menos una hora más. Mi esposo es miembro Elite Marriot Bonvoy, en nuestras experiencias en hoteles de esta misma cadena en otras ciudades del mundo no habíamos pasado algo así.

title: Trip with a teen
text:
This was my 6th visit to NYC and this hotel by far was the best we have stayed in 

It wasn’t the biggest hotel or even the location which was great ( 10
Minutes ish walk to Times Square 10 to Central Park , 5 to the closest CVS and some restaurants ) it is the staff 

The team on reception are so welcoming . Make Feb effort to genuinely help - find a restaurant , help with an adaptor , extra towels the list goes on we felt so incredibly welcome the team are a credit and testimony to Yan the hotel manager 

I am so hard to please :) but felt needed to give a special shout out to Ashley for her sunny demeanour , welcoming smile that you can see even behind her mask and her knowledge of a Malbec!!! Also the guy who helps with bags we didn’t get his name but he was so kind a few times helping get bags and opening doors so attentive 

The staff really make this hotel and I wouldn’t hesitate to stay here again even if it were slightly more expensive than other ones in the area 

Other highlights - 

Free breakfast is good - individual pots of cereal , croissants , waffles , bananas and apples great Starbucks strong filter style  coffee , hot individual cheese and spinach omelettes that don’t look great but taste amazing !!! 

Room - we had 2 queen beds there isnt a huge amount of space but enough for 2 and that we slept here and had showers meant it was big enough 

Bar 58 downstairs does reasonably priced drinks and snacks $12 for a wine $16 ish for a cocktail which is in line with Manhattan bar prices 

Nearby - the burrito box if you fancy Mexican takeout was amazing and 5 mins away . Amore pizza does great slices of you need something quick and we had Uber eats from Gotham pizza and DIG which was chicken with veg and rice ( they forgot utensils and the food had somewhat spilt but if it had been right would have been incredible )

title: Appreciate extra help from staff
text:
I want to express my gratitude to staff member -Jeniyah Demunn for her extra effort in converting a reservation and helping with a room request.
She went beyond the expected to achieve what I needed.
Well done!

title: Perfect location, affordable and accommodating staff
text: Had an incredible stay in NYC on business at Sinai hospital across the street.  I made the mistake of double booking my stay, and the manager was able to quickly and easily credit my over booking, and to get me a confirmation of a new room on the day of!  Many thanks for that, great stay.

title: Hotel Muito BOM
text:
Ficamos hospedados por 10 dias neste hotel, existem alguns pontos positivos e outros não.
Positivos: Próximo do Central Park, quarto sem carpete, com piso de madeira, roupas de cama ok, tem frigobar no quarto, oferece café da manhã bem básico, atendimento na recepção excelente.
Negativos: Elevador demora demais na parte da manhã, ou seja, no horário que a maioria está descendo para o café da manhã, em outros períodos ok, limpeza deixa muito a desejar e mesmo você optando pela limpeza todos os dias só limpam o dia que você solicita na recepção, não tem microondas no quarto, tem um próximo da recepção caso precise usar, ar condicionado muito barulhento, o que pode ser um problema para quem tem o sono leve,  café da manhã bem fraquinho em alguns dias faltou o básico, pão de forma e manteiga, outro ponto importante é o metrô, o mais próximo fica a 10 minutos, quando se anda o dia inteiro e a pessoa já está exausta acaba sendo bem desconfortável., colchão muito mole pra quem tem problema na coluna. Achamos o hotel muito bom, acredito que voltaria sim.

title: Bien situé, confort moderne, bon service, climatisation/chauffage bruyante
text:
Accès facile par bus et métro.
Hotel moderne avec de petites chambres. Le système individuel de climatisation/chauffage est très bruyant.
Petit déjeuner médiocre et nettoyage des chambres à demander : procédure Covid ?
Personnel très bien.

title: Pas terrible
text:
Chambres assez petites. La notre avait vue sur un mur... Les fenêtres ferment mal et laisse passer de l'air froid.... La ventilation fait énormément de bruit. 
Le petit déjeuner est vraiment pas bien.... Tout emballé sous plastique.....
Je ne recommande vraiment pas.

title: Great stay nothing bad to say. I will be going back today to stay. Thank you Fairfield Inn &suites by Marriott Manhattan/central
text: I have stayed there 4 times I love the hotel goodstaff clean room great location thank you Fairfield And staff I'm about to go stay another day there so see the staff soon thank you I would recommend this hotel for anyone that needs a business day or just a weekend

title: Hôtel bien situé au calme et proche à la fois de tout
text:
La chambre pour 3 était très bien, la literie de qualité, la propreté impeccable, l'accueil agréable. Le petit déjeuner n'était pas top : aucun produit frais sauf des bananes, des yaourts light sans goût, pas de céréales (il fallait les demander) tout en sachet (!!)  mais bon on s'en est contenté pour quelques jours. Côté emplacement un peu à l'écart des grands axes donc plus calme tout en étant à 2 pas de Central Park et de Brodway. Belle vue sur des tours avec le soleil en face !
Petit bémol : on ne peut pas ouvrir les fenêtres ! sécurité oblige ?

title: Hotel correct proche de Central Park mais prestations moyennes pour un 3 étoiles.
text:
Hotel un oeu l'ecart mais proche de Centrak Park. Plus proche d'un 2 étoiles. Avec les restrictions Covid, ca ressemble à une auberge de jeunesse. Petit déjeuner cheap à emporter et manger dans sa chambre... très loin du breakfast américain. 
Par contre les chambres sont propres et la literie de qualité

title: Well located, very small rooms
text:
The hotel is very well located and the staff was  friendly. We had a nice view from our room, however the room was very small with no space for our luggage or stuff, it was not spacious at all, neither the bathroom.

We requested housekeeping and it was done daily, so we came everyday at night to a clean and cozy room.

However, halls and the carpets in the halls we're stained and didn't seem to be clean.

title: Mixed reviews
text:
We stayed here for 4 nights for a short break to New York. 
It's not central to bright lights such as Times Square etc so it's either a long walk or a cab. We walked everyday apart from one. It's location wasn't really an issue on a short trip.

The staff were very friendly and welcoming. 10/10 for them.

There were downsides to this hotel.....
Outside the room where we stayed, a lonely broken biscuit was on the floor just outside our room door. The biscuit was still there when we checked out 5 days later, A vacuum hoover stood against a wall opposite the lifts and there it stayed. I think it was there for us the hotel guests to use to hoover the floor ourselves. Other parts of the floor needed hoovering too.
The carpet on my floor was stained and looked like a well worn carpet from a bust nightclub. It needs replacing badly.

The breakfast bar was open for 'grab n go' only due to Covid. No sitting. On offer was coffee, tea, orange juice, cereal bars, fruit, muffins, bagels. I think yogurt was on offer too.
Hot food options such as bacon, sausages, toast etc would of been nice. Guests could of taken such hot food back to their rooms to eat. We grabbed breakfast at a local 'cafe' and for 4 of us the check was around $60 in total.

There are two lifts that can make you wait at busy periods like in the mornings. This hotel has about 18 floors so no surprise. But there are stairs to use. Waiting for the lifts is not a negative against this hotel. I'm just adding this in my review.

There is a tiny shop area in the reception to purchase essentials. They was also a microwave to warm stuff up if you have a warm drink or pizza.

We did not have a car and as far as I'm aware, there is only off street parking. 

There is a gym below the ground floor but this I didn't use.

Due to Covid there is no room service unless requested with 24 hours notice. But they will replenish the basics such as loo rolls and towels if requested on the day.

The hotel reception staff are happy to look after suitcases should you have a later flight after checking out early. 

So in whole, my stay here was ok. Just the issues as mentioned. If the Savoy or a chain hotel, there is no excuse for dirty floors.

If I visit New York again I would stay in a hotel closer to amenities.

title: Décevant !!
text: Chambres petites, lits doubles plus petits qu’en France. Ne parlons même pas du petit-déjeuner qui est très pauvre, tous les jours les mêmes produits, aucune préparation sauf porridge et il faut se lever très tôt pour avoir des fruits!! Le Covid a bon dos, Heureusement le personnel est sympathique et réactif.

title: Hidden Gem in Manhattan
text: This hotel is a great find! Conveniently located on the Upper West Side close to restaurants, shopping, Central Park, Columbus Circle. Staff is friendly, efficient and accommodating, especially Axel at the front desk and Kareema and Diana who offer a nice selection of treats at the grab ‘n go (Covid) breakfast each morning. Hot breakfast should resume in the new year. Our room was spotless with a nice view of the John Jay rooftop park across the street. Only negative is wait time for elevators. Just take stairs and burn some calories. We will definitely return to this hotel whenever we visit NYC. Highly recommend!!!

title: pluses and minuses
text:
We had very mixed reactions to this hotel.  We chose it for the location, primarily, and it didn't disappoint in that way:  about a 15-minute walk to the Metropolitan Opera or Carnegie Hall.  The grab-and-go breakfast was plentiful but boring:  always the exact same variety of granola bar, the same type of yogurt, always plain bagels only, etc.   There was hot oatmeal every day, though, which was a big plus.  The orange juice came in small cartons and one morning they were out of it when I went down at 8:30 a.m.  That shouldn't happen.  But on the whole, the breakfast was a plus.  Another plus:  the hotel was filled to capacity at least three of the five nights we were there, and we rarely heard any noise from the rooms above and below us or to the side of us.  So the sound insulation must be very good.   Final positive:  very friendly and helpful front desk staff. 
    As to the negatives, the big one was that we couldn't get our room cleaned.  We were told we could have the room cleaned, and just had to ask the day before.  We stayed five nights, and asked on the third day to have it cleaned the next morning, and it wasn't.  We mentioned this the next day at the front desk, and the front desk staff was very apologetic and said she'd be sure it was cleaned the next morning.  It wasn't.  We had to put trash and used towels out in the hall, get clean towels, and get more toilet paper.  That's inexcusable.  If they don't have enough staff to clean the rooms, they shouldn't promise the rooms will be cleaned.  Another negative:  besides a tiny room, the "closet" was about 12 or 13 inches wide.  I've never seen a tinier hotel closet.  Finally, this hotel has just about the slowest elevators of any hotel I've ever stayed in, and that's quite a few.  The computer in the hotel lobby was also extremely slow.  But, a final plus:  the printer worked.  
    Bottom line:  we probably wouldn't stay here again because we felt so ripped off about not being able to get the room made up even once in five nights, and having to take our trashcan out of the room and also get supplies.

title: Grab and go breakfast
text: Amazing staff, rooms on smaller side I get that it's covid but I have been to quite a few hotels their breakfast needs to include milk and Ceral for the stay to be complete especially for coffee in the morning. The staff makes this hotel worth staying at again

title: Awesome service and staff
text: Stayed here for weeks. Great service especially from Roberto and the rest of the front desk crew. Very accommodating and helpful. Rooms are small but well compensated for by the quality of service. Very quiet location and close to Central Park and the west side highway running trail.  Thanks! Enjoyed my stay.

title: No AC, extremely uncomfortable stay
text: Unfortunately since the hurricane hit the city we were told there was no AC or fans through out the hotel. Sleeping and just being in the room was extremely uncomfortable and hot. The sleeping conditions at night were impossible because the air was suffocating. We were told when we checked in that the air would be fixed that day, but at night when we asked if it was fixed we were given the run around. It was even worse when employees were also complaining out in public in the semi cold lobby. It was very frustrating not getting straight answers from anyone. I’ve stayed her for a week in July and my stay was great. Everyone was super friendly, the location is perfect, so this stay all in all was a little disappointing.

title: Good Samaritan
text:
Everybody was helpful and friendly, even we had to change rooms  twice, because they didn't  have a room with a chair in the bathroom for dissable people, and in one of the rooms  the air conditioner malfunctioned.

The last two days were vey special, because a young man who said he used  to work there and he was visiting one of his coworkers, help my family  to make a reservation por an accessible taxi for wheelchairs, and he comeback the next day for make sure everything  was good for us, when the taxi arrived and he noticed it wasn't room for a third  person for go to the Amtrak Station, he took my son in his own car to the Station. He was our Good Samaritan.

title: Great option for this location.
text:
This is an excellent hotel with a good location. Was here primarily to do research at New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, which is just a few blocks away. Most everything in the city is a short cab ride away.

Very enthusiastic and knowledgeable staff. Felt like a valued guest! Rooms are small (it’s New York) but the space is smartly used and is clean and well-maintained.

title: Clean hotel, fair staff
text:
We stayed at this location of Fairfield inn for 5 days,  because it was close to my brother in law’s place.  And we got a really good deal.

The check in process is as easy, and even though we were early, we got our room quickly.  The front desk staff was always friendly and helpful.

The room was small but clean and comfortable.  The beds were good, and the water pressure was good.  Even with the A/C running, the room felt a little on the humid side.

The grab and go breakfast was fair.  One day they didn’t even have hot coffee.

They could improve on their room cleaning procedures.  We had to call or stop at the front desk to get more shampoo, conditioner, and coffee for the in room coffee makers.

title: Wonderful experience - Excellent  care and attention - Will return again
text: Only highest remarks for all metrics for this excellent hotel. The staff - every single person - SO truly warm, responsive, and caring. You can tell that they love what they do. The hotel is in a great location if you want to be close to Hudson River or Central Park and of course all fo the amazing places on the UWS. Very clean and quiet and professional.  I highly recommend this hotel.

title: AVOID: Sewage Room, Complete Disarray
text:
5-star reviews for this place absolutely shock me because my two nights here were without a doubt the worst stay I've ever had at a hotel. Check-in and check-out were quick and efficient, but that's about where the good stops.

My room smelled straight up like sewage, and I wish I was kidding. I thought the smell might have been from the hallway or it might go away with time, but it never did, and it was 100% coming from the bathroom toilet and shower drain. So gross. The roller shade for the window was also torn (like a giant tear down the middle), and it gave me major murder scene vibes. And the air conditioning didn't work at all; I tried resetting it, pressing the up arrow, and even reaching out to the front desk for help (spoiler alert: they were useless until maybe 10 hours before checkout they finally must have reset it" from the outside"). The room was boiling. To top it off: the phone/alarm clock combo in the room were not working (dead to the world even plugged in), my room was only stocked with one single bath towel in the bathroom (no hand towels, no shampoo, nothing), the bathroom faucet was super powered and sprayed water everywhere whenever it turned on, and the staff I interacted with were super rude and disinterested both over chat and coming to my room when I requested an additional towel.

The location is a solid 10-15 minute walk from the nearest subway station, and my window looked out on some industrial tower/plant thing. My room was next to the elevator so I heard noise literally all night long. I would literally stay ANYWHERE else in the city to avoid staying here again. And as a loyal Marriott traveler (with multiple family members who have lifetime status), disappointed doesn't even do my experience justice.

 Avoid, avoid, avoid.

title: Great Location, Wonderful Staff, Fabulous Find!
text: This hotel is a little gem tucked into the Upper West Side.  Short walk to Central Park, the Hudson River, attractions, shopping and restaurants in all price ranges.  The room and bathroom were spotless and the bed comfortable. Totally quiet which was unexpected in Manhattan. The staff was outstanding, especially friendly, efficient, helpful Robert who quickly checked me in then went outside to explain to my husband (still in the car, double parked) how to get to the parking deck around the corner. Robert brought in the luggage and took it to our room. Throughout our 4 night stay, he went out of his way to make sure we were taken care of, as did others on staff. We will definitely stay here whenever we visit NYC. Highly recommend!!!

title: Visiting Son
text: This hotel is so nice.  In a good location.  Close to subway restaurants, and Central Park is around the corner.  No on site cafeteria, but room service was good. Robert who work the desk is phenomenal...

title: Top quality and inexpensive
text: I stayed in a king room with city view. As in all NYC hotels, the room is small, but that isn’t why you’re staying there. Get out and see the city! The price can’t be beaten in this area of town. The bed was extremely comfortable, and the room was very clean. There is a small refrigerator and safe in the room as well as iron and board. There are plenty of outlets and USB ports. I had no worries about COVID. Front desk staff were masked, and signs were everywhere that masks are mandatory. Staff were friendly and polite. There are plenty of restaurants around the area including a bakery up the street with good coffee. The breakfast room is closed due to COVID. Parking is on the same block, and it’s convenient that the garage and the hotel have an agreement. I would definitely stay here again! Just a few blocks from Lincoln Center, Central Park, and Columbus Circle.

title: Just a room to crash for the night turned to pleasant experience because of the staff.
text:
Where do I start? Every single front of the house staff is a great find for Fairfield and Marriott. I wouldn’t be doing justice to them, if I were to pick a favorite. They were all absolutely amazing. Although I am used to bigger suites than the ones that are at this property, I fell in love with the view from my suite and I ended up spending my whole stay there. Whatever the shortfalls maybe, having great staff who are willing to go the extra miles, compensates for everything that you don't have even during the Covid Restrictions. I can honestly say that I would highly recommend this property if anyone wants to feel at home. Some of the housekeeping staff were very good because they were following the instructions given and the standards set by the front of the house staff. Overall, it was a very pleasant stay indeed and I have reserved another 80 nights. That should say how I feel about the staff, who are the heart of any operation let alone a hotel. I take this opportunity to thank everyone who has been a part of my pleasant experience at Fairfield Inn by Marriott.
Kind regards, 
Chris I.
Marriott Bonvoy Titanium Member

title: Huele a marihuana
text: El hotel tiene una excelente ubicación, las habitaciones están modernas y cuidadas, sin embargo...... la limpieza es mediocre ya que al llegar había pelos en la regadera, obviamente debido a la pandemia tienen poco personal de limpieza de habitación y eso se entiende un poco, no nos subieron ni una toalla extra en una semana, los amenities de baño brillaron por su ausencia. Lo que NO TOLERO es el olor a tabaco y marihuana qué hay todo el tiempo, la primera noche nos tuvieron que cambiar porque parecía que alguien había fumado marihuana dentro de nuestra habitación, el resto de las noches en menor medida pero las partes comunes de hotel seguían oliendo. Por otra parte el Staff es muy amable y con actitud de resolver las cosas sin embargo desgraciadamente creo que hacen falta correctivos para huéspedes que infrinjan las reglas ya que la estandarización de la marca puede verse comprometida por este tipo de asuntos

title: AMAZING HOSPITALITY
text:
Over the years I have stayed in endless amounts of hotels... but I never seem to have a real reason to right a review until now.
The way I was treated from the moment I checked in with Ashley I knew I was in for a good stay.. Her and Michele provided some of the best hospitality and customer service that I'm in awe. 
They somehow have a way of making you feel like you are a guest of there own home..  Ashley spends most of her time talking to guest of the hotel, its like everyone here feels as if they're best friends with the front desk and I think its amazing.
Every single thing I have needed in the few days I was here, they literally bend over backwards to accommodate. 
The Room was perfect, clean, and comfortable !!! 
Finally, I have enjoyed my stay here so much that I actually extended my visit here! 
Great job!! your company has to all star winners on their staff!!! Bravo!

Sincerely
Dwayne Latiolais

title: Just what we needed! A wonderful stay!
text:
The perfect conclusion to a day trip! We finish spending our Saturday doing a plethora of activities (that we can given where we are of course ;) and really just wanted something cozy and warm to rest for the night. A quick search online brought my attention to this hotel. Location was a little further out being closer to 11th Ave but the room was priced very well and seemed comfortable. A few quirks but overall, a really nice stay. Ashley at the front desk made our check-in experience seamless and easy, and immediately felt like we were being taken care of. The room, clean, comfortable and much bigger than the usual "boutiques" that you will find throughout the city. 

Where they may loose some points: 
a. You're not getting that overly stylish décor or look at this establishment. Some attempts within the room but nothing grand. More of an FYI but if you're okay with this (as I was) then nothing to worry about. 

b. The toiletries, nothing crazy. In fact, you will be better off preparing your own items to have the quality that you prefer. It being a franchise hotel, I believe under the Choice umbrella, my experience is that this sometimes comes with such properties. 

c. The hotel entrance/exit. I would assume due to Covid-19 restrictions, they have to do their best to manage people coming in/and out. This is accomplished by having guest enter with their keycards and newcomers enter via doorbell. The keycard gave us some trouble at the front after we checked in, noticed it happened with another guest as well. Maybe an slight error or issue with their system but didn't keep us out long. 

All this said, I look forward to returning. It was a great finish to a wonderful night as this place worked really well for what we needed. Absolutely will be back. A lot of food options nearby as well, especially for takeout or for a quick walk (Peperino Pizza, pretty good pizza and nearby on 60th).

title: Stay Away!!
text: I had to Change twice my room upon arriving after having problems. Rooms are dirty. The walls the chairs the bathroom and the linen are dirty. It looks like they don’t care about the Covid19. Front desk Ashley was actually very nice and apologized but it’s not her fault at all it’s the management. As a titanium elite member I’m very disappointed that this is under the Marriott brand. Never again!!

title: GOOD HOTEL BUT NOT RECOMMENDED
text:
Every person in reception are super kind but the hotel has some problems 
Bedrooms are super super small not even the smurfs would like it.
No housekeeping as you have to call before 9 A.M. and the day you are about to checkout they knock on your door every 15 minutes for you to leave.

title: Noisy elevators
text: Room was clean and sanitised.  Staff was friendly and wore masks.  Neighbourhood was fine, just a few blocks from Columbus Circle.  The problem was the elevators.  They bang constantly (sounds like someone whacking a 2x4 against a pole every time the elevator moves.  The hotel is small so you hear it from  almost every room.  Made it very hard to sleep.  Also, cleaning of the common areas could be better. There was a stack of takeaway food containers outside a room when I checked in at 5.  It was still there when I left at 11 the next morning.

title: VILE
text: I was attacked by a woman in the elevator who forced her way in without a mask. Do NOT stay here. They didn’t care at all and now I have to find a new hotel to stay at where I am safe. Horrible staff horrible guests

title: Employees not wearing mask
text: I was going in and out of the hotel and on multiple occasions I witnessed employees in the hallways and the lobby not wearing mask. I walked in front of a room a housekeeper was cleaning and she had no mask on. I'm glad I sanitized my room before getting settled in. Who knows if the housekeeper that cleaned my room had a mask on or not. One night we came back to the hotel we needed a bottle opener and waited in the lobby. An employee was in uniform sitting in the lobby on his phone with no mask on. Didnt put it on until he notice we were waiting for something and didnt offer assistance until we asked. With multiple employees not wearing masks for multiple days I felt that my health was in jeopardy.

title: Très bon hôtel.
text: Literie exceptionnelle. Hôtel très bien situé à quelques minutes de Times Square et à deux pas du métro, avec un personnel gentil et serviable. Le petit déjeuner tout à fait honnête et des chambres très propres.

title: Excellent Staff
text: The experience at this hotel was second to none. Robert went above and beyond to ensure that everything went smoothly with the stay.  He was extremely accommodating knowing that we were in town for a procedure for my father at a local hospital.  He was sure to ask how my father was doing and how the surgery went.  He did not hesitate to ask if eveything with the stay was ok, even after my repeated returns to the fornt desk with myriad questions.  The hotel room was perfect for what we needed and the location could not have been better.  Thank you, Robert, for all of your assistance during a difficult time for my family.  Your kindness is greatly apprecaited.

title: Amazing staff
text:
I just wanted to publicly thank the Fairfield Inn staff for incredible service during  a recent stay. Every person I spoke with was polite, friendly and helpful. The clerk at check in even moved his car to hold a spot for me - above and beyond! Another agent hung social distancing signs at the elevator after I voiced concern over the number of people getting on at once.

The only negative thing I will say is that many of the hotel guests were not wearing masks. The hotel staff all were, so it's not on them, but the guests were maybe 50/50.  Not sure it's different at an of the other hotels in the city.

title: Friendly Staff. Clean Rooms. Great Location. Rooms are small though.
text: I recently stayed here for a week at the end of June. All the staff were extemely friendly and the hotel is very clean. The hotel is a few blocks away from Columbus Circle and Central Park and there are a ton of great restaurants locally. I would most definitely stay here again!

title: Ojo!!!! Desaparecen cosas de las habitaciones y hacen cargos indebidos en las tarjetas Visa
text:
Nos alojamos en este hotel a primeros de marzo y el segundo día al volver a la habitación echamos en falta un objeto personal, bajamos a recepción a denunciarlo y nos dijeron que lo investigaban y ya nos dirían algo, así hasta el día de marcharnos que pedimos una hoja de reclamación y nos la negaron, tuvimos que rellenar la reclamación en una hoja de papel y a duras penas conseguimos que nos la firmaran.
Dijeron que se pondrían en contacto con nosotros y hasta ahora.
Encima, llevamos dos meses intentando que nos devuelvan 878 € que nos han cargado en la tarjeta Visa y no hay manera.
Vamos una vergüenza de Hotel con una atención pésima si te encuentras con un problema.

title: Very nice hotel in great location.  Very small rooms.
text: We stayed here for 2 nights for my daughters graduation from medical school.   It was at the nearby Lincoln center.   This was walking distance or about $10 by Lyft.  The hotel was great and the front desk was awesome.  They had a table and chairs to sit at in the small lobby and we had friends come over and sat there.  It rained or we would have gone outside to sit in the very nice patio.  Our room was the smallest room, I have ever stayed in. Don't know how they make the beds.   No were for your luggage.   The great review was due to the helpful front desk ( we were greeted by name when we arrived back from the graduation) and the room was very clean.  The provided breakfast was also very good.  Walk-able to the subway and to Central Park

title: Muito bom!
text: Gostei bastante desse hotel, ele não fica bem naquele burburinho da times square já que sua localização é mais próxima do central park mas com uma pequena caminhada você já está na entrada do metrô. Possui um café da manhã muito completo, sempre variado ao longo dos dias e bem gostoso. O quarto possui um bom tamanho para os padrões de NY e uma bela vista também já que fiquei num andar alto. A limpeza sempre bem feita. O único ponto negativo eram os elevadores que demoravam bastante a chegar mas no geral é um bom hotel, no último dia consegui um late check out e o horário de saída foi às 15:00, maravilhoso!

title: Hotel review
text:
The standard room we stayed in was  small.  The closet was inadequate.  The location of the in-room safe required you get down on your hands and knees and squeeze between the bed and desk to access it.  
The hotel could also use updating.
Front desk staff was very good.

title: No heat for two nights in winter.
text: Room was cold when arrived, played with controls but no HVAC. My friend lives a block away in Manhattan so I decided to stay with him and tell hotel after breakfast next day. Had to complain twice about no heat, we were out an about in NYC. Confirmed HVAC not working. Hotel full. Expected me to stay in room 56°. I had to ask for more blankets. Asked why I didn't say something immediately when I asked for refund. I would have rathered stayed with my friend with heat then pay for this. It's 27° at night! Third night changed room, and was greeted with an already clogged toilet but at least had heat. I was so disgusted by the way I was treated by the front desk, we skipped the breakfast at hotel, checked out early and stayed at my friends. And have the nerve to want to charge me for a bottle water after having to drag my luggage downstairs for the new room last night. I want a refund for those two nights and they have me the run-around.

title: Agonizing Financial Transaction
text: The front desk staff are very professional and courteous.  Hotel was clean, very small.  There was no microwave in room and you can hardly turn around in the bathroom. The location would be okay in the warm months, too far if walking to bus station or subway in the cold. There were over 17 attempts to charge my card on file during my free reward stay, which resulted in my credit card company refusing to authorize any transactions, due to suspicious and potential fraudulent activity.  My debit card that was used to settle first stay, and was not on file, was charged without authorization on my second stay.   When I called my credit card company, to try to settle the account, I was told there had complaints against this property in the past and they were a high risk for fraud, that I would not be able to use this card at anytime for this property.  I then attemtped to use remainder free reward nights and was refused by hotel property manager, who was the one that attempted to charge my debit card without my authorization.  Had he communicated with me, I would have been able to authorize and have settled immediately. Instead, they are now threatening to turn me into collections!  I was told by Bonvoy that the hotel simply needed to request a certificate for my stay, and this would be issued, but they refuse to do this.  A continued nightmare, I cannot recommend this property to anyone at this point.  I am a titanium member and have never experienced such grief in previous stays at any Marriott property.

title: Good service, uncomfortable hotel.
text:
This is a true Marriott property and in all respect and front desk service is very good. I do not blame the personnel working here for the property’s defects.

This is kind of a “just enough” Marriott property. Rooms are small. Uncomfortably small. Bathrooms even more so. It’s appointed pre-Starwood merger and it has some compromises that make it feel more dated even when the hotel isn’t even this old.

No electronic locks for example.

One issue is the location. It’s close to the pier. Close to Fordham University. Close to Lincoln Center and reasonably close to Central Park. 

It is not close to a subway station. Columbus Circle is a good distance away. It’s good for walking, don’t get me wrong. But at night after a show it’s simply not a nice walkable area at all.

It has a small bar, not bad at all and it offers a few bites.

The major issue with this hotel is its lack of functional design. It’s awkward to enter into the elevators. There’s only 2 for the whole hotel. The hotel is 18 floors high. Housekeeping uses them. It can take a long time to get an elevator. I found at least four times when only one elevator was working properly. A housekeeping supervisor used the elevator to go down ONE floor instead of using the stairs.

The windows do not seal well. There’s blower noise from the outside. Rooms are small and can get claustrophobic.

The good thing is that in comparison to other Marriott properties this wasn’t nearly as expensive. Maybe in the summer it is more comfortable.

title: Une horreur !!!
text:
J ai eu le malheur de passer et régler d avance 5 nuits dans cet établissement où j ai dû changer de chambre à 3 reprises :

Un froid et un bruit terrible dans les chambres côte cour et rue!!

Une salle (plutôt une cave )pour le petit-déjeuner indigne !!

Un personnel en dessous de tout imcapable de me commander un taxi pour JFK 

Une honte  pour la chaîne internationale marriott!!

Le prix est attractif mais pas possible de dormir.

title: Lugnt och bra läge
text:
Trevligt hotel i lugnt område men ändå nära till Midtown, Chelsea, Meatpacking mm
Små men fräscha rum. Trevlig personal som alltid hälsar när man går förbi. Frukosten har ett enkelt utbud men är helt ok. Lång väntan på hiss är dock negativt.

title: Decent Hotel close to Chinatown area
text:
Stayed here for one night cause we wanted to be as close to Midtown and Times Square as possible. The hotel location isn’t amazing in proximity to top NYC tourist spots, but it wasn’t bad either. The overall space outside the hotel is a little dingy but bus and metro are close by and there are some markets and Chinatown restaurants close by. 

Good hotel if you’re looking for something well priced in NYC. The hotel had free breakfast too. The room was a little cramped, but all in all, a pretty decent stay.

title: Outstanding
text: I recently stayed at this hotel. The service was outstanding and the breakfast was included and it was basic but okay. The room was small but looked recently renovated. The staff were super friendly and wanted to help when you needed something. Overall I would say this is a good hotel, especially for the price.

title: Only one huge problem: the elevators
text:
Wonderful rooms (small), newly renovated, feels great, comfortable beds and all amenities, great quality of sleep, and - wonderful team! (highly professional and kind and quick).
I chose this hotel because I had an event nearby, so it was perfect for me.
But the waiting times for the two elevators were insane. The two elevators were working and yet, I felt I'm wasting my life waiting.

title: Meh--and Be Aware of Rude Housekeeping Staff
text: In terms of cleanliness and the friendliness of the check-in staff, it was okay.  Nothing special.  The housekeeping staff knocked on my door and I said I was getting ready.....5 minutes later they knocked again.  I thought this was rude.  Then, an hour and a half later they came back to knock on the door AGAIN.  It sent a message of "We can't wait for you to get out of them room".

title: Ottima soluzione
text: Sono stata in questo hotel con il mio ragazzo per 4 giorni a Gennaio. Siamo partiti malissimo perché, nonostante l'arrivo alle 18, la camera non era ancora pronta. Ce ne hanno assegnata una non pulita, con gli asciugamani e le lenzuola degli ospiti precedenti, ma dopo aver spiegato il problema ci hanno dato una nuova camera pulita. La camera é piccola ma comunque funzionale e con tutto quello che serve. Colazione ottima, forse non troppo varia, ma sicuramente abbondante. Quasi nessun hotel comprende la colazione, quindi un enorme punto a favore di questa struttura. Personale gentile e disponibile. Ho notato che, nonostante la macchina per il caffe in camera, una volta utilizzate le prime 2 cialde non ne vengono messe di nuove. Posizione abbastanza buona ad una decina di minuti a piedi dalla stazione metro di Columbus Circle, dalla quale partono treni in tutte le direzioni. Mi é piaciuta anche la vicinanza con Central Park, é stato bello la sera passeggiare lì sapendo che eravamo vicini a "casa". Lo consiglio per l'ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo

title: Great hotel
text: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn for one night. The hotel is beautiful and clean. My room was pretty big for NY standards. It is incredibly modern and tidy. Breakfast was great. And last but not least, front desk service was top-notch.

title: Good Location but nothing fancy
text:
The Central Park name is a bit of stretch, as the hotel is a few blocks from the park, but is otherwise in a convenient location. It isa pretty well maintained hotel and the staff was pleasant.  Had a few minor maintenance issues and requests that were brought up during the stay that were not addressed.  
The free breakfast OK, but nothing special - yogurts ran out and the pastry most consisted of stale bagels and toast.  
The two elevators are extremely slow and not enough for the size of the hotel. 
The room on the top floor facing an interior courtyard was pleasantly quiet and had nice city views

title: Dismal Hotel
text: Recently stayed at this sad excuse for a hotel. From the appallingly designed shoebox rooms with no storage to the unbelievably slow and barely working elevators this establishment leaves everything to be desired.I have stayed in other budget brand hotels before and this makes the Hilton Garden Inn and Hyatt Place seems like palaces. The staff are all indifferent and totally uninterested and anything you ask for is way too much trouble for any of them. Avoid at all costs.

title: NELLA NORMA...
text:
Ottima posizione per visitare New York( vicino al Central Park) , ottima colazione e personale disponibile alla reception.
Camera piccola ( non si possono disfare le valigie) , pulizia della stessa che lascia a desiderare...
Nella norma...

title: Camere piccole, impianto di condizionamento rumoroso, buoni collegamenti, prezzi contenuti
Fabuloso!
text:
Hemos estado la familia en este hotel. Y hemos estado encantados 
Con el trato y con la amabilidad del personal del hotel!!
       Las habitaciones muy bien y limpias , cómodas camas , muy bien situado el hotel. Se nota la calidad de Marriot y la amabilidad y familiaridad de Fairfield !
        El desayuno esta muy bien servido en platos desechable muy practico y el desayuno estaba incluido que en NY esta genial así y que en cualquier hotel pagas mucho mas si es a parte .
     En el desayuno el personal es muy muy amable siempre con sonrisa y todo te  facilitan.
   El precio del hotel esta muy bien .
      La verdad que volvería sin duda alojarme aqui.
Gracias

title: Si può fare
text:
Hotel con un ottimo rapporto qualità prezzo,il personale e gentilissimo,ma la stanza è molto piccola ,bisogna lasciare gli abiti nelle valigie,ma comunque silenziosa,anche se non viene pulita a fondo ,la colazione è compresa nel prezzo!
Un quarto d'ora a piedi da Times square

title: Justo
text: Quarto simples, porém adequado. Recepção muito boa. Café da manhã bom, gera economia. Limpeza discutível. Certamente merece mais atenção. Elevadores, corredores e lado externo do hotel poderiam ser limpos com mais frequência e zelo. Não é difícil. Se afastou do padrão Marriott. Preço justo e, particularmente, gosto da localização. É possível ter silêncio.

title: Excellent staff!
text: Stayed here for a weekend in 12/19. Room was small but very clean. Great location that is close to Central Park, Rockefeller Center. Subway is a few blocks away. Staff is excellent-very helpful & friendly. Great play to stay.

title: Bon compromis
text:
Agréable hôtel à 10 mn à pieds de Columbus circle.
De petite capacité avec 18 étages dans une rue peu passante.
L’accueil est souriant et agréable.

Les chambres sont de qualité égale au novotel situé sur times square et notre chambre (la 607) avait une baignoire.
Literie confortable comme dans tous les hôtels.

Petit déjeuner très copieux ( quasi continental il manque les viennoiseries pour avoir cette appellation) avec un personnel accueillant et souriant (on remercie la personne avec des nattes qui sait accueillir avec sourire ses clients merci à elle).
Au petit dej vous avez des oeufs sous toutes formes : brouillés, durs...lards ou becon, viande
Des céréales, porridge
Gauffres (à faire soi même )
Bagels, pain céréales, salades fruits frais 
Yaourts
Gâteaux 
Jus de fruits
Café 
Thé 
Chocolat

Dans la salle de bain il y a un mot avec écrit que si nous désirons changer nos serviettes de bien vouloir les laisser par terre. Elles ont été changées tous les jours même sans le demander.
Lits faits tous les jours
Aucun ménage par contre dans la chambre.
Un petit coup d’aspirateur aurait été bienvenu.

Cafetière de courtoisie dans la chambre avec dosettes. Vous devriez la retirer ce n’est pas une cafetière c’est un élément de dinette !!!!! C’est dommage ! Investissez dans de bonnes cafetières ou laissez le café mis à disposition toute la journée à la réception.
Nous partions de très bonne heure le matin pour revenir à 18h00....plus de café mis à disposition à la réception et au bar (pour en acheter bien sûr) ils n’en font pas. Dommage.

Le jour du départ il faut libérer la chambre avant 11h00
Nous avons pu laisser nos bagages toute la journée et revenir au lobby vers 17h00 pour prendre notre taxi.
C’est le quatrième hôtel que nous faisons à New York et bous vous le conseillons pour les points forts suivants :

L’emplacement calme
Ses chambres de qualité (attention petites et sans beaucoup de rangements mais comme dans quasi tous les hôtels de New York )
Son petit déjeuner compris et quantitatif et même qualitatif.

Points négatifs s’il en est
10 mn de marche pour prendre son métro (si vous ne marchez pas à New York vous ratez des choses !)
Pas de ménage.
Rien de bien méchant.

title: Ended the year in our favorite hotel with the best staff !!!
text:
This hotel is perfect , perfect location, perfect price & perfect staff and management . Robert Castano (hotel manager) & Steven at the front desk are both extremely Hospitable & wiling you make your stay the best you can have.  Robert is a true expert in customer service and ensuring all his guests have the way stay possible . 
The location is perfect a hop skip and jump to Columbus circle & Central Park and there are numerous delicious restaurants nearby.. although also be sure to take advantage of the happy hour in the hotel lobby great specials and the bartender is always friendly !!
We have stayed here over a handful of times over the past three years and Each visit is better than the next . We usually stay during peak times and the height of the hotel being at capacity & still the staff is on top of every need. The have a delicious daily breakfast buffet that is opened for a few hours early morning be sure to take care advantage of this as it is certainly worth it !!!
The rooms just as in any hotel in nyc are small yet clean ,new , & contemporary chic!!! 

We Look forward to our next stay here !!!
Thank you Robert and staff for your continued service. !

title: Hotel basico para o que nos habitou a Marca Marriot
text: Hotel muito central, pequeno almoço muito bom e pessoal muito simpático - em especial a equipa do pequeno almoço. Limpeza qb (quarto com manchas na parede), manutenção a desejar (cama com ela solta, casa de banho com porta do chuveiro a desejar reforma, mini bar com barulho de motor permanente), áreas comuns amplas mas um hotel com 18 andares e apenas 2 elevadores super lentos. Acesso ao hotel - umas vez por um lado outras por outro lado ..confuso. PEDIR QUARTO PARA A RUA ... os quartos para trás vão dar a um vão feio e sem claridade.

title: Comfortable and clean, great staff
text: Travelled to New York with a friend for a pre-Christmas weekend. Hotel is further north and west than I would normally choose but is an easy walk to Columbus Circle which has great connections. Room was clean and comfortable but small and lacking in storage space - fine for a long weekend but would be a struggle beyond that. Elevators are the slowest I've ever seen! All of the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful - special mention for the dining room staff - Elizabeth, Lucas and especially Tanae who cooked us fresh sausages five minutes before end of breakfast service

title: Nice hotel
text:
We just spent 2 nights at this hotel...very convenient to my son’s place on 60th.
My son actually made the reservation for us.
We found it very clean. Staff was entirely helpful and friendly. Room was smallish...but had everything we required and clean. We were on the 7th floor...and although the elevators were slow, I don’t think anything more than 4-5 minutes at the worst.
Free breakfast was a bonus. 
All in all, for the price in NYC...it lived up to our expectations.

title: Never again
text:
I will never stay here again. I booked a room with a kitchenette online and paid in advance only to arrive and find out there are no kitchens in the hotel at all. When I called about this, the front desk said I was welcome to switch hotels but I would also lose my payment. So the thought of paying for two hotel rooms during our trip but only using one is less than ideal. As a single mom trying to show her kids NYC on a strict budget I am beyond frustrated. Thanks for taking the magic out of the season Fairfield. 

Otherwise, the accommodations are decent if you don't care about hearing your neighbors through the walls or being close to anything in the city. Also, unless you are an Ambassador level reward member don't expect many pleasantries or any fancy treatment at check-in. We did have to wait for 15 min while the Ambassador member checked in before us and we walked up at the same time.

title: Great stay, friendly staff
text: The staff is outstanding - friendly and efficient. Room was a little noisy, but clean and bed was super comfortable. Breakfast buffet is included which is nice. Go early as it does get very busy. Price was reasonable.

title: Froid/chaud
text:
Séjour début novembre , température extérieure proche de 0 degrés , chambres très froides , chauffages très bruyants . Ménage des chambres , serviettes pas changées tout les jours , il faut 10 bonnes minutes pour atteindre le métro cela peut paraître peu mais après une bonne journée de marche et visite ça compte .
Personnel sympa ,souriant.

title: So Much for Titanium Lifetime Elite and Corporate Travel
text:
The property is fine, the rooms are small, the staff are nice.  My problem - I cut a deal with the hotel for a Corporate Rate at the end of last year.  The rate worked in the system just fine during the 1st 2 quarters of 2019.  It stopped working during the summer months (sporadic at best) and I've had to work to get the rate adjusted to our original agreement.  Three weeks ago it happened again, and after checking, I realized I was charged too much on my previous visit.   I wrote an email to Andrea, my corporate contact asking her to fix the system (a too high rate was showing again) and that I needed a room for the upcoming week.

I got a reply from the Front Office Supervisor the next day indicating he adjusted the bill.  Upon me emailing again about a reservation (1 day back and forth on email) he replied indicating that the hotel was booked solid, but with rain in the forecast there might be a cancellation.  That obviously doesn't work for me.

I booked elsewhere and asked if Andrea had been fired because I hadn't heard from her.  I got a reply from Andrea explaining that she had been very busy, that the problem had only happened a couple of times and that my rate may not have been available (outside of black out dates - which this was not why would that ever happen?)  She then provided a screen shot with my corporate rate coming up with no dates.  She did not address my concern over asking for a room and being told the hotel was sold out.

I replied explaining why this response didn't make sense to me and that I was disappointed.  I asked again about why I was told the hotel was sold out.  That was three weeks ago and I have received no reply.

To whomever may care at Marriott - it matters to me and travelers like me to honor your commitments and instruct your staff to treat ALL customers with respect.  I have an honest and legitimate concern.  While my overcharge refund was made, I was otherwise not taken seriously or treated with care.

You material re: my Lifetime Titanium Elite Status seems to indicate that you value my loyalty and patronage.  Your service during this incident shows the opposite.

title: First time in NYC - Fantastic hotel would recommend!
text:
My partner and I stayed here for 5 nights and booked through Expedia. 

Location - The hotel is in a decent location and is easily accessible to midtown by foot. The subway is two blocks away which is perfect for people who don’t like a lot of walking whereas we are walkers and we did lots. We found the location no problem.

Room - The room was cosy, clean, quiet, comfortable and modern. However there wasn’t a lot of storage to unpack clothes- which isn’t always a bad thing. It would have also been good if there was a plug socket next to the long standing mirror rather than just than the bathroom for hair drying. For us that’s a safety feature. However all in all, the room was suitable. A simple, inexpensive fix to storage would be to put some hooks on the wall for coats, bags etc. 

Breakfast - Scattered around the hotel there is a traffic light system of the times of when breakfast is busiest, we really liked this. 
There was a range of different choices from fruit, cereals, waffles and cooked breakfast. It was self service which was great and the quality of the food was very good and tasty. It was great to see fresh fruit. The only feedback would be to consider recycling and segregate plastic and cardboard. This is big in the UK but not sure in the USA. 

Overall we were very impressed. Great value for money combined with first class service from the moment we arrived to end of our stay. I would recommend anyone looking at this hotel to consider as its competitive on pricing and having breakfast buffet included saves time and money. 

A special mention goes to Ashley for making us feel welcome and especially Robert who went the extra mile more than once for us. Both are great assets to the hotel.

title: Great property with friendly service and awesome features
text:
This newish property is very clean & quiet.  It has friendly staff everywhere - at the front desk, at the breakfast buffet, and among the service staff.  The rooms are spacious (especially for NYC) and the hard-surface floor is kept very clean.

Special kudos to Robert and the front desk staff for providing early check-in so that my family can do a quick clean-up prior to our sight-seeing day in Manhattan!

Quick tip: the Hudson Market is located ~1 block away and it is staffed with fresh, high-quality food.

title: Right Price for Midtown Manhattan
text: Price is right.  Not a bad walk to Central park, close to Hell's Kitchen.  Breakfast buffet better than average for an included buffet.  Small bar area.  Room size decent for Midtown.  Overall property clean and staff is friendly.

title: Horrible
text:
First the good. Barbara the bartender was fantastic. Done.
Arrived a hour and a half past when you could begin to check in.  No rooms ready! We had limited time to get ready head to dinner and a show. So he finally finds a first floor room which we took because we were only staying one night. Is it noisy we asked? No he told us. Lie. Doors slamming all night long. Room is the size of a walk in closet for almost 400 a night. The heat sounded like a jet engine when it turned on with a metallic vibration. Room was dirty. Shower floor was disgusting.  Thank goodness it was only one night. Would never come back.

title: short stay...highly recommend
text: stayed here only one night, prior to a cruise departure...we had connecting rooms which is wonderful for a family...the room was small but very comfortable...nice bedding...but the kicker/best part was the brunch the next morning...the staff was so nice, singing happy birthday, calling my 5 year old granddaughter 'princess', making her feel so special...the food was great, much better than the usual continental breakfast...make your own waffles, 2 rows of hot options, breads and fruits...

title: Decent location to explore New York City
text: Decent location to explore New York City. Price is reasonable for the location, keeping in view includes a great breakfast. Rooms are comfortable as long as you don't spend too long in them, as space is tight (family of four in 2 good sized beds), but you are not in New York to watch TV in your room all day!

title: Elendig beliggenhed, små værelser, morgenmad i kælderen på paptallerkener
text: hotellet har en virkelig dårlig beliggenhed - der er kun den klassiske Starbucks og et pizzaria i nærheden. Værelserne er små og man skal være heldig hvis de bliver gjort rent hver dag, morgenmaden er ok men indtages i kælderen i et meget støjfyldt lokale. Det er buffet og alt service er pap og plastik. Ikke spor miljøvenligt. Her vil jeg aldrig bo igen.

title: Clean, quiet, small room, good location and reasonable rates for the city.
text: We stayed here for a week and found the location excellent for attending the Met Opera at Lincoln Square. The walk was easy and safe, even late at night. Our room was clean and had an excellent shower. Staff were very friendly and courteous. Numerous restaurants are within a short walk as is the subway. Breakfast is on par with this class of hotels (reconstituted eggs) but not the best we have had at a Fairfield Inn. The breakfast room has sufficient seating and helpful staff. The rooms are small with insufficient space for unpacking---no drawers and less than a 12 inch closet. This is an issue for a long stay and requires piling clothes on every available space. Several days are rooms were not made up until after 4 PM changing our preopera dinner plans. Only 2 elevators service the hotel and wait times can be long. Wi-Fi was good but required signing on every 24 hours. A real plus is not having the resort or facility fee that so many NYC hotels have as an add on.

title: Despite the fact
text:
it's a concrete box on a soulless block--think BMW repair shop and John Jay College as neighbors without a single house and, despite the name, a hike from Central Park--the place grows on you until you feed quite fond of it.   

Front desk staff is unfailingly cheerful and efficient at all hours of day and night, the breakfast ladies seem to like their gig, as does the manager.  Computer and printer in lobby actually work!  The window blind blocks out the light so it's dark when you want to sleep. Rooms a smidge bigger than the average NY hotel room with good linens.   Room doors heavy and bang when closed, so can be noisy.   The slow elevator didn't bother me, I took the stairs.   Hotel is super convenient to Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center,  theater district, or if you're a guest on CBS.  I met two, one who had just come off the air, one heading for a taping.

title: Looks new and clean. Smaller room. Close to subway.
text: If you are alone or Max 2 people, the standard rooms are just right. They are quite compact but the rooms look new in design and clean. The building is actually not so visible at the first reach due to its higher buildings next to it. Elevator is slow I think and the breakfast area is not so big. Walking distance to Columbus Square sub and quite convenient to walk to. Good values if you wanna stay close to mid Manhattan.

title: Great stat
text:
Check in staff member was very friendly. 

Breakfast was a surprisingly good spread and good seating for the number of people. 

Location was fantastic for dining at Columbus Circle. I walked back to the hotel at night and it was a pleasant walk back. 

Elevators a bit of a pain but nothing that held me up. 

Room was clean and comfortable. I am a light sleeper and found it to be very quiet. 

Check out was quick and easy. As were Uber pick ups from the front entrance. 

I had a very favorable rate even though I booked last minute and would say it was excellent value for money. 

Would stay again.

title: Good location near Lincoln Center
text: Good location, not too far a walk from Lincoln Center, which is why we chose it.  Safe location, friendly staff, decent bar downstairs, comfortable room.  Would stay again if we wanted to be in this part of town.

title: Lots of good attributes but one really bad attribute.
text:
This was my first stay at this location. The positives are:  1.  excellent location. This is a great location if you were going to something at the Lincoln center such as the opera. It is only about a quarter of a mile and an easy walk to Lincoln Center. There are also many places to eat within walking distance. It’s not very busy  around here at night but I still felt safe walking back by myself after the opera. 2.  the staff is very friendly and very helpful. Every staff member was enthusiastic and went above and beyond to help with anything I might need. 3.  The room is small and tight but it is clean and has a coffee maker and a refrigerator, and clock.  4.   The fitness center is good. There are a couple of treadmills, a bike, and elliptical, and free weights. 

Negatives:   There is one big negative to this location and that is the elevator situation. This is an 18 story hotel and they have two extremely slow elevators that serve the entire building. It is really a ridiculous situation and something all the guests talk about. I got on the elevator this morning on the ninth floor and by the time I got to the lobby I seriously forgot what I was going down for. It’s a huge negative and one that actually could prevent me from staying here again. I don’t like having to take 15 minutes to just go down and get a cup of coffee. I think the only workaround is to request a room on one of the bottom two floors so that I could walk up and down the stairways. Another negative as there are no ice machines in the building. If you want ice you can call down to the front desk and they will send a bag up to your room or you can ask at the front desk and they will go get you a coffee cup full of ice from the breakfast area.

title: Hotel executivos ou excursões
text:
Localização mediana.
