Equipe da recepção super cordial, no entanto solicitamos late check out e a recepcionista prontamente nos atendeu e falou que poderíamos ficar até 4pm, no dia seguinte eu chequei com ela se estava tudo ok, e ela me confirmou que poderíamos ficar até as 4pm, no entanto no dia do check out fomos expulsas do quarto as 3pm, pois falaram que não havia late check out e se não saíssemos do quarto iriam nos cobrar. 
Foi uma situação muito constrangedora e desagradável, pois tivemos a preocupação de checar 2 vezes com a moça da recepção, justamente para não termos nenhum inconveniente, no entanto fomos expulsas do quarto e a senhora, acredito que gerente, foi extremamente grossa, pois ela deu entender que estávamos mentindo.  
Tivemos que sair às pressas do quarto e ainda nem estávamos prontas...
Limpeza ruim, acredito que só trocam a toalha e limpam o banheiro, não limpam o chão do quarto e muito menos tiram o pó. 
Quarto pequeno, mas já sabíamos. 
Café da manhã básico, mas parece que a comida vai acabar, pessoas desesperadas para comer, sinceramente prefiro gastar U$ 6,00 e comer um croissant com expresso machiatto no Starbucks. 
Elevador demorado, principalmente no horário do café da manhã, tem que usar a escada. 
Não voltaríamos.

Here for my sisters birthday. I
Love this place it is clean. It is close to everything and staff is helpful with directions. Great breakfast. Broadway is just a few steps away and public transportation it out the door.

title: Ótima localização. Café com tudo que é necessário. Staff super eficiente e acolhedor.
text:
Ótima localização, Whole Foods próximo, pizzaria Justino’s, Central Park e um excelente shopping. Rua sossegada e segura. 
Staff super educado e solícito. Fomos super bem tratados. Quarto limpo, banheiro muito bom, somente trocaria a porta por uma de correr para ganhar espaço. 
Com certeza voltaremos.

title: Front desk staff not very enthusiastic
text: I've stayed here on several occasions and my last visit was disappointing. When I tried to check in, the staff was busy on their phone. I was not recognized as a Titanium member and offered one small bottle of water. My card key did not work properly when trying to access the door leading to the elevators and the person at the bar who let me in told me many people have this issue (so, not sure why this is not fixed). I was given a room on a low floor facing the street and there was the sound of garbage trucks from the evening to early morning, which did not allow me to get a good night's sleep. I did go back downstairs to ask fro extra water and the clerk on the night shift was quite nice sand went to the back to get me a couple of bottles of water and apologized on behalf of his associate who checked me in. The hotel is quite a hike from transportation and 58th St. between 10th and 11th avenues where this hotel is located is not well lit, so I would suggest late night revelers to be careful when returning to the hotel at off-hours. I'm not sure I'll go back following this experience as stay loyal to the Bonvoy brand, but feel like they don't really care about my business.

title: Nice hotel
text:
We stayed here for a week and for the most enjoyed our stay. The hotel was clean and because it’s not right on a main road there is not a lot of street noise. The front desk staff were very attentive and helpful. The only negatives were 
1.the slowness of the elevators which often resulted in having to go by stairs if you didn’t want to wait 10 minutes. 
2. Breakfast is served very early. Closes at 9 am promptly. 9.30 on weekends. 

I must add though that the breakfasts were very good with something for everyone. 

I would definitely stay here again.

title: Ótima localização!!!
text:
Muito bem atendido pelos funcionários, quartos modernos e confortáveis, dá pra fazer mta coisa caminhando e além disso fica próximo do metrô.
O café da manhã é excelente!!
Recomendo mto e me hospedaria lá novamente sem dúvida alguma.

title: Ottima location...per il resto niente di che!!!
text: Sicuramente questo hotel gode di una buona location...centrale, così da poter raggiungere tutti i punti più importanti di Manhattan facilmente. Le camere sono molto piccole e soprattutto senza armadio. Colazione: nulla di esaltante. Nella media un Buon Hotel...

title: Located close to the Nerve-center of Manhattan in solitude
text: Hotel par excellence, on 58th street beyond the 10th Avenue and in total solitude... though ten minutes away from Broadway and Columbus Circle and the buzzword in town - Times Square... wall down beyond 11th avenue downhill from hotspot and you reach the Hudson Bay and the Piers Park.... perfect localities to explore Manhattan and be in peace with this urban focal point

title: Fantastic Employees and Hospitality; Hotel itself needs WORK
text:
Please note: No one asked or suggested I write this review. 

Service: I stayed here last week and found the employees at the front desk to be very kind, generous and incredibly friendly. They were absolutely terrific and should run a class on hospitality - no joke. They were even able to provide me with a loaner umbrella to get to my meeting. Thank you all very much again!

Hotel: That said, the hotel itself was dirty. There were ants in the lobby all over the floor near the window, there was a storm and water got in somehow and was all over the floor of the bar area one night and the rooms were a bit grimy with some stains on the walls.  Sheets and bathroom were clean but I think Marriott needs to give this place a good scrubbing all over and get it up to Marriott NYC standards. I won't likely be staying here again because it was dirty.

title: Great hotel/great location
text: We were there during the 4-hour blackout and the staff were more than helpful.   The location is great, with Central Park only a few blocks away.   Yes, the elevators were extremely slow, but it did not take away from the quality of my stay there.

title: Average Hotel, Extremely Slow Elevator
text: Stayed at this hotel for 5 nights, rooms were clean with comfortable beds. Breakfast provided was good quality however there is always a morning rush between 8:30-9AM which makes it unenjoyable to eat or get the food you want. One thing for me that was a huge deal breaker for this hotel was the elevator. It is EXTREMELY slow. The hotel has 18 floors I believe, with only 2 small elevators. Every day my trip down to the main lobby or for breakfast would take 10 minutes. I was staying on the 9th floor and was forced to take the stairs many mornings as it was significantly faster. I realize this is a small thing, but when you are at this hotel for a few nights the elevator makes a huge difference. Would not stay here again solely because of the elevator. Additionally, the area isn't that great, I found you had to walk 2-3 blocks away to get closer to shops/restaurants.

title: Won’t stay on 18th floor again
text:
As repeat customers (our daughter lives close by), they gave us a first floor room. My husband does not like to hear folks about us and asked for a higher floor. While the view was really nice, we knew elevators here can be slow. We did not anticipate one being broken and out of service over the weekend. Folks on the 14th floor were walking down as it was faster. 

Btw we looked at the mobility impaired rooms for a future stay. They are the same size but missing the desk so a wheelchair can enter. So the frig sits on the floor with the coffeemaker on top. See pics.

title: Friendly staff but subpar service
text:
Front desk staff are generally friendly and approachable, but others are much less so, and often look at you as if you are a nuisance.

Service is extremely slow, despite us calling ahead saying we would arrive at 3pm (check in time), our rooms were not ready until 4:30pm as they "hadn't been cleaned" yet. Everyone else who checked in after us were immediately given room keys. The elevators are a particular low point, as they only have two that are very slow and take a long time to get anywhere or even open the doors, so it's lucky we were on the second floor and could avoid them.

title: Great service and good location
text:
First the downsides The rooms rather small but to be frank that doesn't really matter as one is only there to sleep and shower before doing the tourist thing. 

Upsides are many: Location is very good - 7 minute walk to Columbus Circle Subway. 10 minutes to Central Park. Close to usual array of restaurants and bars from 24 hr diners to upmarket eateries. Took my teenage children to Dizzy's jazz club at the Lincoln - they loved it. 15 - 20 minutes stroll to Times Sq district.
Breakfast was complimentary - standard US fare but the children loved making waffles, and it beats some hotels where breakfast is to be paid for.
Room was clean and beds were comfy. WiFi very good and reliable unlike some hotels we have stayed at.
Best aspect was the service which was very good. Our bags didn't arrive - front desk helped with emergency toiletries and advised where to get cheap clothes/underwear/"stuff" before our bags did arrive. They also helped by chasing the airline on our behalf. Advised on local restaurants for late night eats and sorted out our transport back to the airport. Nothing out of the ordinary but all done efficiently and with a smile on their face. Don't like to pick out individuals but Daniel on the night desk was a star! 

Children were very happy during our stay there (5 nights in total) . Pleased to recommend and would happily return!

title: Average hotel
text:
We stayed 5 nights here. The room was fine except the air con was too loud to sleep with so we had to keep it off and sleep hotter than we would have liked.

Housekeeping tended to come reasonably early and if you asked for 30 minutes they tended not to return until around 5pm which was inconvenient as you tended to be relaxing before dinner. On the fourth day they didn’t come back at all and just offered us towels later. 

The breakfast was fine, hot food and cold options. Super busy though.

The 2 elevators definitely were not enough for the number of people staying and had constant long waits every time. We ended up walking 6 flights of stairs up and down a lot and saw mAny other customers doing the same. 

Average hotel and ok for the price.

title: Don't overlook this hotel - it's a "sleeper"
text: Next to Central Park?  Close but not across the street (e.g., Essex or Plaza hotels).  A few blocks away.  But there is a lot to like.  Close to Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center, Mt. Sinai Hospital West.  Nearby upscale food stores, dining of all levels.  Probably overlooked is an easy walk to the Hudson River and walkways and paths for miles.  Hotel rooms are small, compact and adequate.  Best of all inside room was quiet.  Actually very quiet.  That's a plus for New York City.  Very easy walk to Columbus Circle subway stop.  Complimentary breakfast with numerous selections is bountiful.  Plenty of families and tourists in the hotel.  Gym is small, probably good for a handful of quests; never observed more than a few guests at a time.  This is not a Ritz Carlton.  Guests don't pay Ritz room prices.  Very affordable for NYC.  Small bar/lounge area.  Unique among this hotel property is the staff.  Incredibly helpful and friendly.  Oh, it's probably a 15-20 minute walk to Central Park.  Fairfield Inn - Manhatten - sure.  Central Park - close.

title: Reasonable price. Location not so much.
text: We wanted a hotel closer to Columbus Circle but it is really not all that close.  Reasonably priced for NYC.  Clean, modern, small rooms to be expected. Quiet. Typical breakfast, fine for families, not so crowded at the earlier times. Slow elevators (we were on the 12th floor and once waited 20 min).  Arrived a bit early and our room was not ready due to late departures which Mariott has to accommodate but the front desk quite apologetic and nice about it. Bar in the lobby. I probably would not choose this Fairfield again as there is a hill around 10th St which was a bit challenging with luggage and the closest subway is at Columbus circle. Also, free internet was sloooow.

title: Good but fix the elevators!
text: Great location and the staff are very solicitous. Shoebox sizes rooms with minimal amenities. But if you are here to see the sites or visit with family, the hotel is perfect. The rooms are clean, the lobby needs updating, the complimentary breakfast is bountiful and well attended (get there early), HOWEVER, be prepared to wait and wait and wait for the elevators. There are only two and one of them was out of order for most of our trip. Thank goodness the emergency staircase is clean and well lit!

title: Off the main road, quiet...well staffed!
text:
I was thrown off by the "name" of the hotel...I had visions of looking out my window and seeing Central Park, but instead, it was a good 9-10 "normal" blocks (3 avenue blocks, NY style...which means the equivalent to about 3 "normal" ones) away.  In the end, this was fine, as it was quiet and away from the hustle and bustle of NYC.  Easy to walk to the bus line if you're going east/west as well as north/south (don't knock the buses until you try them!), and Central Park starts just across from Columbus Circle, which is where you pick up the subway.

The front desk staff was friendly, courteous, and full of info!  Steven got us a nice "car" to the airport instead of us taking a taxi, and it ended up being less, and a much more comfortable ride (big SUV...we felt important!).  Barbara, the bartender was very sweet, and did a great job keeping up with the busyness of the folks that were there for another conference.

My only disappointment was with the housekeeping staff.  I'd left a note and a tip to get more washcloths, and nothing was left.  In addition, they didn't leave an extra roll of toilet paper (which I had to call down for, as we were almost out), nor did they check the tissue.  My recommendation would be to call down and let the front desk know, as I don't think the housekeeping staff could read English, nor converse well (I speak Spanish, but it seemed that our housekeeper spoke something else).

The price was right, too, especially for NYC.  Next time I come out, I'll definitely look them up again!

title: Lots good, some bad
text: Fairfield is very conveniently located at the top of Hell's Kitchen neighborhood near the southwest entrance to central park.  Hotel is very clean and staff were friendly and helpful.  Breakfast is included and is very good.  Hotel does not have parking garage, but has an agreement with nearby lot, and its quite expensive.  Entrance is below street level, so handling luggage can be a problem. Rooms are tiny and have very limited closet and storage space.

title: Great Stay
text: My friend and I visited NYC this past weekend and stayed here and this made our trip great.  We had lots planned so this was a place to sleep but it was more than that. We were so comfortable in our room and the hotel itself.  It was a safe, comfortable place.  The rooms were clean, beds were comfy and the staff was friendly and helpful.  I would stay again.  Location was really convenient for us as well.

title: Great location and Great staff
text: This is a great location near Central Park and the Columbus Circle subway.  The hotel staff is wonderful start to finish.  Housekeeping could use a boost but any mention of needs is quickly tended. No matter what you need, the staff will see to it!

title: OVERALL ALWAYS A GREAT EXPERIENCE!
text: I always stay at this hotel whether it’s for work or I’m traveling with my family to the city. They never disappoint! From the moment you walk in, always a welcoming greeting and it’s an overall enjoyable stay! Rooms are cleaned, breakfast is delicious and friendly staff every time!

title: Friendly staff
text: The staff at this hotel are as friendly as they come. From the moment I walked in, they were accommodating me with the best room for my needs, so I could get right to work in the morning. The bartenders were attentive, sweet and fast with service. The breakfast attendants made the experience very relaxed and enjoyable. They were awake and working early and seemed to love their job and loved serving others. One even said “we are here for you”. There was always someone at the door greeting and saying hello, and the supervisor at the front desk was also extremely accommodating. Thank you for such a pleasant experience. I’ll be back.

title: Great Value, Nice Staff, Cleam
text: Location was a bit far, we had to walk 3 blocks to get to the subway so that was a minus plus it sits on a hill and I am 7 months pregnant. The rooms were super clean, elevators took a while, but that is ok. You have a great staff who was super friendly, breakfast was great, room was super clean, front desk people were always kind with a smile on their face. I highly recommend this place.

title: Disappointed
text: We visited this hotel for St George graduation. When we walked in the room we were shocked at the size. There were 2 beds with very little room in between or at the foot.  There was no where to put your luggage out of the way.  The closet was tiny and there were no drawers.  The room did have a safe, fridge and nice view.  The A.C. worked good.  The elevators were horrible and required long waits.  This needs addressing.  The staff at the front were great but the cleaning staff was not.  They would take towels and not replace.  This hotel was close to several things within walking distance.  We would not stay here again.

title: You'll get what you expect...if you don't expect much!
text:
This is the definition of a no-frills hotel. Bare minimum drawer, surface and closet space. One chair in room.  super narrow closet,no lid on toilet, allowing items from overhanging shelves to plop into bowl,small refrigerator...did have electronic remote controlled shade (in accessible room).Reminded us of one of the typically tiny and sparse Paris hotels. 
Dark depressing corridors, ridiculously long wait for elevator. Inconvenient access to ground floor elevator which requires room key to enter through one door. Difficult to unload luggage on arrival or departure since no easy car access to main door for check in. Must park illegally on street. Busy outdoor bar and lounge scene. Ok breakfast but long lines if you're not down when breakfast is put out. Friendly, accommodating staff--shout out to Daniel at front desk--and good location snd reasonable rate doesn't make up for serious shortcomings of this property. Not one of Marriott's finest. Also, no "suites" in this Fairfield Suites hotel! Because of modest price and location, it's passable for a one or two night stay.

title: Ruhig, Sauber, gutes Frühstück
text:
Unseren vierten NYC Aufenthalt wollten wir ruhiger angehen, daher entschieden wir uns für ein Hotel in der Nähe de Central Park. Wir fanden die Zimmer sauber, es gab keinen Teppich, das finden wir hygienischer! Das inkludierte Frühstück war super, es gab alles (ausser Scheibenkäse oder Wurst). Auch das war ein Grund für die Buchung. Mit Lyft haben wir 40 Minuten bis zum Flughafen LGA sowie Newark gebraucht und circa 48 Dollar bezahlt. 
Die Damen und Herren vom Front Desk haben uns immer Tipps gegeben, wie wir schnell von A nach B kommen. 
Das Restaurant/die Bar nutzten wir nicht. Das Essen sah aber immer sehr gut aus.
Wir würden hier wieder buchen.

title: Good hotel, convenient for Lincoln Center, but with worst elevators ever seen!!
text:
We stayed for nine nights as we were in New York for the Wagner Ring Cycle at the Metropolitan Opera - very convenient as the Lincoln Center is only a ten minute walk away.
The rooms are reasonable and the bed comfortable - though the room is obviously designed for short stays only, as the wardrobe space is inadequate, there are no drawers and very little space for hanging and storing clothes.
The breakfast choices are good and plentiful - though what a waste as all the plates, cups and bowls are paper, and all the cutlery and glasses are plastic - and everything just thrown away.
Unlike other reviewers we were disappointed with the room cleaning - sometimes not done until very late in the day, towels left on the floor, one day the towels were taken away and not replaced, the bathroom floor was rarely washed and was quite dirty by the end of our stay.
And as has been said by others, the elevators have to be the worst possible. Every journey is painfully slow, the doors take ages to open and close, and the programming is awful. So we spent a long time waiting. You really need to do something about this!
Another poor design fault is at the main entrance - where there are steps down from the road. Every time it rains they have to tie yellow tape across the stairs to prevent you from using them - you then need to take the slope down nearby.
But the staff are all very friendly and helpful, and, despite what I say above, we did enjoy our stay there. If you stay here, ask if they have improved the elevators - if not, ask for floors 1 to 4 and take the stairs.

title: Elevators need to be fixed
text:
The rooms are really small but clean and comfortable.  The elevators (only 2) are a nightmare!! They definitely need to do something about it never seen elevators so slow!!!
Please note that breakfast closes at 9h30 even on weekends

title: Good Deal Well Run
text: I stayed here for 6 days recently.  I must say that for a value hotel, they are doing a lot of things right here. The place is clean, the hotel is very well staffed with friendly employees, the rooms get cleaned right away in the morning (something I like, and other more luxury brands can't seem to do).  For it's location, price point and amenities, this is a really good choice for a NYC stay.  It's two long blocks (Avenue blocks not street blocks) away from the Columbus Circle subway stop, and convenient to Central Park, though not on the park.  Do yourself a favor and stay here, away from the craziness of Times Square, which you can get to easily from this location.  For families and business travelers, this hotel is a good value.

title: Puflandia
text:
Manhattan è bella e cara..
Nonostante la mia età e la mia esperienza nei viaggi mi faccio fregare dalla colazione compresa nel prezzo della camera che mi fa preferire e prenotare questo hotel dall’Italia prima di partire.
In realtà gli alberghi delle grandi catene tendono ad assicurare degli standard qualitativi buoni ma sono anche estremamente MEDI.
~La colazione (discreta) era sempre la stessa, senza variazioni o modifiche nell’arco di tutti i 9 giorni
~La camera non era piccola...di più! Posto una foto del l’armadio che tra l’altro contiene un asse da stiro!!
~Le zone comuni sono molto piccole solo nell’ingresso
Bar scarso

title: Great location and friendly staff
text: We had tickets for two Broadway shows (The Lion King and My Fair Lady). This Fairfield Inn, at 538 W 58th St., allowed us to get to both theatres on foot. More so, we were able to walk through Central Park to get to museums. Nearby, we were able to get breakfast and dinner. When our ''transport" from the hotel to the airport was late, the staff helped us track it (needed wi-fi) although we had checked out.

title: Everything you need
text: I realize the Fairfield is a utilitarian hotel but this is a new one.  In NYC most rooms are small and the ones here are no exception.  But they have hard wood like floors and new fixtures. We stayed on the 15th floor so it was super quiet.  Plus, out room looked out on the fields from the John Jay School of Justice.  It really was a terrific view.  We didn't use the fitness center but it looked nice with relatively new equipment.  Breakfast was good and even being in the basement is was a nice space.  The staff was super.

title: Ottimo!
text: Dopo varie ricerche su internet tramite Expedia ho optato per questa struttura che mi offriva una buona location, Wi-Fi in camera e la colazione (cosa rara a NYC) inclusa.....il tutto ad un buon prezzo. La struttura e’ in una strada tranquilla e comoda alla metro e per muoversi ovunque a piedi. Il Wi-Fi funziona benissimo.  La colazione e’ varia ed abbondante (mi è piaciuto molto il fatto che c’era frutta fresca). Il personale e’ molto sorridente e disponibile. Le camere sono piccole ma funzionali e dotate di tutto il necessario ma soprattutto va detto che senza moquette e’ davvero un grande pregio. Il bagno e’ moderno con una bellissima doccia ed i prodotti da toilette di Paul Mitchell molto apprezzati! Il giorno della partenza, dopo il check out, mi hanno tenuto le valigie in custodia fino a tardo pomeriggio senza alcun costo aggiuntivo. Il servizio di trasporto per l’aeroporto che mi hanno consigliato per l’aeroporto (auto privata) pareggiava il costo di Uber quindi onesti. L’unico neo: il pavimento della sala da colazione era un po’ appiccicoso già alle 7 del mattino. Altri difetti non ne ho trovati! Per il resto lo consiglio vivamente.

title: Good hotel with perfect location
text: The staff was friendly. The elevator seems to be a only blip in this hotel. The breakfast was good. Staff was very cooperative. Since I was vegetarian she made extra effort for us to get sofa patties. Bar in the hotel was OK. The location is perfect. 5 min from Central Park and 15 min walk from times square. There are large number of eateries around the hotel. The fitness centre is ok. There are small grocery shops selling all items you need. Room was comfortable. Only suggestions I have change elevator and have some bell boy to carry luggage.

title: Nice, convenient location
text: The staff were extremely friendly.  It truly set the tone for my stay.  I arrived before check in but was told by the front desk person that if I wanted to wait 15 minutes in the lobby. I might be able to get into my room early and sure enough I did. The next morning that sesame level of friendly service was there at checkout.

title: SOX/YANKEES
text: Took the 2 little ones on a baseball road trip. I just recently started staying at Fairfield inn when I travel with kids because I really enjoy free breakfast that comes with it. Well I really picked a good one in this place. Pretty rough ride by time I arrived but Robert at check in was so relaxing and nice. He says hey you made it now its time to relax. He showed me parking garage is right next door and told me you can either unload now or go to garage. NO RUSH!  Then he tells me we have no more double beds that you requested but I went ahead and gave you 2 rooms next to each other. Boy was this a treat! I felt like saying Robert I am used to sleeping on the floor but this was great after a long ride. This hotel was perfectly located. That night made 15 minute walk to Time Square. In the morning the breakfast was awesome everything you could want and good to. We checked out in the morning and put our bags in storage and hiked around Central Park 5 minutes away.I think it was Stephan that took care of our bags.  Place was spotless and rooms were perfect.  Thanks for a great stay.

title: Nice
text: The elevator situation is a reality. I don't understand how you have to wait 10 minutes to use an elevator. But price was right, rooms are small, location is convenient and front desk staff are outstanding. It is a Fairfield Inn; if you are looking for luxury and full service, this is not the place. If you are on a budget and looking for price/quality relation in NYC; this is definitely a good choice. Robert at the front desk; the best!! Ask for him if you need help!!

title: Disappointed
text: Biggest issue is the lack of elevators—only two and they are slow.  We waited 10 minutes for one going down and when it finally came, there was no room for us.  We had to take one going up to finally get to the lobby.  Rooms are fine, but very small.  However, the room was clean.  One plus is the staff.  They are first rate.

title: There are better options
text:
Stayed here for 2 nights. Definitely won’t return. I’m not saying it is the worst place I’ve ever stayed. But there are far better options - even at the same price point. 

Had a room with two beds. The fact that they tried to cram 2 beds into that room was laughable. The AC in the room the first night didn’t work well, and it was a hot, uncomfortable sleep. I called down, but was told there were no other rooms and nothing they could do about it. The room itself wasn’t completely clean - hair in the bathroom upon check in, and some general dirtiness on the desk/only place you could place your suitcase. The elevator takes FOREVER during peak times. I never had a full set of toiletries in the room despite calling down. Hotel staff was hit or miss. 

Was it the worst place I’ve ever stayed? No. But you can find much better hotels for the same price in the area.

title: Lovely hotel
text: I am staying at this hotel as we speak.  It is very nice...great buffet breakfast, bar, nice staff and I recommend it with one condition...it is inappropriately called FI Central Park and it is at least 4 long NYC blocks to central park..much nearer to Hudson river.  There is no subway station or bus stop without a several block walk.  Mt.Sinea hospital is in the next block which is very convenient.  Just so you know!!

title: Staff
text: Stayed for 5 nights at the end of March / start April and must say that we had a great time. The staff were lovely and very helpful. The room was small but alright for two people Location was a little walk to subway about 5/7 min we had the 7 day metro pass cost 32 dollars but well worth it.Anyway would stay at Hotel again if in New York. Thanks to all STAFF.

title: hotel bien situé
text:
hotel très bien situé pour visiter new york
literie parfaite chambre au calme seul bémol climatisation bruyante mais possibilité de l'arrêter manuellement
bonne insonorisation entre les chambres
petit déjeuner copieux sucré salé 
couverts en carton et plastique sans recyclage
personnel dévoué et sympathique
pas de possibilité de diner

title: A welcoming stay
text:
Was booked in via my Travel Consultant who searched for great deals for me - knowing I wanted somewhere close to the hub of New York but far enough away not to be noisy - this was perfect. Just a 5 or six minute gentle walk from Columbus Circle from where I could walk into Times Sq to the right or Central Park to the left - or straight on to 5th Avenue for shopping or jump onto the subway and for $3 single ride -get to most places I wanted.

Each day the front desk team were welcoming, knew my name, asked how my day was planned/had been and happily researched stuff I needed to know online for me. 

Was booked Bed & Breakfast and that was a new experience for me in New York - breakfast was plentiful, self service buffet with everything hot & fresh - the Waffle Machines were a new experience for me - had to try one ! Om Nom Nom - they had a helpful "traffic light" style warning in the elevators warning of the expected busy times for breakfast each day - but even when it was busy, I never had to wait long and food was continually replenished hot and fresh.

Reception bar team were great and when I popped back on the Wednesday it was apparently "Customer Appreciation Day" so a free beer was handed to me - local brew - nice and refreshing - Thanks

title: Ótimo hotel e localização muito boa
text: Hotel novo, a quatro quadras da estação de metrô da Columbus Circle. Equipe de atendimento muito atenciosa, quarto pequeno, mas ótimo, limpo, cama muito confortáve, chuveiro excelente (com box e sem cortina ou banheira!), amenities e ótimo secador de cabelo. Tem cafeteira e chá no quarto. Possui café da manhã bem americano, inclui ovos mexidos, frutas, bacon, chá, café, chocolate, iougurte, waffle e pães. Não curto os sucos, pois são todos artificiais, se fossem naturais ajudaria muito. No check-in bloqueiam 20 dólares por dia no cartão e desbloqueiam no check-out, achei super razoável se comparado a outros hotéis. Tem wi-fi free muito bom. Bem na esquina fica o restaurante The Greek Kitchen, não deixem de conhecer, pratos ótimos, bem setvidos e barato. Nas proximidades tem mercado, farmácia CVS, Starbucks. Com certeza indico e ficaria novamente.

title: Bon séjour !
text: J’ai passé un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel. Personnel prêt à rendre service. Hôtel propre et bien situé même s’il faut marcher un peu pour le métro Columbus Circle qui dessert tout plein de ligne. Au choix : jogging à Centralpark qui est à proximité ou dans la salle de fitness au sous-sol de l’établissement. Petit déjeuner varié et de bonne qualité. Je le recommande et reviendrais.

title: Não me hospedarei novamente
text:
Reservei o hotel por ter conhecido um outro da mesma bandeira em New Orleans em janeiro deste ano.
Mas este de NY e muito diferente para pior
Fica a 4 quadras do Shopping Columbus . Hotel lotado com muito movimento 
Os quartos são minúsculos com 1 única porta de armário.
Aconteceram alguns fatos bem desagradáveis durante minha estadia: nos colocaram em um quarto que já sabiam estar com problema no aquecimento e me hospedei em dias de temperatura negativa. Dava para ver um “conserto” com papel alumínio dentro da calefação. Depois de reclamar 2 vezes tivemos de mudar de quarto a 1 da manhã porque não dava para dormir. Deviam ter interditado o quarto.
Em um dos dias a camareira” esqueceu “ de limpar meu quarto quando cheguei e reclamei me disseram que não daria para fazer nada porque o pessoal já havia ido embora: ou seja, virou um problema MEU! 
E mais: em outro dia cheguei a porta do meu quarto estava aberta : fui reclamar e me disseram que foi erro da camareira que não viu que a porta não tinha travado: nada foi furtado mas me gerou insegurança com os procedimentos do hotel
Depois de tudo isso, ou seja cariosa erros na minha estadia, não houve nenhuma preocupação do hotel em desculpar -se
No dia do check out pedi Apenas 1 hora de extensão ( ao invés de sair às 11 sair ao meio dia) e me foi negado!!! Depois de tudo que passei lá me negaram esse simples pedido e mais: faltando 10 minutos para as 11 estavam batendo na porta para que eu saísse
Quer dizer: o hotel e contra os hóspedes, fiquei com péssima impressão e não
Voltarei

title: pratique
text: hôtel un peu éloigné du métro Colombus Circus mais faisable en 10 mn a pieds, peu d'endroit pour diner, c'est dommage, prenez une chambre sur cours, vue pas jolie mais plus calme que sur la rue, ascenseur un peu long à obtenir, petit déjeuner un peu bruyant, et manque d'aération pour profiter de cet instant

title: Gute Lage, freundliches Personal
text: Wir verbrachten 5 Tage/Nächte im Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhatten/Central Park und waren sehr zufrieden. Das Hotel besticht durch seine Lage (Time Square 10 Min. / Subway Columbus Circle und Central Park 7 Min. zu Fuß entfernt). Von hier aus kann man locker zu Fuß bis zum Rockefeller Center, oder quer durch den Central Park zum Met Museum gehen. Das Frühstück war leider nicht besonders, aber kein Problem - in der Umgebung gibt es nette Coffeeshops/Diners. Das Zimmer war zweckmäßig und sauber, Handtücher wurden auf Wunsch täglich gewechselt. Wifi lief einwandfrei. Sehr hervorzuheben ist das durchweg freundliche Personal, hier findet man immer Hilfe, egal bei welcher Frage. Wir würden wiederkommen und können das Hotel weiterempfehlen.

title: Good enough
text:
Stayed here for 5 nights, was disappointed by the service but was otherwise a nice hotel.

Issues noted:
1. Room Cleaning = Appears that room cleaning is only provided when requested.  Our room was cleaned after the first night without issue and without us asking. Second day we were gone from 8:30-3:30pm, room was not cleaned. A staff member caught our attention and asked if we wanted our room cleaned as we were entering our room and explained that cleaning services stop at 4:00pm. We were too exhausted to accept and therefore turned down service. Next day we were out of the hotel from 8:30-3:30pm and again returned without our room cleaned. Called and asked for the room to be cleaned (and it was within 20 minutes) - no explanation provided, no compensation received for lack of service.

2. Cleanliness of Common Spaces = The floor in the lower room where breakfast is served was sticky out entire stay - was visibly dirty. Bathrooms next to breakfast area were visibly dirty (unclean floor, walls, toilet paper everywhere, water everywhere). 

3. Elevators are very slow = be prepared to walk up and down the stairs - much faster than waiting for the elevators. Had to wait 10 minutes for the elevator the day we left (couldn't walk down the stairs with our luggage). The elevators also appear to open on any floor that requested an elevator, even if that elevator is moving in the opposite direction requested (often had people joining us on the elevator thinking it was going up/down when the elevator was in fact moving the other way).

4. Minor room issues = shower doors were not properly installed which resulted in excessive water on the floor after shower use. Thermostate in our room did not work and therefore could not control the temperature or fan. Pre-check in requests made on the Marriott app (foam pillows, extra towels) were not fulfilled.  

Overall was good enough for what we needed (needed to be near the CBS recording studio around the corner for the purpose of our stay); however, definitely a disappointment in comparison to other Marriot hotels we have stayed. Will not return.

title: Very nice visit.  Pleasant, helpful personnel.
text: Extremely clean and at a safe location.  Loved the shower! The windows were not too thin and kept out the city noise.  The beds were very comfortable with plenty of pillows.  Refrigerator in room.  We did not get to the breakfast (by 09:30). 2 blocks from Terminal 5.  Plenty of lunch options nearby. Very small bar area.  They will hold your luggage for you before check-in and after check-out.  No need to carry your bags around with you all day.

title: Everything is Small
text:
Who said NY is the big city.   Not Fairfield, everything is small.  Rooms, elevators, bar, bathroom...you get the idea.   Wait, not everything is small, the bill is relatively large for the value.   Speaking of elevators, they are the slowest ever.   Also on day of checkout, housekeeping knocked on our door (twice) as a courtesy wake up.  

Front desk had a great welcome to us, probably the highlight of the stay.

title: Great hotel
text:
We made a fairly extensive list of possible places to stay in Manhattan and I can safely say we chose the right place. After wandering around we would occasionally stumble across some of the other hotels on the list and every time we’d say “thank god we stayed at the Fairfield!”. 
On arrival the staff were friendly and very helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast was perfect and couldn’t have asked for more! The Fairfield staff at breakfast deserve a mention as they were always very welcoming and kept everything running smoothly. 
I’m not sure if the hotel was fully booked while we were there but I have seen reviews complaining about the elevator situation (ie. waiting times), however we didn’t encounter any such problems and we were on the 15th floor.
The location was perfect for us. Just a couple of blocks west of Central Park + Broadway and a couple of blocks east of the Hudson River, everything in Midtown is within walking distance, we even walked down to the financial district in lower Manhattan (about 1:30hr walk) which is a great way to see Soho and Washington square etc. 
We would definitely stay here again.

title: Planning a Central Park area Museum blitz, stay here!
text: Prior work and family stays had all been more central to Times Square, being out of the masses was great and from here all the Central Park museums are walkable.  We used points to secure the room which was clean, ok a little small but the staff is friendly but as noted one wonders if you're getting trapped in the elevator, you'll see.   There are a number of good restaurants nearby from diners to updated Greek and for our climber friends a climbing gym a block away.  Last day had a Nancy Pelosi/Gov. Cuomo sighting right outside the hotel exiting John Jay College across the street.

title: Very nice and right priced.
text: Just checked out and had a very nice stay.  Room was very clean and king size bed just fit. Nice hot water shower.  Breakfast was awesome... eggs, waffles, fruit, cereal, something for everyone.  Just a 10 minute walk from everywhere.

title: Bel établissement au calme et très bien situé
text:
Propre
Très bon petit déjeuner : choix, fraîcheur des produits
Localisation = Central Park, pas bruyant et proche de tout
Grand lit

Petites chambre et salle de bains mais pas gênant du tout pour 5 nuits

title: Nice, clean, and quiet
text: I had to stay over for my job in the city recently due to inclement weather, and was pleasently surprised at how nice, clean, and quiet the Fairfield Inn near Central Park was. I've stayed in several nearby hotels in the past few years for similar reasons of my work, and none of the other places (The Watson hotel, The Hudson hotel, etc.) were as meticulously clean, and because of their locations on a very busyWest 57th street, they were much noisier. The Fairfield may not have spectacular views, but if you want peace and quiet after a busy day in the city,,this is the hotel for you.

title: Weekend Visit
text: We picked this hotel because it is within walking distance to Lincoln Center and the room was small but clean and modern. The hot breakfast was wonderful with eggs, oatmeal, fresh fruit, yogurt and more! Parking is available next door for $43 a night. I would of given this hotel 4 stars but I'm deducting one star for this reason; The incessant the sound of hotel doors closing! Why they need to close so loud I don't know but whether there was a large event or convention happening, and plenty of people getting to their rooms late, those click-thunks start to add up. They started to grate…and awake.

title: Like it
text: I stayed in this hotel with my mom for one night. We went to NY for wedding shopping. This hotel has a great location. Close enough to everything but apart enough from all the noise. The hotel looks great. Comfortable bed, clean bathroom, nice and helpful staff.. The breakfast was good enough with many options and a modern atmosphere. There are a couple of parking options around.

title: Nice property, very westside
text: No complaints other than how far west the property is from Broadway.  Nice if small room, great free breakfast.  Good staff and nicely appointed room.  Not sure what else to say but need more characters!

title: Excellent stay!
text: I arrived in New York at 6.30am after a long flight from Singapore. As soon as I turned my phone on, I had a message on Marriott app from the hotel confirming that my room was already ready for me! Great! When I checked in, the front desk agent was done in less than a minute and I was off to my room on the 15th floor. The room was small as usual in New York, but it looked gorgeous, like it had just been remodeled. The bathroom was spacious with shower that had high water pressure and hot enough water. This hotel offers complimentary breakfast in the breakfast room on the cellar level, and I have to say that this was probably the best "free" hotel breakfasts I've ever had. Each day they had slightly different meats (sausage, bacon, Canadian bacon), eggs, oatmeal, fruits, bagels and fresh fruits..and best of all, amazing DIY banana-nut waffles! Simply great spread. All staff members that I interacted with the very nice and polite. The hotel is located bit off from the most touristy areas in Hell's Kitchen with plenty of nice restaurants and bars around the corner and about seven minutes walk from Columbus Circle. Three thumbs up!

title: Good neighborhood
text: This hotel is very well located to explore a large area of Central Park and the upper West side on foot.  Room was tiny, but it is NYC.  The hotel was newly opened when we stayed, so everything was fresh and clean.  Friendly staff.

title: Buenas habitaciones. Ascensores deficientes.
text:
Primero, decir que la ubicación del hotel es muy buena. En cinco minutos andando estás en Central Park y la estación de metro de Columbus. Cerca hay sobre todo muchos restaurantes de todo tipo a precios variados.
El personal de la recepción nos pareció muy amable a la llegada. La recepción en sí es muy pequeña, y se continúa con un bar y algunas mesas antes de tomar una puerta para subir al ascensor.
Justamente el ascensor me pareció lo peor del edificio. Solo tienen dos, y son superlentos. Se puede perder mucho tiempo esperando. Muchas veces subí por las escaleras.
La habitación a mi me pareció buena. Muy limpia, bien mantenida, y con espacio suficiente. Los baños son amplios. Únicamente no me gustó del baño que no tuviese tapa en el WC, pero es solo una observación.

El desayuno merece mención aparte, porque creo que,gastando lo mismo, se podría dar mejor desayuno, con más variedad y, sobre todo sin usar platos plásticos, lo cual me parece sumamente anti-ecológico. No veo necesidad de ello.
Creo que podría haber mejor café, mejor chocolate y mejor pan que el que ofertan.

title: Très bien
text:
4 nuits dans cet hôtel plutôt moderne et propre. Lit très grand et très confortable. Chambre et salle de bain très petites.
Personnel juste poli sans plus.
Petit déjeuner avec beaucoup de choix (fruits frais, graines et oléagineux, gaufres, nages....  MAIS il manque vraiment le Nutella !!!!!
Bien situé à 2 blocs de colombus circle pour accéder à central park ou prendre le métro.

title: do not stay on west side of the building, stay on the east side
text: I had to move my room from the west side of the building to the east side of the building. The noise level is very high on the west side. It’s above a very large humming machine. The hotel moved me the next morning and put me on the east side front of there building. “NO NOISE” it was quiet.

title: Very Friendly Hotel!
text: We stayed here as a family over New Year and the welcome was always warm! The breakfast area was clean and well run with a good choice of food and drinks.All the staff we came into contact with were always friendly and helpful!

title: Consigliato!
text:
Sono stato in questa struttura dal 25/12 al 04/01. Mi sono trovato molto bene. 
Molti lati positivi: 
- Il rapporto qualità-prezzo, considerando che sono stato qui nel periodo natalizio, è stato ottimo. 
- La posizione (sei a 10 minuti a piedi da Columbus Circle dove si prende la metro) e 20 circa a piedi dalla Fifth Avenue. 
- La colazione inclusa nel prezzo (cosa da non sottovalutare a Manhattan dove la colazione è costosa e con le tipps si spende ancor di più. La colazione fornita, inoltre, è varia ed abbondante). 
- La pulizia della camera (ben pulita nonostante gli standard igienici di New York non siano come i nostri). 
- Personale cortese e disponibile. 
- Wi-fi che va una bomba (a differenza di tanti altri posti visitati dove il Wi-fi prende una volta ogni tanto, qui va benissimo)
Pochi lati negativi:
- In camera c'è un solo armadio strettissimo occupato dall'asse da stiro e le cose devono stare chiuse in valigia. 
- Pulizia delle finestre esterne (c'è anche una bella vista, ma è oscurata dal lurido esistente sull'esterno della finestra). Questi, comunque, son dettagli. Mi son trovato molto bene

title: TRANQUILLITA' ED EFFICIENZA
text: Sono stata a New York per la prima volta con la mia famiglia dal 1 al 5 gennaio. L'hotel è carino, funzionale, le stanze non sono molto grandi ma essenziali e con un'ottima pulizia, unica pecca l'armadio molto piccolo che obbliga a tenere i vestiti in valigia. Non è molto vicino al centro nevralgico di Time Square ma si trova in una zona tranquilla e con una bella passeggiata si possono raggiungere le varie attrazioni. Il personale è gentilissimo e disponibile per qualsiasi esigenza. la colazione...... FAVOLOSA.... ricca, varia e buonissima abbiamo perfino trovato fragole, uva e mirtilli e per chi fa turismo non perdere tempo a cercare un posto per fare colazione è.....ORO!!!!! quindi CONSIGLIATISSIMO a chi vuole andare in questa meravigliosa città.

title: Decent, close to Lincoln Centre
text:
We emailed ahead to confirm one room would have two beds for our 2 grown children travelling with us. 

Pros:

Friendly staff
Parking around the corner was not a bad price for Manhattan
Close to Lincoln Centre, Central Park, Intrepid
Free breakfast with decent selection
Beds ok

Cons

Frequently a long wait for either of two small elevators
Comforter on the bed was very thin, seemed to be one of those $9 ones from Ikea, so we were cold.

title: Great value, comfort, service, location
text:
This Fairfield is the best value we found for a 2 night stay for west side NYC theatre and museum access. The price was so reasonable, and we were not expecting much. We 
were so surprised and pleased with nearly every aspect of the hotel!  In our standard king room, the only thing we found lacking was the tiny locker sized closet and with just 2 tiny drawers. (probably understandable  in NYC). Travel in the winter meant bigger clothes, but we adapted, just a warning if this would be a concern to other travelers. Good job Marriott!!

title: Consigliato!!!
text:
Se state cercando una buona posizione per visitare New York, una buona colazione e delle receptionist veramente simpatiche, potete smettere di cercare e prenotare questo hotel!!! Mi dispiace di non aver fatto una foto della colazione, ma era davvero varia. Molto meglio che andare a farla fuori! Ci permetteva di iniziare la giornata carichi e senza perdite di tempo!
Tra L’altro struttura nuova e senza l’odiosa moquette. 
Le receptionist (lo ripeto) simpatiche e disponibili!
Vacanza indimenticabile!

title: Buon soggiorno
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in questo hotel per 4 notti, si trova veramente a 5 min da Columbus Circle, ottimo per spostarsi verso tutte le mete principali della città. Il personale è gentilissimo e dove vedono la difficoltà della lingua ti vengono incontro usando anche applicazioni di traduzione. La stanza si trovava al 16 piano, ci sono due ascensori capienti, ma negli orari di punta c’è da fare un po’ di attesa. La stanza è piccola ma funzionale, è vero, come scrivevano altre persone, l’unica disagio sono proprio gli armadi stretti che non ti permettono di poter aprire e posizionare i vestiti della valigia e pertanto aldilà delle giacche, si è obbligati a tenere le cose riposte dentro. La pulizia viene effettuata ogni giorno. Per quanto riguarda la colazione risulta essere un po’ scarsa è tipicamente americana, negli orari di punta può capitare che alcuni prodotti finiscano e non vengano riforniti. Vista la capienza dell’hotel la sala si presenta piccola e talvolta ti costringe a portarti la colazione in camera. 
Complessivamente soggiorno molto buono e ci torneremmo!

title: Pick another hotel
text:
We booked the room on the phone with SPG, once we were checked in realized that the room was a king bed and it would not work for 2 kids and 2 adults.  We immediately spoke to the front desk and we were told if a room with 2 beds became available they would call us if not they would give us ”as many blankets and pillows” so the kids could sleep on the wood floor.  At 9:30pm it was clear the kids would be sleeping on the floor and I asked them to bring up 4 comforter’s and 4 pillows- they only sent 1 comforter and 2 pillows. Clearly they knew that would not be enough.  I asked for them to send more up to us, but they were completely out or blankets, some time later they arrived with one more, not nearly enough for even slight comfort.  Not acceptable on so many levels- 
The heat in the hotel was on full blast so we slept with the window open, not pleasant to hear all of the noise from the street. 
The SPG rating of a category 5 and 50,000 points a night is a total joke.  This hotel is not family friendly and should work on its service/problem solving.

title: Staff treated us like family
text: We arrived one-day prier to our cruise, picking this hotel for the convience to the port, and excellent walking around.  You know what they say about making plans?  Upon arriving at the hotel, we discovered that our NCL ship was running about 18 hours late to NY.  The staff could not have been more gracious and helpful. The day of our cruise it was raining, dark and gloomy, but the staff let us sit in the lobby, offered us free wifi coffee and water, even bringing us pillows to make sitting in the chairs more comfy, kept us updated on what was happening at the port.  The hotel is clean and comfortable but the staff is excellent

title: MUITO MAU A EVITAR
text:
Hotel completamente sem estrutura .
18 andares 2 elevadores para clientes e empregados, Aquecimento do quarto faz tanto barulho que não se consegue dormir pedimos um cobertor fomos informados que não têm 😡.
A sala dos pequenos almoços é na cave fechada e minúscula para a dimensão do hotel 😡😡.
Pela primeira vez e depois de estadias em hotéis pelo mundo fora neste hotel não existe louça nem talheres pois é tudo em plástico 😡😡😡😡o que produz diariamente toneladas de lixo plástico 😡😡 no mínimo ridículo.
Casa de banho minúscula e sem pressão de agua .
Único ponto positivo é a localização

title: Terrible! Unworthy of the Marriott brand
text:
Despite the great location this hotel is ran very poorly.

Rooms are tiny with essentially no closet space.  We were there for 6 days and our clothes simply didn’t fit (could not unpack!).  Rooms are not very clean and daily service is poor.

Only two very slow elevators cause 10-15 minute wait times on a daily basis creating enormous frustration for guests.  These elevators are also used by service staff which creates additional demand for it.

Service staff is very loud at all hours (their maintenance radios woke me up several nights during my stay).  Doors also shut loudly.

A/C system is loud too.

Breakfast area is very small and always crowded.  Food quality is below average.

Finally, the service is totally unworthy of the Marriott brand. 

Front desk staff seems to be too busy in their processes to care about customers.  Service staff unapologetically take precedence over guests in slow elevators on a regular basis. 

I will never stay there again and strongly urge others to consider alternatives.

title: Great Staff, Comfortable Beds and Very Clean Rooms
text:
The staff at this hotel is excellent.  When we travel to NY, we drive 7 hours and tend to look ragged upon arrival. This leads to some judgment and some less than friendly interaction at times. Ashley was so kind and personable and answered all our questions.  Hospitality is truly exemplified here.  All my contact with the staff, Ashley, Robert and Nash was friendly, professional and extremely helpful.  

The rooms were small but if you stay in NY that is a given unless you want to pay an enormous sum for a room you will spend little time in.  The rooms were very clean, amazingly quiet, and the beds were extremely comfortable. We had three rooms, some bigger than others but all three couples, of various ages, enjoyed the stay.  There is a refrigerator in the room also.  I don't eat breakfast but those in our group that did partake said the food was good but said the eating area could get crowded. Breakfast was included in the price of the room and that is rare in the city, unless you pay a premium. There are many options surrounding the hotel should  you choose to eat out.

NY is a walking city and I thought the hotel was in a great location but if you don't want to walk you can catch the subway right at Columbus Circle to most major attractions.

Please read reviews carefully as some of the less than stellar reviews have nothing to do with the excellence of this hotel.  I have stayed in various areas in NY and paid much more money and this hotel was better than most. I think there was parking on the street but we parked in the garage just behind the hotel. It was very easy to get to and you could walk right back to the hotel. 

As no hotel is perfect, the only complaint would be the slowness of the elevators but that should not impact your stay,  You just have to be patient. I would stay here again as I liked it was less crowded at night and had many places to eat and stores close by.

title: Bad view, otherview comfortable
text: The room view and lighting was bad. Also, no late check-out option. Otherwise, our stay was fine and comfortable. Location requires a bit of walking to get to good areas in Midtown West. I booked because of the good price in points.

title: Great Location for the Lincoln Center
text:
We chose the Fairfield because it is within walking distance of the Lincoln Center, where we had concert tickets.  We were quite pleased with the quietness and cleanliness of the room, and the efficiency of the climate control system.  We were less pleased that there was only one chair to sit in, meaning that if we both wanted to have coffee and a snack or read at the same time, one of us had to be on the bed.
Front desk service was friendly and helpful most of the time with the exception of when we complained that our room had not been made up when we returned for a rest in mid-afternoon.  When the same thing happened the next day, we were told that it was our responsibility to inform the desk before we left in the morning what time we expected to return.  That was a first in our decades of staying in hotels around the world.

title: Great 5 day stay
text: Great location and service. Staff were really helpful and attentive. Breakfast was a good standard and lots of choice. Rooms were compact but this is standard in New York. Our room had a constant noise outside. Sounded like a generator or air con unit but we were able to sleep through it. Overall great stay and would return and recommend to all. Thanks Chris

title: Pessimo
text: A foto do quarto era uma e me colocaram em um quarto muito pior. Não tem o minimo de atendimento de um hotel, reclamaram até de ter que pegar as malas na hora do check out, além de limitaram o horario do café muito cedo

title: Una volta è bastata
text:
Abbiamo soggiornato in una tripla per tre notti in questo albergo, nella stanza era presente un solo minuscolo armadio di circa 45 cm dove a malapena  entravano i nostri 3 giubbotti senza avere la possibilità  di disfare le nostre valige che abbiamo dovuto tenere per tutto il soggiorno in mezzo alla stanza riducendo in questo modo ancora di più lo spazio per muoverci.
Imbarazzante il momento della colazione che si svolgeva in una sala assolutamente inappropriata per accogliere gli ospiti dell'hotel che comunque erano numerosi visto che si trattava di una struttura di 18 piani, costringendoci a vagare con il piatto di cartone in mano per cercare un posto dove sedersi  al pari di una mensa ministeriale o mc Donald con l'unica differenza che non eravamo provvisti di vassoio ma, come già detto, piatti di cartone e posate di plastica e ovviamente senza alcun servizio disponibile al tavolo dove già avevano mangiato altre persone e  se eravamo fortunati si avvicinava una cameriera scocciata a pulire con una pezza bagnata.
Unica nota positiva di questo albergo è stata la posizione abbastanza vicina ai punti di interesse di Manhattan.

title: Hard beds!
text: We were staying on points so the price was right! free! But the first night, the bed was so firm both my husband and I had a hard time sleeping. I also don't think the "king" is a true king. Maybe a Cal king? The staff was helpful. Because they have a free breakfast, the breakfast room was a zoo but amazingly the staff kept up with the masses. the elevators are REALLY slow, so, just use the stairs.

title: Great stay for a girls trip!
text: I really loved this jewel in the city! A group of friends and I booked this hotel for a girls trip into the city. We arrived in the early hours (2am) and found an agent waiting for our arrival. We parked our car on the street and the agent who I think was the night manager was nice enough to come out and check to see if we were in danger of being towed. We originally booked a double but found the room too tight for us to function. The next morning Axel assisted us in rebooking to two comfortable king rooms. All the rooms were clean and comfortable. Breakfast was an unexpected surprise as it was hot and prepared as needed. All of the desk personnel were all very helpful and ready to assist. The location is convenient to central park and the subway.

title: Great stay..just allow time for those elevators!
text:
Had a fab 10-night stay here starting on 28/10. Super-pleasant checkin staff, we were upgraded to a street view room. Rooms while not huge are comfy and a
The free breaky is great, we never found long queues at all and the food and service great. A pleasant surprise to see so many fruit options in NYC. 

Its a bit of a step to the subway, but the tradeoff is the relative serenity compared to the relentless noise of closer to Midtown,

Only slight hitch?? Surely 2 tiny little lifts for an 18 story hotel is barely legal? We waited a full 30 mins at the lifts to get to reception from our room at checkout. Granted it was the day after the Marathon...but still..made it a rush to Penn station for our train. 

Minor quibble thought., We'd happily stay here again!

title: Fantastic stay!!!
text: Great place to stay! It is a little hidden, but so nice! Everyone is so friendly, breakfast is amazing, and it’s very clean! Also heads up to Stevie for being so nice! If you go here, talk to Stevie! He is the guy to help you!

title: Highly recommend!
text: Great place to stay at a reasonable price! Clean and a good breakfast.  The staff was very friendly and helpful. Walking distance to Times Square and great restaurants nearby. I would highly recommend this hotel.

title: Clean, super friendly, great location!!!
text: We stayed here for our Anniversary, a little Stay-cation (28Oct.-30Oct.)! Hotel is fairly new, was very clean, the staff were very nice and friendly. Room was a little on the smaller size, though that’s typical for NYC. We had a king corner room on the top floor (18), great views and very quiet. The breakfast buffet was good, plenty of options, can get a little crowded down there though. The bed was on the firmer side. All in all, two thumbs up! Location is great too, easy walking to most attractions, not a noisy or busy neighborhood.

title: Exceeded expectations
text:
We stayed at this hotel and found it to be a great location, modern, clean, and great staff. Lots of neighborhood restaurants, and the hotel's breakfast buffet is very good. Close to Central Park and Columbus Circle.
The bed was comfortable, and we had no noise from either the street or from other guest rooms. We were glad we had a room with a view which made staying there even nicer.

title: great service but 24/7 street construction noise
text: Front personel and the breakfast helpers were very efficient and service-minded. Space for two big suitcases, for NY large bathroom. King-size bed was very comfortable. Big screen TV and host of channels. WIFI functioned well. Included breakfast, though always crowded, was top quality and worth standing in line for. Their recommendations for when the fewest people are at breakfast are spot on, try to follow their suggestions. Be patient when using the elevators. We experienced fairly long waits, no matter the time of day or night.

title: Great Pre/Post Cruise, Columbus Circle, Lincoln Center
text: We spent one night at this stylish westside location last week post-cruise. It's a short, inexpensive taxi ride from the port and they were very accommodating storing our luggage while we spent our day in the city before our room was ready.  The hotel is clean and modern and has a friendly, helpful staff.  Everyone from the front desk clerks, to the bellman to the breakfast staff were professional, knowledgeable and kind. Our room was "city small" but well appointed with a smart tv, comfortable bed and compact bathroom. The nightly rate was relatively affordable for NYC.  Our daughter lives in Manhattan and we won't hesitate to book this location again for future visits.

title: Excellent value, clean and friendly
text: Stayed here for 5 nights in September.  10 minutes walk from Columbus Circle Subway.  In a great position to get to Central Park.  About a mile walk from times square, but nice to be slightly away from the madness.  Great choice at breakfast, especially as a tourist, its nice not to think about finding somewhere for breakfast, when you need to be up and out with a busy New York tourist schedule.  Good choice of toast, English muffins, bagel, waffle machines, cereal, fruit, yoghurt, hot food of egg, home fries, bacon and sausage, with it changing on a daily basis.  Yes its all disposable cutlery, but this does not affect the cleanliness of the dining room or how efficient the staff were at keeping it all topped up.  Reception staff very helpful, nice friendly girls on the bar.  We have stayed in Fairfields before on our US visits, and once again as a British tourist they were ideal.  Rooms not very big, but clean, and I don't go on holiday to sit in my room all day.  In a city like New York, clean bed, and shower is what I need.

title: Nice hotel in a quiet location
text:
I got this hotel via a hotwire deal.  At first, I was a bit disappointed about the location, but once we got there, I realized it actually had a lot of good selling points.  It's far, far west, near the river.  But, if you are driving into Manhattan (as we were) it's really simple to get there off the West Side Highway, and you don't have to deal with a lot of Manhattan traffic.  Also, parking was a lot cheaper in that area than others.  I paid only $25/day to park which is cheap for Manhattan.

As mentioned, the location just off of 10th/Amsterdam Ave. is about a 10 minute walk from the Subway at Columbus Circle.  It's also about a mile to Times Square.  We ended up walking to all the shows we had booked, each was a very pleasant walk of about 15 minutes or so.  It was actually nice to be away from a lot of the crowds and congestion of staying right in Times Sq.

As for the hotel itself, it was very nice.  All the employees were very pleasant and cheerful and helpful.  The room itself was as small as it could possibly be, without feeling closed in.  There was plenty of room to walk around the king bed, but if someone was standing at the foot of the bed, they had to move to let the other one get by.  Bathroom the same.  Just large enough to do your business, but tight.  Everything in the room though, was very nice, new, clean and modern.  Breakfast was amazing, for a free breakfast, this was one of the best I've ever seen.

So this was a first visit for me, but when I return to NYC I will certainly consider staying here again if I can get a good price.

title: Not quite Central Park
text: One important aspect to note is that it is about a 10 minute hike to the southern border of Central Park. Actually the hotel is much closer to the Hudson River since it is between 10th and 11th, But about 5-7 minutes take you to Columbus Circle where you can catch a variety of train lines. So the location shouldn't pose a serious problem. The staff is very friendly and helpful which isn't always the case in New York where real estate is at a premium. The room is a reasonable size, again by New York standards which means not roomy but not by any means cramped. There is only a shower in the room so those who insist on baths may be disappointed. The included breakfast is a step up from those in the standard bargain hotels. The breakfast buffet is not of course overwhelmingly but it is reasonable and filling. For a more quiet and relaxing breakfast do try to get there early. Lastly, there are only two elevators (lifts). When I was there one was not working. Fortunately I was on the second floor and could easily walk up and down to my room. Others had long waits.

title: 8 notti
text: Nonostante la stanza piccolina e l'armadio minuscolo se dovessimo ritornare a NY allogeremo nuovamente in questo hotel. Colazione a buffet varia e abbondante. Pulito e confortevole. Check out alle 11:00 ma con la possibilità di lasciare le valigie in un'apposita stanza per sfruttare al meglio la giornata, il nostro volo era  alle 22:20. Assolutamente consigliato!

title: Perfect little hotel
text:
Professional and friendly staff. Milita ( Millie) went the “extra mile” to advise and direct us. Ronald was there for all our needs. Room 917 was spotless and quiet. A wonderful bed too! Walking distance to Central Park, and world recognized department stores. 
Great restaurants within walking distance too.

title: Helpful staff and a decent location
text:
Paper plates and plastic cutlery are never a winner - decent food though.
Helpful staff in general but be sure to get a room at the front of the hotel to avoid the alley!
A bit of a walk to the subway but we didn't mind that as everything is a walk...

title: Labor day weeknd visit
text:
Booked this hotel blindly on Hotwire. The price was great considering how expensive NYC is. We arrived about 730 am after our redeye and the staff were quite nice and welcoming. We were able to check our bags and freshen up in the downstairs restrooms. The staff invited us to check out the big busy breakfast room. We really appreciated being able to grab a bite and we definitely needed the caffeine to start exploring the city. There were many options and the veggie sausages hit the spot!

The hotel is a bit on the outer edge of the main touristy spots but it's easy enough to hop on the subway or grab an uber. The room was small but was fine for what we needed. We were probably in the room a total of 15 hours over the weekend. The bed was firm and quite comfy after walking through the city. The shower had good water pressure too. Everything seemed very new and clean.

The rumors are true about the elevators so be prepared to wait a bit or hoof it up a few flights. We didn't hear neighbors and the ac provided coolness and white noise. This is a really good spot and we would definitely stay here again!

title: 10 notti al Fairfield (Central Park)
text: Ho soggiornato in questa struttura per 10 notti assieme a mio marito, in occasione della nostra luna di miele. L'hotel si trova a  15 minuti a piedi da Central Park, sulla 58 strada, zona comoda, tranquilla e carina, a 10 minuti a piedi dalla stazione metro Columbus Circle e im generale a poca distanza dal centro. La struttura è moderna, con un bar al pian terreno con cortile esterno; il personale è stato sempre gentile e disponibile. La nostra stanza al 10° piano (una king standard) era dotata di bagno, cassaforte, tantissime prese, asse e ferro da stiro, frigo e smart tv. Era abbastanza piccola, abbiamo avuto difficoltà a trovare un posizionamento per le valigie, così come con l'armadio, che era praticamente ad unica anta, perciò non abbiamo neanche potuto disfare la valigie, per mancanza di spazio sufficiente per entrambi!!! Era in generale difficile muoverci contemporaneamente all'interno della stanza! Il bagno, ugualmente piccolo, aveva però una grande (quasi metà della sua superficie totale) e comoda doccia (inesistente il bidet  :-(  ) lode invece al letto matrimoniale di dimensioni più grandi rispetto ai nostri standard e davvero comodissimo! La stanza dava su un cortile interno, ma purtroppo confinava con un locale credo dedicato all'impianto di areazione, che emetteva un continuo rumore intermittente che la notte risultava molto fastidioso. La pulizia quotidiana non era approfondita, tanto che, soprattutto in bagno, negli ultimi giorni si sono accumulati polvere e capelli... Lode invece alla colazione internazionale, di ampia e ottima scelta (se proprio devo trovare una pecca è solo la mancanza del cappuccino!). Altra pecca della struttura, la presenza di due soli ascensori, di cui uno per diversi giorni fuori servizio, con attese snervanti a tutte le ore. Considerando nel complesso tutti questi aspetti, e il prezzo competitivo rispetto ad altre strutture nella stessa zona, la valuto mediamente e potrei comunque riconsiderarla per una prossima visita a New York.

title: Good location, very nice hotel
text:
My family and I had a great 4 day stay at this hotel. Room was nice and clean. Service great. Breakfast was very good too.
Bar are was also nice.
The only problem are the elevators so we were lucky to get the lower floor.

title: Would stay here again, helpful staff, good location
text: Great location for walking to restaurants and to Central Park which we did every day.  Room was clean and spacious by New York standards.  They had a little bar area that was open from 4-midnight. Great for a nightcap after a day of sightseeing. Also, right outside was a sitting area with large lounge chaiirs and couches under big umbrellas.  Really want to give a shout out to front desk staff, Melida, so efficient, anything that came up,she could handle it.   Also,  Daniel and Nash were helpful and fun.  Made us feel welcome.

title: The Elevators Ruin It
text: It's in an out of the way area, but the rooms are clean and newly refurbished. The gym is spacious by NYC standards. Crowd in the lobby tended towards the dodgy but doable. The thing that kills, and I mean KILLS this otherwise very very decent hotel is the elevators. They are BEYOND slow, the clunk and falter at each floor.....generally very scary and an impetus to your day. I walked up and down 8 flights of stairs to avoid them. Others were saying and doing the same. Don't stay here if you have anywhere to be......heaven knows how long you will spend traveling on the lifts. About as long as it takes to get to Philadelphia, is my guess.

title: Beautiful room
text: Special thanks to Ronald at check-in on 10/7/18.  A big part of a hotel stay for me is the people and it is refreshing to work with someone who remains calm, friendly and accommodating during a very busy and challenging check-in time.  THANKS.  The room was spotless, modern, bright and clean.  All the typical amenities were available, including a small safe.  There are numerous strategically placed outlets and a new television.  I'm very pleasantly surprised.  The street scene location outside is not very exciting but it is a short walk to worthwhile sights.  The lobby is small but modern and comfortable.  I like it.

title: Mai più
text: Struttura nuova, accogliente, ma le pulizie non hanno proprio idea di come vadano fatte. Ho trovato scarafaggi in camera (foto allegata) e quando ci siamo andati a lamentare abbastanza alterati, il manager ci ha presi per matti. Le pulizie nel bagno inesistenti, solo cambio asciugamani. Altra pecca è che bisogna aspettare molto tempo l’ascensore perché lo usano gli inservienti. Nota buona la colazione.

title: Poor room planning
text: We had a much better stay for the first time in Jan 2017.  Returning in Dec 2017, the hotel did not plan very well and gave us only an option for a noisy room or a very tight room and they did not apologize.  Did not like how even the manager handled the situation that night.  Will not likely return even though we got to NYC several times a year and stay multiple nights each time.

title: No air conditioning, no compensation, no customer service, no way again!
text:
I waited a little while to see if I could get any satisfaction from either the hotel or Marriott, and nothing was done so here goes.
1. My husband and I stayed one night, July 27th, 2018, when it was over 95 degrees and humid. The air conditioning stopped working about 6pm and never worked again the entire night.  We contacted the front desk multiple times throughout the evening and were told 'we're working on it. the entire hotel is out'.  They sent one person to our room to check, and he proceeded to complain that he 'had to come all the way from New Jersey at night'. Honestly, I don't care where you came from but if it's your job -it's your job.
The front desk didn't even offer us a bottle of water or even ONE DOLLAR off our bill!! I contacted customer service and they said, well we'll give you 8,000 rewards points, which 1. I have not received and 2. I have not even been credited for the points for the stay OR the 'extra' points.

2.  What hotels in New York don't have cabs that pass by? This one, that the one!  The front desk said they could not call us a cab but we "could walk down to 10th avenue and hail one".  Yes, we had luggage too.

3. At checkout, the front desk and valets thought it was pretty funny that there was no air conditioning (after I complained to the desk) because they did have a good laugh about it.  I, of course, was not amused.

Bottom line: this hotel failed in customer service. Either I should have received a HUGE discount, or at least some compensation for NO AIR CONDITIONING the entire nights stay, or they should have offered to move us to another hotel.  I would never stay here again for two reasons: lack of consideration by this hotel and staff to accommodate us and the location 'off the beaten path' of any cabs in the area.

title: we will be back
text:
We are a family of 4 and we stayed at Fairfield hotel for 5 nights at the beginning of July 2018. Tough the rooms were a bit small, we recommend this hotel for its location (quite close to the center and quiet), its clean and newish rooms, its wonderful breakfast (included in price) and the warming and helpful hospitality of the reception staff. We especially praise Daniel from the reception desk who was like a friend to us. He did not save any effort to help us. Thank you so much, Daniel.   
WE WILL BE BACK

title: A good hotel in an excellent area
text:
The hotel is in Hell’s Kitchen, walking distance to some good restaurants and bars. It is about 10 mins by walk from the closest subway. 

The hotel is quite nice and the staff are very friendly. The rooms are small which is quite common for New York but well designed to just have enough space. They are modern and we were on a higher floor which had a nice view of the skyline. The breakfast isnt bad either, if you are there for a few days it’s good but does get repetitive. One concern is the lifts are terribly slow specially during breakfast. When we were there one lift was constantly playing up and we were at times waiting for 10 minutes to get down. It might seem like a minor issue but it does get annoying. 

Else it’s a nice hotel for a good price in NY.

title: So very unassuming but hit the spot
text:
From the time I entered the building I felt welcomed. Sandwiched between a few office/business buildings is this Marriott gem. The facility was comfortable and clean.Yes, the rooms are small, but from what I understand, that is the NYC way.There are walkable eateries, markets, and attractions in the area. Unfortunately we arrived during an impending storm so we didn't get to take advantage of nearby central park but we did walk to a local restaurant and walked back from the abc studio. The staff was friendly and hospitable the way you expect hotel staff to be. However one employee went above and beyond. We were greeted by Ronald, who was joined by his supervisor Robert. Both were very friendly and helpful, Ronald went the extra mile by assisting my friend and me by taking time to find rooms for us on the same floor, and offering dining options and travel tips. As a matter of fact, we didn't even ask for directions but before we left to venture out, he had already printed out step by step navigation.
