He also made us feel like VIPs by offering to make and making our dinner reservations (even in fancy hotels, I don't get that kind of service).
Visiting NYC but don't want to stay in the busiest part of town? Check out the Fairfield Inn Manhattan Central Park.

title: Excellent for many reasons
text:
We have just spent 7 nights here, and want to pass on our thanks to the hotel and recommend it to others.
We commend Daniel, who gave us such a warm welcome, and many helpful tips (including a $ metrocard to help us) when he checked us in. The reception staff throughout were courteous and pleasant.
There is free coffee and fruit available in the lobby. Wifi available throughout the hotel.
The daily breakfasts were excellent: fresh fruit, cereal, toast, yoghurts, and various bagels, waffles etc, and cooked food. The dining area is spotless. I have to mention Diana, who welcomed us warmly each day. We really did appreciate how hard she works keeping the food and drinks topped up, and clearing up, always with a smile. She enhanced our stay.
Our bed was comfortable. Our room was cleaned daily, always very well. On the 7th floor, we overlooked the street (no traffic noise audible) and a grassy/tree lined college roof opposite. 
The hotel is well situated, with Central Park and museums, and mid-town Manhattan in walking distance if you choose. If not, the subway is under 1/2 mile away.
There is only one negative about our stay: as mentioned in some other reviews of this hotel, our aircon was excessively loud, and woke us repeatedly through the night as it came on and off (with temperatures in the 90s during our stay, and high humidity, the aircon was essential.) We did go to reception about it and they got an engineer to check it- no difference as a result. We were also offered an alternative room but having unpacked, chose not to move. This is the only negative of an otherwise excellent stay.

title: Otra opción
text:
En mi viaje me hospedé en dos hoteles en zonas distintas. Uno en el midtown y en este en la zona del central park. Pudiendo hacer esa comparación, esta area no me convenció. El subway más cercano esta a 700mts y no me resultó comodo.
En cuanto al hotel: las habitaciones son pequeñas no cuentan con microondas y el placard es diminuto.
El horario del desayuno finaliza a las 9am y los domingos 9:30 como que me pareció muy temprano.
Y tiene 2 ascensores y realmente hay que esperar bastante.
No sería un hotel que volvería a elegir.

title: Check-in staff almost competent
text: We stayed at this relatively new hotel for the third time. Location is quite good as we like being close to Hell’s Kitchen. The best kept secret maybe 1.5 blocks to the west and 1 block up: walk under the westside highway, cross the bike path and turn right to enter south end of Riverside Park and Locomotive Lawn. It is a nice area to relax on the Hudson River. Plenty of seatings. You can watch the sunset here over the New Jersey side. Back to the hotel, rooms are small but still new and largely functional. Closet is tiny. No luggage stand. There is a mini fridge. Bathroom is compact but overall not bad. Not much space around the sink to put all your toiletries but the towel shelf above toilet helps. Breakfast is quite good: noticeably better than a similar hotel class like Holiday Inn Express. Great selections and well staffed so items are restocked quickly and areas are kept clean. Check-in was pleasant but the staff could be more honest and competent. Being platinum elite, I inquired about an upgrade expecting a no (because we booked through Hotwire) but got an evasive answer that I was given a high floor room (10th floor of the 18th floor building with window facing another building so no view)! Room was already pre-assigned. No attempt to even look. Asking her to add my partner name to the reservation. Said yes but didn’t do it. My partner arrived later to have trouble getting a room key! Will we be back? Yes, at the right price. Expectations set to low accordingly!

title: Great Little Hotel
text:
This is a great little hotel, and very reasonably priced. The staff is great, better than in some expensive hotels I’ve stayed in. If you ask for something, they remember your room number! Front desk *and* the cleaning staff was responsive and friendly. 

There's a great breakfast included. I'm talkin': scrambled eggs, eggs-cellent oatmeal, fruit, diy waffles, bagels, toast, etc. etc. It was a seriously good breakfast, and I was forced to eat a little of everything. And have seconds.

The only potential issue is the neighborhood; Hell's Kitchen is a bit quiet: very residential, with little retail. But there are plenty of independent restaurants and there is a Starbucks across the street. Everything you'd want to do and/or see is within walking reasonable distance. 

The street itself is a jumble of warehouses and construction, so it's not the most picturesque location. So if you dream of staying across from Central Park when you’re in New York, you're better off… well… staying near Central Park!

As to be expected, rooms are a bit on the small side, but I’ve stayed in smaller in the city. There were a lot of families staying there, however, with many Europeans–more than U.S. tourists. The rooms are immaculate and bonus! there's a refrigerator. The hotel has plenty of public spaces where you can hang out, including a bar and some nice armchairs near the front desk. If it’s not too hot, feel free to sit outside on the comfy couches situated under the umbrellas!

title: Surprisingly great
text: We expected that the room would be very small because rooms in NYC generally are. But this one was fine and featured very efficient use of space. We had a beautiful view from the 17th floor, overlooking John Jay College. Friendly and helpful staff. Comfortable places to relax, both inside in the bar area and outside patio with comfortable furniture and umbrellas. Excellent location, within walking distance of Central Park, Hell's Kitchen and the theater district.  It was easy and economical to take Uber wherever we had to go that was out of walking range, eg, the 9/11 Memorial. Breakfast is included but is so crowded we opted out. Also, only two elevators, so leave enough time to get up and down. We loved it and would absolutely return.

title: Comodo e pulito
text: Ottima esperienza sotto tutto i punti di vista ... hotel pulito, colazione variabe di ottima qualità, cortesia, camera abbastanza vivibile e con dei materassi e cuscini da favola !! Il nostro soggiorno a New York e’ stato molto piacevole grazie a questa bella struttura ! Molto gentili mi hanno permesso anche di lasciare le valige dopo il check out fino alla sera ... l stazione della metro dista 700 metri ma dietro l’angolo si può prendere con la metro card il bus m57 che ti porta alla stazione della metro 👍🏻...

title: Great location, frustrating stay
text:
I’m a Platinum Elite member of Marriott. This is not the sort of property I can recommend. The welcome was great. Friendly, professional, efficient. Then I went to elevator. OMG.

Don’t arrive too early. Don't expect to use the elevator between 07:00 and 09:30. There is no service elevator so the staff has to use the guest elevator. First you’ll have to wait. Sometimes as long as 30 minutes. Then it stops frequently. I found it easier to walk down from the 14th floor than taking the elevator. During the morning the elevator is frequently full of cleaning staff and you can't get in.

In my room, the A/C system cycles frequently and the fan is very loud. 

The dining area is efficient and well-attended to. Sort of. Staff are visible and available. But, your shoes will stick to the floor and your napkin will stick to the table. It’s not very clean. The A/C blows so hard that your already tepid food will be refrigerator temp by the time you sit down. One staff member simply brushes table scraps to the floor with a dry napkin rather than wipe the table with a cleaning cloth and catching the scraps.

Saving the best until last. My daughter (27 years old) met me at the hotel in the morning. Before I got downstairs to meet her, a reception clerk had already hit on her. Then I came down and right in front of me he continued to flirt. Totally inappropriate and unlike any Marriott property I’ve ever stayed. We were late for an appointment so we dashed out. We discussed the incident, I’m not off-base. Upon checkout I told the desk about the incident. He offered to to have it addressed. I hope it is. This was my daughter, one young lady. How many others have had to experience this indignation, one can only imagine.

title: Would recommend
text:
Hotel is newer, well maintained and very clean.  We were greeted promptly with a smile at all times.  Room was very tiny but average, I guess, for Manhattan room standards in this price range.  Usual amenities.  Free breakfast, wifi available.  Room 914 faced walls.  Dark, no light. Kept our window shades down at all times because there were windows facing us.  Housekeeping was excellent. 
The only thing that was negative were the elevators.  There were only 2 and they were giving management problems during our stay.  
This hotel is near just about everything by NYC standards.  Central Park, the Intrepid, theaters, restaurants, Lincoln Center.  Anything in the midtown West Side area.  Taxis and Uber readily available.
Totally recommend.

title: Confortable
text:
Hace unos días estuve una semana en este hotel , y la verdad que tengo que dividir mi opinión en dos partes .

La ubicación no está mal a unos 10 minutos andado de Columbus circle ( estación de metro más cercana) y a nos 25 de times. Cuenta con números restaurantes y tiendas cerca , pero donde puedes comprar más barato es en la farmacia que hay de 24 horas a dos cuadras ( tienes de todo ).

En un primer lugar destacar la amabilidad de la mayoría de personas que trabajan en el hotel , desde el personal de recepción hasta el personal de los desayunos .

Hablando de los desayunos decir que son bastante completos con variedad de bollería , frutas , panes, cereales , zumos  y demás , si me faltaba algo es un poco de embutido (pavo , jamón de York o algo parecido) , si eres celiaco  tienen productos específicos además de contar con leche de soja en su lineal de desayuno.
 
Las habitaciones no están mal aunque por el precio que tienen creo que deberían ser algo más grande , la de 4 es relativamente pequeña , la ropa tuvo que estar toda la semana en las maletas puesto que el armario era minúsculo. Las camas son de 1,35 aunque en las imágenes parecen mucho más grande y dar lugar a engaño. Algo que destacar de las habitaciones es la cantidad de enchufes y de adaptadores de usb que tienen primordiales a la hora de cargar dispositivos electrónicos después de un día largo de caminata y de fotos .
Los baños están bastante completos.

En cuanto la limpieza de las habitaciones no está mal , pero tampoco para tirar cohetes , no da asco ni mucho menos , pero un par de días no nos cambiaron las toallas y el baño no estaba la limpieza hecha al 100 por 100.

Si me preguntas si volvería al hotel , te respondería que si , está bien y lo mejor es el desayuno teniendo en cuenta los desayunos que ofrecen otros hoteles.

Otro hotel para tener en cuenta y en el que estuve en otra visita a la ciudad de Nueva York es el YOTEL .

title: Totally recommend
text:
Marriott is always a guarantee when it comes to hotels. We stayed there during our last trip to NYC, in March! We had a premium reservation, so our room was on the 14th floor. The room was absolutely great and we had a great view. The bed was so comfortable!!!The bathroom was big enough! The breakfast was pretty good (there were also waffles) even though some days we were struggling find a table. The stuff was really kind and helpful and when we asked them for some restaurant proposals they gave us a two-sheet list of restaurants of many kinds. 
Well, a con was that the hotel was a bit far from the subway station (Columbus circle)-approximately 10 minutes on foot. We enjoyed our stay there!

title: Great customer service attitude by all staff
text:
This is a very busy hotel. But you would not know it by the friendly smiles and helpful attitudes of everyone we came in contact with. 
Thanks Diana and Alexis for help finding a table in the crazy breakfast room. 
Thanks Marx for getting the rattling fixed in our AC duct. 
Thanks Melissa for trying to get the WiFi password for us. ( This was never accomplished however. )
Thanks Ronald for the helpful info at check in. 

Rooms are small but have every thing. I like the yellow umbrellas and furniture outside. Great location to our daughter who lives in the UWS.

title: A bit far from things, but great hotel, and stay!!!
text:
We stayed here for a long weekend in NY and a show in June.
The reason for our stay was that directly in accross the street was what i thought was the theater where our show was at. It was not. Our show was by Time Square.

But its ok. Because a quick Uber ride, and we were there.

First the front desk staff was friendly and always welcomed us as we came and went.
The lobby is very modern and all new.
I will admit, our room was SMALL. But this is how NY is. We did not have a dresser and had to place our cloths on the counter which acts like a Desk.
None of this bothered me. It is NY after all. The room was brand new. Bathroom was super modern and the room was very clean. We loved that the TV had NETFLIX built in. We were able to see shows on our Netflix account. We did not hear any noise. Overall it was a great stay. Bed and pillows were super comfy and A/C was cold!!

CON: The area is changing, but not much to do after the sun goes down. There are a few dinning options near by. 
I know NY is not cheap, but the price I paid per night, was very expensive considering that we needed to take Uber to eat and find things to do.

OVERALL: I give this a 5 star becasue it is new, modern, and the staff really went out of the way to make sure my stay was great. The area, i am sure will change with time and this will be a great place to stay at.
I would stay again for a cheaper price becasue it is quiet and restful place in a city that is very busy and loud.

title: Successful Family Trip
text:
Just returned from a great long weekend (August 3-6) trip where this was our home base.  

Pros:
- The staff (Melissa and Axell at the front desk in particular) were great
- Breakfast really is fantastic
- Location was perfect for us as we spent lots of time in Central Park, which was only 2 1/2 blocks away

Cons:
- Wish there was a chest of drawers in the room to unpack clothes
- Elevator situation is not ideal, but they let you know that upon check-in, and is really only an issue at breakfast time.

Overall it was a great stay and would recommend to anyone who prefers a quiet location close to Central Park.

title: Enjoyed a great stay. Would book again!
text: We were nicely greeted, given a room quickly, and enjoyed our stay.  Found the room clean and employees fantastic.  Room was clean and well prepared.  We had a   comfortable stay.  We highly recommend staying here.

title: Enjoy stairs
text: They only have 2 extremely slow and small elevators so on normal use you spend forever waiting for an elevator.  During our trip one broke during the busy morning and it became impossible to actually get on as other guests went to higher floors and rode it down.  So 15 flights of stairs became the only option.  This hotel is also a good hike from the subway.

title: Bel établissement
text: Etablissement bien situé, calme, bien tenu et très agréable. Un petit déjeuné copieux, les enfants ont adoré faire leur propres gauffres (petit bémol sur la clim à fond ds la salle). Merci à Delilah pour son attention à l'accueil.

title: Anniversary celebration
text: I love this hotel! The rooms are super clean and freshly updated-no carpet-I love that. The staff-every single one- SO helpful and accommodating and friendly. It’s a quiet neighborhood and near great restaurants and close to Lincoln Center. The breakfast is truly a spread to die for. Huge space with tons of seating and TV’s, newspapers, lots of staff standing by to assist. Just so impressive!!!

title: Hotel vicino a Central Park
text: Struttura in posizione strategica, non distante dal centro vicino a Central Park. personale molto cordiale, Camere e bagno molto pulite. Ottima e abbondante colazione compresa che a New York non è da sottovalutare. Consigliatissimo anche per più persone. Noi eravamo in quattro e ci siamo trovati molto bene. Ricordiamoci che siamo a Manhattan. Se tornassi a New York ci ritornerei senza alcun dubbio.

title: Group trip
text:
We travelled as part of a school trip to New York. 
We cannot fault the hotel for both the staff and students. It was very clean and well located. 10 minutes walk to the nearest subway. Close to a shopping centre and Wholefoods market. 

The bathroom is relatively small, but not a real issue.

Also, there is not a lot of draw/cupboard space.

The inclusion of a mini fridge and tea/coffee maker is nice.

There is a huge variety at breakfast, including hot food, waffles, cereal, fresh fruit, yoghurts, bagels and muffins. All great!

We would definitely recommend this hotel and would be happy to stay with them again.

title: Amazing value! Great location! Wonderful hotel!
text:
This place is great!! The staff is incredibly helpful. The rooms are up to date and clean. Best of all is the breakfast included in the stay! We were expecting pastries and yogurt, and have been pleasantly surprised by the variety of full breakfast available each morning. 

The location is just a few blocks away from the hustle of the city. We’d highly recommend this hotel and will stay here again!

title: Great location and perfect choice
text: Perfect choice, no complaints at all, guest services was perfect and so attentive, room was big considering being Manhattan. Check in was super easy as well as checkout. We were there while the city was in the middle of a winter storm so returning every night to this warm and pleasant spot was a joy.

title: The best stay
text: Had a great stay at the hotel. Overall, the hotel had everything we needed. From check in to check out, staff was attentive and polite. As many reviews here says, elevators were a little slow but just give yoursefl a little extra time and you'll be fine. We will be back.

title: Great Stay.
text:
We were only in New York for 1 night and had a great stay. From check in with Melissa at the Front Desk to goodbye all of our expectations were met. The location was perfect for what we needed and the hotel is very clean.  
Yes, the rooms are on the small side but take an advise form someone who lived in New York City for a long time, ALL rooms are small unless you can afford a $1000/ nightly rate. 
Again, thank you all for a great and comfortable night and most importantly to Melissa who is certainly a STAR.

title: Great value in a quiet neighborhood
text:
Stayed 2 nights for my business trip, and I absolutely enjoyed my stay throughout the trip. Hotel is located in a quiet neighborhood apart from tourists and busy streets so there’s no noise or typical Manhattan sirens during the day and night. Columbus Circle and Central Park is only 7-10 minutes away, so it’s walkable to run errands; Whole Foods and other shopping destinations nearby. Room is small, but it’s OK for NYC standards (standard king would be better for solo traveler or couple) - it was perfect size for me. Everything is fairly new and updated; I have zero complaint about cleanliness or room condition. If you want the hotel near the Central Park or Hell’s Kitchen area, I highly recommend Fairfield Inn at this location. *Midtown and lower Manhattan area will be far from this location, but you have Uber! 

Summary ————————
Pros: location (walkable to Central Park), clean and updated room, friendly staffs, quiet neighborhood (located right next to BMW Manhattan in a quiet street)
Cons: no privacy - you can’t open the shade because other building is located right across from your room. If you want a better view, you can pay double for a courtyard view. It was quite odd to see no shower caddies or shelves in a shower booth. I had to put all my stuff on a shower floor.

title: Great find on Expedia
text: Loved it here , just out of the hustle and bustle but not a long walk either . The staff were so friendly . Breakfast included was buffet and did the job . Loved it for the 4 nights we were there . Very clean , free WiFi .

title: Outstanding Service and Accommodations!
text: This was my first trip to NYC and it was outstanding. This was mainly due to service, knowledge and friendliness of the management and staff at the Fairfield Inn & Suites. The location is excellent too. A short walk to Central Park and the subway. The room was small but well equipped and comfortable. The staff allowed stored our luggage until our room was ready and held it for us when we checked out so we could enjoy extra time in the City before departing. I want to especially credit Ronald F., Steven and Diana for exceeding all of our expectations. They were wonderful, pleasant and full of knowledge and suggestions making our trip incredible. I cannot express what a wonderful stay we had. The breakfast was plentiful and great even though it was a packed house in the dining room. She was anticipating needs and was such a kind and pleasant young lady. Again, this place is new, clean, and perfectly located. Beds are comfy and noise is at a minimum. We will be staying here again!

title: Uma boa opção de hospedagem
text: Hotel novo, instalações modernas e staff atencioso. Fica a três quadras do Central Park e uns vinte minutos a pé da Times Square, ou seja, bem longe da muvuca. Há farmácias, mercados e uma Starbucks bem perto. O café da manhã é muito bom, mas fuja do horário de pico quando fica bem  cheio e os dois elevadores não dão conta de  levar os hóspedes até o salão do subsolo onde é servida a refeição. Quarto pequeno, mas com boa cama, e equipado com frigobar e TV e com muitos canais. Banheiro com box (e não com aquelas famigeradas cortinas de plástico) e ducha das boas. Fiquei num quarto da frente e achei um pouco barulhento, principalmente quando parava o caminhão para recolher o lixo. É uma ótima opção, sobretudo pela relação custo-benefício, e para quem já conhece a cidade e quer ficar mais distante do burburinho da Time Square.

title: Amazing, modern, clean hotel near Central Park
text: This hotel is amazing for the price. Customer service here is wonderful and can't be beat. This is a brand new hotel, built within the last 2 years. The rooms are very modern and extremely comfortable. I loved our bed! Yes, the rooms are a bit small, but they more than make up for it with how clean and comfortable they are. They only have a shower in the bathroom, but it is excellent. Love how a breakfast buffet is included with your stay. The only downside is that the hotel is a bit far from Times Square, but that can be a positive if you're looking for somewhere quiet! And it's not too far of a walk from Columbus Circle and the southern edge of Central Park. You can get a MetroCard and travel anywhere in Manhattan so the location was not that big of a deal to us, and we really enjoyed the great service and peaceful, luxurious room.

title: would be nice to review this place using Font size suitable for the room sizes at this hotel
text:
I travel a lot and have stayed at a wide range of hotels all over the world.  This is truly an unusual one.  To be dramatic, it would be nice to review this place using a Font suitable for the room sizes at this hotel:  that would require a Times New Roman size 5 (try it, you'll get the picture).  Alas, the TripAdvisor website does not permit Fonts that small.  I put my suitcase on the floor in my room (the 2nd largest room size they offer) and I was not able to walk around the room.  The bathroom, particularly the sink, is also very little.  

Yup, I had read the reviews before booking but none of the TripAdvisor contributors really conveyed what you are getting yourself into.  So, I  like the idea of TripAdvisor allowing us to review this facility with an appropriately-sized Font.  The reviews did mention another size-influenced problem:  there are only 2 elevators (no freight elevator) for an 18-story hotel.

On the positive side, the staff is helpful, friendly, and does not take offense at the complaints that come pouring in when visitors arrive to see their tiny habitats.  Daniel at the front desk was particularly attentive.  Also, there was a safe and a small refrigerator in the room.

Overall, if you are staying for more than a couple of days, nothing justifies staying in such a small room.

title: Hotel bien situé, Accueil agréable
text:
Ne pas hésiter à demander les chambres en hauteur. Certaines se trouvent face à un mur!
Ma demande a été satisfaite
Petit déjeuner avec beaucoup de choix, salé, sucré, boissons chaudes et froides
Personnel aimable et disponible

title: Boa escolha!!
text: Ótimo hotel! Os quartos são novinhos, com uma cama grande, Tv plana com Netflix, internet free inclusa, cofre digital, frigobar, boa ducha no banheiro, secador de cabelo, ferro passar roupas, café da manhã com ovos, pães, sucos, frutas, waffles, panquecas... A localização do hotel é boa também... está há cerca de 8 - 10 minutos de caminhada da estação Columbus circle.... em 8 minutos a pé vc está no central park... em 15 min na times square. O único defeito do hotel é a quantidade de elevadores (não atende a necessidades nas horas de maior fluxo). Recomendo este hotel!!

title: Recent Stay at the Fairfield Inn and Suites New York, Manhattan/Central Park
text: I recently spent one night at the Fairfield Hotel on W 58th Street and it was an average experience. The rooms are clean and well appointed but are extremely small. It was quite difficult to control the temperature in the room and there was no real view. Breakfast is served cafeteria-style in the basement of the hotel. This is a good hotel for visitors and travellers to New York but is not equipped for business people. The major complaint is that for a hotel with about 16 floors (or more), there are only two elevators, which causes delays and is frustrating. My total bill for one night with taxes was approximately $ 300.00 (US), which was not worth the expense.

title: Location not ideal
text: The people who work here are so nice, but this location is not particularly close to anything tourists are looking for, and Ubers basically ANYWHERE from here cost upwards of $15+ which adds up. The room is clean, breakfast is fine and free, but it’s 15 minutes on foot to basically anywhere and you can’t safely walk back at night

title: Excellent choice for an economical stay in NY
text:
I feel great about our choice to stay at the Fairfield on West 58th. The rooms were clean, the staff was amazing, and there was a large breakfast available each morning with choices for everyone, from the heath nut to the sugar lover. Because you aren't staying in the middle of Times Square, there was zero road noise. 

If you're willing to walk, you won't even need a taxi. If you do require a taxi, use the Curb app and one will come right to the door. Probably the only downside to this particular location would be the availability of really great food, close to your hotel. If you plan ahead though, that's really not a big deal.

We would definitely stay here again.

title: Friendly staff, clean rooms
text: We stayed here for 4 nights in June 2018 and loved it.  The staff is always very friendly and helpful, the rooms were always cleaned very well, the shower is awesome, the wifi is great, and the free breakfast is such a nice touch.  Would definitely stay here again.

title: Good value for money
text: A close walk from Columbus Circle, it may be a bit off Midtown but convenient enough to go anywhere. Restaurants are also plenty in the neighbourhood. The hotel itself is modern, staff were courteous and helpful, and the room was decent and clean. I missed the time for breakfast throughout my stay so could not comment on its quality. It may not be a high-end hotel but the price makes up for it. Good value for money in NYC!

title: Great location & even better hospitality
text:
We stayed here for 3 nights to complete the last few days of our vacation. The hotel is located near enough to the subways including Columbus Circle. A variety of good restaurants are within walking distance. Deliveries are facilitated from many restaurants. It is close to Fordham & Mount Sinai Universities, Lincoln Centre.

Check in was quick and within 3 minutes we were heading to our room. The reception staff was pleasant and welcoming.

The rooms are the usual size for New York and laid out in the usual Marriott style for space efficiency. They were well kept and looked new (including linens). The outdoor seating area is a plus an area other than your room, the lobby or bar where you can relax.

The hot breakfast offered is a positive selling point. Quantities were well maintained and there is a variety of options. The staff are efficient is topping up servings and maintatining a clean dining room seamlessly.

Any incidents were treated with prompt attention and the staff was sincere in creating solutions.

This location is definitely top of the list for whenever we are in New York.

title: Great choice for NYc
text:
My husband and I stayed here for 4 nights in May. The hotel is well located, close to Columbus Circle with lots or restaurants and shops. It’s a reasonable walk to the subway, and if you like to walk, it’s also a decent walk to Times Square. Everything was in good condition and very clean. The room was typical New York I.e. on the small side. I had some minor quibbles with the room, mainly the lack of drawers. Elevators are slow, so ask for a room on a low floor so you can take the stairs. Very good breakfast for this type of property.

One thing I didn’t like in the room was the fact that the safe was at floor level. You have to get down on your hands and knees to access it, making it very difficult to see all the way to the back. I found this out the hard way when I realized I had left my house key in the safe. I thought I’d cleared it all out, but it was difficult to see all the way in.  I called the hotel as soon as I got home. Front Desk Supervisor Delilah went so far above and beyond in making sure I got my key back, that it was unbelievable. We found all the staff to be very ice and helpful, but Delilah deserves a special mention - she was amazing. Overall, this is a well located, up-to-date, mid price property.  We would definitely stay here again.

title: True, the room's cozy, but the breakfast ...
text:
As pointed out in several reviews, the room is "cozy",  i.e., small.  There is no dresser and the king-sized bed takes up a lot of the space.
Nevertheless we had a good stay here for a few days. The staff was very helpful and the breakfast was the largest one I've seen outside of some European hotel breakfast buffets.  And the oatmeal was hot.
When I lived in Manhattan, nobody came to this neighborhood.  Now it's attached to the rest of miidtown Manhattan, with high rise apartment houses and shops.

title: un bon hôtel à NY pour un prix correct
text:
un hôtel confortable, très bonne literie (hyper appréciable après la marche dans NY) déco sympa, vue quelconque. Effectivement peu de rangements, mais ça ne nous a pas du tout dérangé pour 3 jours.
Situé à 15/20 min de marche de Broadway, Times Squares, des croisières Circle Lines et proche du métro Columbus Circle et de Central Park. L'hôtel nous a réservé notre shuttle de retour, quasi le même prix que ce que j'avais réservé sur le net pour l'aller. Aucune taxe de séjour à régler, ce qui est assez rares à NY. Bon accueil à l'hôtel, ils parlent un petit peu français.

title: Great location, lovely hotel
text: We have stayed in this cosy hotel for few nights in New York. It was close to the subway, Central Park, shops and restaurants. The lifts were a long wait in the morning, and no real wardrobe space. Breakfast was rather poor, unless you like cereal. Otherwise great!

title: Nice Room. Clean and Quiet
text:
This hotel is a tad out of area we are used to since we usually stay nearer to Columbus Circle or midtown, but the extra 5-6 minutes walking was worth it for the better price point. It was a reasonable price for a Saturday night in Manhattan.
We arrived before the official check in time and they had our room ready. We were given a handicap room which they said was bigger than a regular room. Even so, it was what I would consider average sized. The room was very clean with a good mattress and very nice linens. The bathroom was spacious. 
The front desk people were peasant. We had a decent breakfast included in the price and we were able to leave our luggage there the whole day, since our flight didn't leave until evening. We were able to enjoy Bryant Park and Central Park. The front desk people said we would be able to easily get a cab on 11th Ave. but all the cabs were full. We ended up with an Uber. I would recommend having them call a cab for you or calling Uber. It wasn't worth standing on the street for 15 minutes or more.
I would definitely stay there again if I need to be in NYC because of the hotel's  location, cleanliness and price. However, the cost of hotel rooms in NYC has gotten ridiculous over that past few years due to the tax increases.

title: Really nice; 2 small issues.
text:
Our new favorite for the Upper Westside.  Nice quiet neighborhood, which is important to me.  Rooms are cozy, but typical for Manhattan.  Great room.  Excellent staff.

2 nitpicks: in the AM the elevator was a LONG wait.  So crowded because of the speed that the lower floors were outta luck.  Staff uses the same elevators, so that adds delay as they move equipment among floors.

In the shower stall (which was very nice), the soap and shampoo shelf tilted.  This was an issue because it is made of chrome mesh, allowing everything to roll out.

OK, I have vented.  I still love this place.

title: Convenient Comfort
text: This particular Fairfield Inn is adjacent to John Jay College and the neighborhood is clean. The property is clean, reasonably priced and in a great location; not too busy and not too secluded. The staff is professional, friendly, and attentive. Nice restaurants nearby and a great walkway along the Hudson River about two blocks away. It is a great value for anyone traveling to NYC

title: Small room
text:
Went to visit daughter and son in law.   Hotel was very clean, help was extremely professional.  Room was small, only one drawer in one nite stand, closet held only 10 hangers.  We made it work lived out of suitcase. Bed was very comfortable. Breakfast not so good, sausage was rubbery and cold, Canadian bacon COLD. Oatmeal and waffles only things good and coffee. 
That said would stay again, just no breakfast

title: Great location and service, copious breakfast
text: Walking distance from the Lincoln Center, this is a good hotel if you're going to the Metropolitan Opera. Many restaurants are within walking distance. The staff is helpful and the breakfast offers a wide range of choices, warm and cold. The environment is surprisingly and pleasantly quiet for the city. The hotel has a gym that is of moderate size but enough to exercise your muscles. Overall a congenial hotel and an excellent price-quality ratio.

title: Excelente!!
text:
Realmente es un hotel recomendable!!! La atencion es remarcable, calidez, calidad y claridad. 
El desayuno es amplio y generoso. 
Tuvimos que cambiar de hotel por razones laborales y lo estamos lamentando. 
Definitivamente mi hotel en NYC

title: Roadtrip
text: Hotel ist sauber, es wird nur das nötigste gesprochen, Preis ist gehoben.  Niemand hilft mit den Koffern, wenn man Unterstützung braucht zum Beispiel um ein Taxi zu rufen wird gesagt das man die Nummer für ein Taxi nicht habe und deshalb nichts tun kann. Sowas habe ich in den USA ich nicht erlebt. Im billigsten Hotel in Deutschland gibt es diesen Service. S

title: Great place in great area!
text: We loved staying here!  Everyone that worded here went above and beyond to make us feel welcome. The rooms are very small, but very clean. Who wants to spend time in their room in NYC anyway, so the small room size doesn’t matter. Nice bar area and the free breakfast area was great as well. Nice and quiet location that’s very close to Central Park & Columbus Circle. We will stay here again on our next visit!

title: Five star service at a discount price
text:
Stayed two nights in April with a group of six women in three rooms for a friends' birthday.  Rooms are clean and modern and the beds are comfy, but typical for an NYC hotel: the rooms are small, clothing storage is limited, some rooms only have showers and not bathtubs, and there was often a short wait for the two elevators.

HOWEVER, the service was just exceptional.  With a particular shout-out to Steven, who knew us by name when we checked in, coordinated our shopping deliveries (we live abroad so we ordered just a wee bit of Amazon), arranged for AMAZING car service (an Escalade or a limo for six, and for cheaper than two taxis?!  Yes, please!), was always ready with a welcome and a smile.  I love staying at a five star hotel because you are treated like someone important and valued: we got the same service here at the Fairfield Inn for a fraction of the price.

Note that this hotel is between 10th and 11th Avenues: perfectly safe, nice and quiet, but a 10-ish minute walk to the bustle of Columbus Circle, depending on the weather and your shoes.

Free breakfast was adequate, clean, ample -- but there are so many charming diners on 9th and 10th, do go elsewhere if your budget allows.

title: Great One Night Stay
text: We had a great one night stay at this hotel!  Stayed here the night before going on a cruise - very convenient location to the cruise terminal.  Check in was easy and the person at the desk was very accommodating, and we had a great room on the 13th floor with a view.  We took a lyft to the Times Square area and enjoyed the city for the night.  We ended up walking back to the hotel from there and it wasn't a terrible walk - but I'd probably recommend getting a lyft or Uber.  Had a great breakfast in the morning and check out was quick.  The room was a bit small, but for one night for two people it was just fine.

title: Clean, convenient, great location
text: Needed a hotel near Fordham University Law School.  This hotel was 2 blocks away.  Close to Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle & west side of Central Park.  Hotel was modern, clean.  Front desk personnel were friendly and efficient.  They will hold your luggage before and after check in/out.  Rooms are small but this is typical in Manhattan.  Room including bathroom was very clean.  Breakfast was comprehensive and included hot eggs & sausage, variety of fruit, yogurts, breads, juices, pastries, coffees & teas.  Very pleased with our stay, would not hesitate to return to this hotel.

title: Comfortable, clean, great staff
text: Just back from a quick trip to NYC and stayed one night at the Fairfield Inn .. walked from Columbus Circle subway - just a few blocks.  The hotel is betweem 10th and 11th on West 58th street ... so much positive change in the area.  I was seeing a show at Lincoln Center - just a few blocks away, no need for taxis.  Clean, comfy.  Free wifi, free buffet breakfast.  I did see a workout room, but did not use it.  A small, friendly bar.  Yes, the elevators can get crowded - but this is a smaller hotel so waiting a few minutes is not a real issue.  I would certainly stay here again.   The staff - everyone at the checkout desk, the ladies in the breakfast area -- all very, very helpful.

title: Great place to stay in Midtown
text: We stayed there for 9 days after our daughter gave birth.  The hotel is very quiet and clean, which to me was most important.  We were impressed with the friendliness of all of the staff we encountered.  There was a female staff member during breakfast that greeted everyone who came in one morning. I was fumbling a bit with something at breakfast one morning, and another staff member came over and made a suggestion to make things easier!  We didn't need anyone from maintenance but anyone of the workers we met in an elevator or hallway was friendly.  I see complaints about elevators--yes there are only two and the only time it is an issue is in the morning for breakfast--and honestly, it wasn't an issue for us.  We met lovely folks from all over the world while we waited and I can't say the wait was that long.  We will definitely stay there again.

title: Super
text: Un très bon séjour dans cet hôtel, la chambre est petite mais très propre et la literie très bonne. Notre vue du 15ème était très sympa. Le petit déjeuner servi sous forme de buffet est très varié. Les réceptionnistes sont adorables et toujours souriants. Petit bémol pour la vmc bruyante.

title: Buena elección
text: Excelente personal, amable y atento con al menos una persona siempre en recepción que habla español. Desayuno típico americano por lo que a los españoles se nos hace monótono. Habitaciones pequeñas, baño funcional y amplio, cama muy grande y armario para una sola persona (lo peor). Zona tranquila con restaurantes y "delis" en la avenida adyacente a buen precio. Mejor elegir habitaciones en los piso altos, son más tranquilas.

title: Until the last day....
text: This hotel located near downtown of NYC. The hotel was new and clean. It is not far from central park and Manhattan. Staff upon check-in was friendly and willing to help. The hotel only has two elevators so everybody was using it, including the Housekeeping staff, so be prepared to wait for a while until your turn. The breakfast staff was great and big seating area, one day, Tracy (GM) was there greeting the guest, she was so friendly. Until the last day around 10:30am, one of the housekeeping staff knock on my door and ask "What time you leave?" She did not have her name tag on so I do not know what is her name. She was SO RUDE, NOT FRIENDLY AT ALL AND HER MANNER WAS SUPER BAD!! I asked her name and she just turns away and walks away. It not even check out time and she just wants us to leave.

title: Good value, clean modern rooms.
text: Stayed here after getting stuck in NYC due to the New England snowstorm.  Relatively new hotel with clean comfortable rooms, decent shower and good price.  I like the usb and outlet next to the bed for charging devices.  The room is a typically small bay room for NYC, but it worked.  I didn’t have the free breakfast and I didn’t use the WiFi or gym.  The location is a few blocks west of Columbus circle, easier to UBER around.  Friendly front desk made check in pleasant.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text: It’s actually a nice little hotel. A little off to the side but only 10 minutes cab ride to Times Square. Only complaint is the elevators. And the crowds at breakfast can be pretty intense. So you need to time accordingly if you are in a rush. Parking is convenient however small walk. It is located beneath the BMW dealer. I suggest taking the elevator up to the building and exit out to 58th. It will save you a few steps. Remember to get your parking ticket validated by the hotel For a different rate. Just before 9 AM the hotel cleaning staff will occupy the elevators all at once and will be more difficult to go up or down.

title: Good newer place, crowed breakfast everyday
text: I've been stayed at this property many times when they opened couple years ago.  Hotel is new, location is good, out from the tourist area but still closed enough for everything.  Rooms are nice and clean, size are pretty good for New York hotel.  Loved that no carpet, much easier to keep it clean.  Beds are still good. Smart TV connect to Netflix. Beautiful floor to ceiling front view facing the school courtyard.  Best buffet breakfast compare with many other Fairfield Inn in New York, but it's also the craziest I've ever been to, I stayed there many times during the years and every times are seriously busy.  Only down side is the elevator are very very slow...

title: Great Mother Daughter Weekene
text:
Clean room, friendly staff, comfortable bed. Yes, rooms are on the small side but what more can one ask for when away for a quick mother daughter weekend?

Go early for breakfast as it does get very busy after 8am.

title: Terrible room
text: I know it is New York and spice is valuable, but this room was ridiculous.  There was only 2 feet of space between the walls and bed.  The desk was too small to work at or even sit at without chair hitting the bed.  No space in bathroom either.

title: Very good choice
text: The staff were exceptional. Breakfast was very good and offered wonderful fresh fruit, hot items and more in a spacious room. The room was small but clean and comfortable. My only complaints were the hard, overstuffed pillows, and the road noise at night. Otherwise, can't beat the price for the accommodations.  Loved the little bar in there lobby too.

title: Great Hotel with Staff that care!
text: We Check into the hotel and were greeted at our car by a hotel employee ready to assist with luggage assist!  This Hotel is Beautiful but the staff made our trip very special!  Diana in the morning started our day with a warm genuine Hello; went out of her way to accommodate along with the rest of the breakfast staff.  This hotel cares about the guest!

title: Convenient Value
text: I made my reservation at this hotel on a website that does not allow you to see the hotel name before your room is booked.  I saved $60 that way (when compared to the rate I would've received from the hotel's website.  I chose the hotel because it was a good value and had favorable, current customer remarks, and I would concur that it was a good value and a fine hotel.  I walked from the Music Box Theater to the hotel in about 20 minutes.  It is located nearby various restaurants and a lovely Whole Foods Market, as well as a mom and pop wine and spirits (no beer) store.  It is one block away from CBS recording studios and a large Mt. Sinai medical facility and about three blocks to the nearest subway stop.  My room had a king size bed, mini-fridge (empty of the usual mini-fridge stuff) and a nice bathroom (shower, no tub).  It had a small valet for a closet.  The floors are faux wood (which I prefer to carpeting).  The room was modern and clean.  Breakfast buffet is included, as is free wi-fi.  The shampoo, conditioner, soap and lotion were Paul Mitchell.  The staff was more than friendly.  I had a wonderful stay.  I will, however, continue to book hotels in New York with the bargain website rather than returning to any one specific hotel.

title: Won't Stay Here Again, Unfortunately
text: I've stayed here three times so far as I'm regularly in this neighborhood for work. Unfortunately, I will no longer choose to stay at this hotel.  I encountered a problem checking in.  Although this was frustrating what really upset me was how I felt I was treated and talked to by the general manager.  I know it can be hard dealing with upset guests but I would have expected more patience, a kinder tone, and ability to solve problems from a general manager.

title: Silvester in New York
text: Im grossen und ganzen war alles in Ordnung. Leider ist die Heizungsanlage ausgefallen bei minus 10 Grad . Das Frühstück war sehr lecker,die Mitarbeiter steht’s bemüht und hilfsbereit . Zimmer etwas klein aber normal in New York .

title: Cozy petite room and warm staff
text:
Room is small but comfortable in general. Chat in app in advance and got a high level room as requested. The view from the room is nice in general. 

Breakfast is OK but super crowded, as well as the elevators during the breakfast hours. Two elevators only for an 18-story building might be less enough.

AC is extremely noisy, while the front desk said they were already in the progress of changing it and asked if we need to change the room to those which had already been changed. We denied but we appreciated that. 

In general the hotel is modern and the staff are warm, nice and willing to help. I would be interested to come back.

title: Great staff
text:
The evening front of the house staff and bartenders were great.  

I had several snafus and there attempt to right the ship was exemplary.

I think there housekeeping could be more observant as the issues were directly related to them.

However, I found the rooms to be well cared for, clean and with nice amenities.

The breakfast was warm and fresh.

I will stay here again.

title: Weekend in NYC
text: Rooms were small but comfortable. Room fan was loud. No issues with elevators during our stay. Breakfast was good. Staff were friendly and helpful. We had planned to park in the BMW garage around the corner but instead parked on the street and used meters during our stay so we could use our car to get around.

title: I've been in Marriotts all over the world, this is the smallest.
text: If you're a business traveller, stay far away from this place. Not a closet or hanger, nor a single drawer. You're litteraly living out of a suit case. The small list of menu items is for the very hungry and even then expect them to be out of at least half of them. Staff was friendly enough, but this Marriot should be avoided.

title: 8 dias de conforto em NYC
text:
Hotel atendeu plenamente as expectativas. Boa localização, rodeado de bons restaurantes.
Funcionários prestativos e atenciosos. Café da manhã muito bom valendo registro pra deliciaaaa a de Walffer que temos disponíveis todos os dias.
Boa limpeza e acomodação para duas pessoas ap 410.
Recomendo!!!

title: Excellent hotel with friendly people
text: We really enjoyed our stay. Room was small, but good quality. We had everything we need: big TV, comfortable king size bed, quite place, good coffee, free internet. Free breakfast with healthy choices was very good and helpful. I also used small gym, which also has everything you need. The only thing is location, which is not as close to Central Park (15 min walk) or Times Square (20 min walk) as you may think. But is is quite and safe part of the city.

title: Awesome Friendly
text: This place was so super friendly and accomadatimg to robert and senia and deliah were awesome , so many friendly people Antonio and Axell, wonderful people , the front office supervisor, so nice. This hotel is proud of their hotel, their city. So amazing. If you want a great NYC experience, advice, a clean, super nice hotel, come here. Great location. By central park. Clean, clean, clean,and a wonderful breakfast. Everyone was so engaging.

title: overnight trip
text: On Monday 1/22 we checked in to the Fairfield inn and was immediately greeted by Millie and Solomon who were fantastic .it took us no time at all to check. We had reserved 2rooms one of my friends was a platinum member and Millie gave us a box with bottled water and cookies. The rooms were immaculate, And plenty big enough for us. We had chosen this hotel because we had tickets to the harry connick show, which we lottery had to walk around the corner  on 57th st. Every time we entered the hotel we were greeted by Solomon  he was great, I would definitely recommend thiss hotel if you want to stay on the upper west side. And the free breakfast was an added bonus and serves something for everyone.

title: Birthday stay
text:
We visited here for 7 days, we booked on a last minute trip to NYC for my birthday. 

We booked for my 30th birthday, I didn't know at the time by my partner has let me know since we have been. He contacted the hotel via email before we arrived, this apparently went through to the main company rather than the hotel. He wanted to advise them that the trip was for my birthday. He was told to contact the hotel directly. Which he did when we arrived, he was told that they didn't have any room service facilities and they could not accommodate anything. This was a real shame really as we've visited NYC 3 times now for my birthday and in the other hotels they have always helped to make the day that little bit more special. 

When we arrived the check in was very smooth and quick. They lady dealing with us was very informative and helpful. 

The room was extremely small and the hotel doesn't appear to have a good view of anything really. The rooms had everything that you needed for the stay, hairdryer, iron and fridge etc. The heating in the room worked really well, we were there when it was minus 15 and it kept us really warm it was just really noisy but we got used to it. All hotels in NYC are small and I have stayed in smaller. 

The room was clean on arrival however I have to say that the maid service has a lot more work to do. Our floor wasn't hovered in the week that we were there, our shower appeared to just be loosely wiped with a cloth, our shampoo etc wasn't replaced every day which was very frustrating. I could continue with the list but there was something missing every day. 

The tea and coffee facility in the room was good (when the items were replaced which didn't always happen).

The breakfast really was Good, there is plenty of choice and they changed the variety of cooked items each day. Items such as scrambled eggs, cheese omelette, bacon, sausage, cereals, fruit, variety of breads..... We both really enjoyed the breakfasts every day. The room does get busy towards the end of each service but if you don't leave it until the last minute the dining room is fairly quiet. 

The hotel is located about a 10-15 minute walk from times square. It's in a fairly quiet location but it is easily accessible to everything. It's a nice a quiet area to get away from noise of the tourist areas. It's about a 10 minute walk from Columbus circle which is opposite central park. 

The nearest subway is 10 minutes walk away. 

There is plenty of places to eat near by all within walking distance. 

Other than the cleanliness of our room within our stay and the poor maid service I would stay at this hotel again!

title: Consigliato!
text: La struttura si trova in una buona posizione, 10 minuti a piedi dalla stazione metro Columbus Circle, quindi ben collegata con i mezzi pubblici e la metro. Niente male la colazione, più propensa al salato che al dolce, buona varietà di frutta e la possibilità di prepararsi dei waffles caldi. Camera piccola ma confortevole, silenziosa e pulita. Staff gentile e disponibile. Ottimo rapporto qualità/prezzo.

title: Very friendly, super clean!
text: This place is a gem in Manhattan.  Everyone on the staff was genuinely friendly, breakfast was incredible for the price and rooms and common areas were 5-star clean, which is critical to a happy stay for me.

title: Customer service off the charts
text: Usually I'm not one to write reviews but I was so impressed with the service here that I felt compelled. I'm a lifetime platinum member with Marriott and have stayed in many luxury properties including a ton of JW Marriotts. The personal service and attention this hotel gives their guests is hands down equivalent, if not better, than any of the luxury properties  mentioned. Melissa and Delilah the agents, and Steve the bellman could not do enough to accommodate me with my special requests. Well done guys. I'll be back!!

title: 4.5 for Sure, Would stay again, excellent to be near hospital or College
text:
I booked this hotel for 2 nights as I wanted to be able to walk to my daughter's apt. on 72 St. if the weather was decent. The rate was good the week I was there, so it made sense.
Room was clean, bathroom good. A bit smaller than 3 other hotels I used while I was without my apartment for a month, but very adequate. Breakfast was very nice. 
Housekeeping didn't replace the coffee/tea for the 2nd day, but a small thing really. I could have gone downstairs to get some I'm sure.
My room was on the 2nd floor with an ugly view. I thought it was odd they gave me this room as they weren't full.

The location is good if you are visiting Mt. Sinai hospital, John Jay College or Lincoln Center. I wouldn't recommend it for people wanting to tour downtown, or upper westside or eastside.

title: Great Stay
text: Spent two nights at this site and loved it.  The King Size bedroom we had was roomy which is not the usual for Manhattan.  The bathroom was really nice and loved the shower.  The free breakfast was one of the best I have ever experienced with hot/cold food varieties to suit most tastes.  The staff are great.  They have this nice bar and lounge that we enjoyed both nights after two Broadway shows.  Highly recommend this place.  Very relaxing.

title: Friendly staff, convenient location and great breakfast!
text:
The room was nice, although the beds seemed kind of small for two.  We had double beds, a little stand alone closet and plenty of USB chargers at almost all outlets!  There was a small pod style Mr. Coffee machine, fine for one cup, in the room.  We stayed for one night because we went to see a show at Lincoln Center, which was within walking distance.    The next morning they gave us a very accommodating late check-out, so we took an Uber to the Museum of Natural History and spent the early afternoon there.  An Uber back got us to the hotel in time to check-out, no fuss, no muss. 

All the employees were very nice, especially the lady at check-in (Spanish, wearing glasses) she took the time to repeat a few items and never seemed annoyed. 

My wife did complain about one thing, it was that the shower was not cleaned very well.  There was hair, both kinds and you could just tell that the cleaning staff probably did nothing more than run the water.  The lighting in the bathroom could have been the issue, because my wife had to point it out to me, I didn't see it originally. The lighting is very dim.

As mentioned in my title, the breakfast was great!  Plenty of food, even when I came down around 9:15am (hours end at 9:30am) there seemed to be enough seating and you could take stuff back to your room too.

title: Very pleasant surprise!
text: I'd like to give it a 4.5.  I chose this one for its proximity to Lincoln Center, and didn't need much more than a bed for the night, but it's a really nice property.  The basement breakfast room and fitness center are both large and modern - that was probably the biggest surprise.  I didn't even know they had free breakfast, let alone such a big nice room.  The property has been renovated.  The lobby is very nice and the room is clean - pretty bathroom, good design.  The staff was great too, both at checkin and for a few questions in the morning.  The parking arrangement is good for the city, a garage under the BMW dealership half a block away.  I've stayed in a number of Marriotts in the city and had never considered this one before, but definitely would return.

title: Everything was perfect!
text: Great deal- $147 for a decent sized room with 2 double beds and free breakfast. Clean room, good shower, quiet toilets. Smart TV with access to internet TV. Free Wi-Fi. Beds were okay- a bit too hard but I've experiences way worse. ALL of the staff members were very, very pleasant! Easily accessible, welcoming bar. Parking is right behind the building and right next to the CBS studios. Reduced rate of $40. Lots of close restaurants. A 10 min $13 Uber ride to the show near Times Square. I have already booked another stay.

title: Nuevo y buen servicio
text:
Estuve en las navidades del 2017 y todo muy bien. El desayuno tipo bufet muy variado y completo. La habitación con cafetera,  nevera, caja fuerte y plancha. Las camas  muy cómodas. 
Lo unico que  tiene que  mejorar es el mantenimiento de los  ascensores que casi siempre había  uno averiado y el aislamiento del  recibidor del  hotel  que con la entrada y salida  de  personas, la puerta dejaba  pasar mucho frio. El hotel no está  en el centro pero esta bien situado.

title: The friendliest staff in town
text:
We stayed at Fairfield Inn for three nights, when our flight was cancelled because of the bad weather. It was clean, cosy, in a good location (walking distance from Hell’s Kitchen / Lincoln Centre / Times Square) and that staff were the friendliest and most helpful we encountered in New York. We didn’t choose the hotel, American Airlines put us up there, but we’d stay there again and recommend it to friends. 

The breakfast buffet is crazy busy if, like most people, you leave it until the latest possible second. But it’s fine, otherwise.

Thank you to the lovely staff who were so sympathetic about us being stranded and did everything they could to accommodate us including a late check out and allowing us to stay in our room until we could get another voucher from the airline (who make you go back to the airport after two nights to get more vouchers and it took ALL DAY... don’t get me started about them. Never again!)

title: Excelente servicio
text: Llegamos pasado navidad y nos quedamos un par de semanas.  El personal es muy cordial y atento, habitación limpia y el desayuno es abundante y variado. Las instalaciones parecen bastante nuevas y queda cercano a la estación Columbus Circle del Subway, lo que te deja muy bien ubicado para llegar donde necesites.

title: Perfect stay
text:
This is more like a boutique hotel and doesn’t feel like part of a chain. Check in was easy. We were welcomed with the most friendly staff I have ever seen (I think her name was Michelle?). Beautiful
smile and made sure to thank us for choosing the hotel. Nice start!  To get onto the elevators for guest rooms you need your guest key. Nice security touch. Room was small but it’s NYC!  Everything was super clean. Nice big screen tv and new everything in the bathroom.  Full hot breakfast in the morning in a very nice large room with anything you could want: fresh fruit, yogurts, breads, cereals, oatmeal, eggs, omelets (pre- made), waffles (DIY with Belgium waffle maker), pastries, coffee, tea...all included. Check out was as easy and friendly as check in. No long lines!

title: The hotel has potential to be improved but...
text:
We stayed there in December and it was very cold in the room. Unfortunately there are no heaters and the air con was super loud, making it impossible to use while sleeping. The ventilation was only 3 options: low, high and auto. All were the same noisy.
There's a lot of street noise in the rooms facing the street. The others may be better. 

The staff is great. They went above and beyond to solve the issue with the room(s). Everyone was very kind, nice and trying their best to offer the best services. I was very impressed by the quality of client service.

The room is big enough and clean.

Breakfast is simply terrible and feels super cheap (plastic forks and knives?!).

The hotel could have great potential if some things would be fixed, such as ventilation, better sound proof windows and a better quality breakfast.

Tip:  I wouldn't pay for the breakfast - better choose cafe Rex, 5 mins away with great coffee, croissants and sandwiches.

title: FANTASTICA MANHATTAN
text: Pulito, funzionale, moderno e confortevole. Ottimo e abbondante il buffet di colazione. Per Manhattan il rapporto qualità/prezzo è molto buono. Con 16 piani e soltanto due ascensori si crea molto traffico nelle ore di punta. Se dovessi tornare a NY tornerei sicuramente in questo Hotel.

title: Inexpensive but Nice & Clean
text: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It looks like this is relatively a new one and very clean. I liked the laminate wood floor in the room and free breakfast. I had stayed at Hyatt and Hilton hotels in New York before. But this Fairfield Inn is better than those hotels. The only problem was that I felt cold during sleep even with high temperature setting. Nevertheless, we will stay here again when we visit New York again.

title: Excelente opción con desayuno incluido!
text: Muy buena ubicación, cercano al Central Park. El desayuno incluido lo diferencia de muchos alojamientos en Nueva York. Excelente servicio en el desayuno, con opciones para celíacos y la excepcional atención de Guillermo, dispuesto a colaborar e incluso a asesorar sobre alternativas para visitar la ciudad!

title: Hotel muito bom, excelente atendimento, café da manhã e serviços muito bons
text:
Hotel muito bom, novo, funcionários atenciosos, café da manhã bem servido, localização muito boa  e tranquila, a duas quadras da avenida próxima mais movimentada.
O quarto é um pouco mais apertado que o normal, mas acho que isso é normal de NY. O destaque fica por conta dos funcionarios do hotel, muito atenciosos. Café da manhã bem servido, com muitas opções, mas lá pelo quarto dia já vai se enjoando, o que é normal. 
O serviço de limpeza vai de acordo com o que vc dá de gorjeta pra equipe de limpeza. A debil mental da minha irma deu 1 dolar de gorjeta (o que é uma ofensa) pra camareira sem eu ver e acredito que tenham é jogado sujeira no chao do quarto, pois estava muito mais sujo do que quando saimos. Mas no outro dia deixei 25 dolares e o quarto ficou brilhando. There's no free lunch in NY... então, se for dar gorjeta baixa, melhor nem dar, o segredo é lá pelo segundo ou terceiro dia dar uma boa gorjeta, que ai já dao A faxina no quarto e ai ficam caprichando nos dias seguintes, esperando a proxima "bolada"...

title: Great Stay
text: We stayed at the Fairfield Inn Central Park for five nights at the end of November. The location was great. I could walk everywhere I wanted to go, but I also always walk long distances when in NYC. The staff was super friendly and made us feel welcomed. There was only one bartender on each night, so the wait for a drink would take some time. The bartender was also the person going downstairs to get your food. Other than this small detail, our stay was enjoyable and look forward to returning.

title: Anniversary/Visit
text: Getting away and visiting family and celebrating our anniversary my husband and I was very pleased to have our stay at this hotel, boutique type with not so much hassle.  Our stay was pleasant, the breakfast (even though it open so early) had plenty of variety and a good selection.  The room was clean and upgraded, kind of cozy.  Also, I had issues booking my return to the airport and Steven from the Front Desk took good care of us.  The surrounding area was very good.  Next time in town I will definitely stay here again.  Oh and they took good care of my husband with his bad knee, they came over and gave him a bag of ice and helped us to get a lower floor for him.

title: Hotel Propre, mais c'est bien tout !
text:
Bon accueil mais ,2 Ascenseurs seulement pour 18 étages et des centaines de chambres le matin au petit déjeuner (très copieux et varié) c'est très long...remonter idem.
Ensuite la chambre 18m2 tout au plus pour 21 annoncé  ,Pas de penderie tiroirs , vous laissez tout dans vos valises en fait , pas de coffre, lit King size annoncé, en fait c'est 1m60 ...alors que c'est 1M80 king size sur booking...
Emplacement pas mal peut mieux faire et quartier Mort le soir.

title: Great stay
text: Nice, clean hotel centrally located within walking distance Columbus Circle, Central Park and other attractions.  Very good breakfast buffet and value. Area is not as busy, hectic or loud as other city areas.

title: Chambre propre et assez spacieuse - bloc de climatiseurs très bruyants côté cour
text:
Chambre propre et assez spacieuse mais donnant sur un mur (côté cour donc) et un bloc de climatiseurs très bruyants : Prévoir des boules Quies !
Le petit déjeuner est correct et varié.
Le personnel de la réception est très aimable. 
Un peu loin de la station de métro Columbus Circle.

title: Nice hotel in a good location
text: We spent a night at the Fairfield before catching a cruise leaving from NYC. Checking in was easy and efficient. The buffet breakfast the next morning was straightforward. All of the staff we encountered were pleasant.

title: Clean,  Well Run, Great Breakfast, Prices Vary Dramatically
text: This Fairfield Inn in NY has small well appointed rooms, a great staff, and an excellent breakfast.  The prices for rooms vary greatly depending on the day of the week, and what the traffic will bear.  A small room with a king bed can be $109, or $340.    I will stay here again if the pricing is right.  I needed a late check-out; no problem.  It was adjusted from 11am to 2pm.

title: Great Stay
text:
I love trying out different Marriott properties while in the city, and once again, I wasn't disappointed.

LOCATION-
This hotel is conveniently located in a quieter part of the city on 58th St between 10th and 11th Ave, which makes it a convenient walk over to Columbus Circle, whether that be for some shopping or to make your way into Central Park. In other directions, but still very reachable by foot, are Lincoln Center, Carnegie Hall, as well as the Theatre District if you're catching a Broadway show. Subway lines are near if you need to venture out further. And after spending all day in the city, I almost always need to stop into Duane Reade before heading back to the room... happy to find one right around the corner. 

STAFF-
Always helpful and courteous. Totally appreciate being able to check-in early.

ROOMS-
Very clean and comfortable. Decent size (see photos). Some might refer to them as small, but I have definitely stayed in smaller while in NYC. I have no complaints about this one. I would definitely stay here again. Great rate, as well. 

Note:
Complimentary breakfast, but I'd recommend walking around and finding all the other options the city has to offer. And if you don't want to spend much on meals, there is a Strokos Deli on the corner of 10th that'll whip up something fresh for ya at a very reasonable price.

title: Comodo pulito ma se siete più di 2 è sconsigliato
text:
Hotel recentemente ristrutturato, posizione non centralissima ma comoda, servizi ottimo, pulizia ottima
Le camere un po piccoline, per 3 persone sono scomode, i letti sono piccolini armadio quasi assente, al massimo puoi mettere 2 camice
Rapporto qualità prezzo buono
Comunque sono stato bene 
Ho letto recensioni sulla rumorosità dell’aria condizionata effettivamente si un po’ rumorosa lo è, ma basta spegnerla
Colazione buona e abbondante

title: Good Location for walking to Lincoln Center
text:
Stayed here to attend several events at Lincoln Center. Easy walk to the Center, Columbus Circle and Central Park.

Rooms very small, kind of dark, with little storage.

Front Desk staff were very helpful. Breakfast offerings were good.

title: Good value hotel, nothing more, nothing less
text:
Booking: Booked through Marriott Direct for a 1-night stay to watch tennis at the US Open

Location: 10-minute walk from the nearest subway station

Check-In and Lobby: Standard lobby with courteous staff present and available to check us into our room. They did not recognize my status however. Free breakfast is available and was offered to us even on our early check-in. Guests will need to come early as it gets packed.

The Room: Double bed room which was suitable for our stay. There was construction noise as we were facing the street, the sleep quality was affected

Amenities: I requested two amenity kits, however barely 1 was provided

Cons: The sleep quality could've been better but I was not expecting much since it was a 1-night stay

Final Verdict: Will book a different hotel next time, either SPG, or full service Marriott

title: Confortevolissimo!
text: Siamo stati 6 notti in questo hotel... scelta ottima. La camera non è grandissima, ma giusta... quella con vista è d’atmosfera, quindi vale la pena la differenza di prezzo. Letto comodissimo, Bagno perfetto e ben attrezzato, tutto molto nuovo. Unica pecca della camera l’armadio minuscolo (50 cm massimo) in cui non ci sta tutta la roba. Colazione ricca, varia e ottima (raro per nyc). Per la metro ci sono 8-10 min di strada (columbus circle), ma va bene, perchè comunque in bella zona, vicino central park e una via con bei ristoranti. Consigliatissimo.

title: Amazing Staff
text: Wow is all I can say about the front desk staff!! What an amazing group! Made us feel right at home! Senia was our favorite. Traveling with 2 kids alone is not easy but she made us feel like we were the only guests in the hotel! Rooms are small but spotless!! Upgraded rooms, clean & comfortable. We will be back!!

title: Niente male
text:
Ci siamo appena stati per un lungo Week end: hotel a 10 minuti a piedi da Central Park e dalla stazione della metro a Columbus.
Personale gentile, colazione discreta e camere non molto grandi, ma moderne, con parquet, due grandi letti e molto pulite.
In zona ci sono molti locali, supermercato e farmacia.
Credo sia stata una buona scelta in una zona non particolarmente trafficata.

title: excellent emplacement
text:
Hôtel très bien situé et au calme . A 10 mn de marche de columbus circle,parfait pour organiser ses déplacements. Petits dejeuners très complets,choix varié, fruits frais,vaisselle et couverts jetables on ne risque pas de se blesser avec les couteaux!!
personnel d'une très grande gentillesse, propreté irreprochable,chambres confortables mais très peu de rangement.

title: lack of storage space
text: Courteous staff and clean rooms that characterize Marriot properties. The rooms lack drawers and  a reasonably sized closet for storage. Rooms a bit small but this is Manhatten. This hotel is fine if you have a short stay or only a small amount of luggage but not so much if you have a lot of luggage.You will have to walk a bit to get to the subway or cross town buses.

title: Für eine Übernachtung
text:
Ok da der Schlafkomfort gut ist
Die Lage ist ebenfalls gut , aber das Preis Leistungsverhältnis ist an der Grenze
Für ein Frühstück würde ich eines der Diner bevorzugen die rund um das Hotel zu finden sind
Das GYM ist für ein kleines Workout perfekt
Nach nur 2 Jahren sieht man schon vielfältig die Spuren der sogenannten
Bettenwechsel

title: Excellent family stay in Manhattan
text: Stayed for 3 days earlier this week.  Excellent experience.  Staff is PHENOMENAL.  This is a very well run hotel.  everyone had an awesome, helpful attitude. Property was tidy and well kept.  Venezuelan lady at the front desk was super friendly and helpful.  Worked with out kid situation and made our stay awesome.  excellent breakfast too.

title: Great Experience at this Hotel
text:
How do I love thee?  Let me count the ways…

Daniel.  Wow!!  He got us into Amarone Ristorante on a Saturday night because I was too discombobulated to have made a reservation ahead of time.  Food was excellent.  Lovely restaurant, lovely evening, all due to Daniel.

Marx!  Always available to get me a cab and anything else I needed.  Marx was reliable, always at the front desk, never did I need to search for him, met my every need.

Delilah! Called her from the airport:  I did not have my purse.  She contacted my driver, got my purse, sent it home to me.  Delightful young woman and determined to help me in my hour of need.

Millie!  Great manager.  Always on top of things.  She’s either really good at modeling superb customer service or she’s really good at hiring superb employees.  Or both!

There were other staff that were great too, but sadly, I cannot remember their names.  The staff made phone calls for me, provided directions and suggestions to cafes and grocers, and were consistently, immediately available to help me.

Also, must not forget Justin in the cafeteria downstairs.  He took care of me whether I was hunting for bananas, oatmeal, or whatever I needed.  

More than anything, the staff made me feel I had a home away from home.  Every hotel in the Marriot chain provides superb service, but this staff went beyond the polite and helpful—they made me feel I was a part of their “home.”

Finally, the room, though tiny (NYC real estate is tight) it was very clean.  Breakfast downstairs was okay.  Wish they'd replace the oatmeal with steel-cut oats; wish they'd replace the sugary cereals with plain high-fiber Cheerios.  Coffee was excellent!

title: Good hotel but a little far from Times Square
text:
Very nice hotel. People at the reception were very helpful. The room was clean and the free breakfast very good. It's just that you have to walk a bit to get to the nearest subway or Times square.
But I would recommand it for sure.

title: Perfect for stay
text: Just as the other reviews state, this is a conveniently located, well priced, clean and safe hotel with an eager and helpful staff. One of the best FFI’s I’ve stayed in. The closet is very small, and most of the narrow space is consumed by a full size ironing board--is this really necessary? Maybe so, but expect that you won’t be hanging many clothes. The small room is clean and the bed was comfy. The neighborhood was safe and very walkable to Central Park and lots of restaurants. Just a good economic choice if you have to travel to Manhattan. I’d stay again.

title: Clean great staff location just ok
text: Property is very clean, staff excellent. Breakfast absolutely ok but it's the standard Fairfield fare. Yes, rooms are small and the elevators take forever but it's NYC.  Two drawbacks, it's a solid 10 minute walk from the only nearby subway (Columbus Circle) and the restaurant selection in the area is pretty average.  For business travel it isn't my first choice but if you're on vaca the proximity to Central Park and the quiet of the neighborhood (shockingly little traffic on this cross street compared to locations further east) could make this a great choice.

title: Nice
text: Very clean, great staff, delicious breakfast. Lots of close restaurants in walking distance. The rooms are small, but it sells as a European type hotel. The rooms were quiet. We would stay here again.

title: Convenient Location - Friendly Staff
text:
This was my first real visit to NYC and really didn't know the geography that well.  I am a frequent Marriott customer and decided on this location because it seemed central to what we wanted to go and visit.  We made a great choice.  It really is only 8-10 blocks from Times Square, a few blocks from Central Park.  Its located on a quiet street.

The staff was very friendly and attentive whenever we had questions or needed directions.  

The only thing you have to get used to is the price of hotels in NYC.  We paid $320  night for a room that would cost us $80 a night in the midwest.  

The location is key though and made it more cost effective to get where we needed.

title: Pleasantly surprised
text:
As some reviewers have pointed out the hotel rooms are a little small. But it’s Manhattan; space is limited everywhere! And what the room lacks in space it makes up for in style and functionality. 

But the real reason to stay here is the staff. Everyone from the front desk to the breakfast room to housekeeping could not have been more friendly and welcoming. I would happily stay here again!

title: Exceptional staff, close to Central Park, extensive breakfast.
text:
Stayed there for 6 nights. After a red eye flight, I arrived at the hotel early in the morning, hoping to just drop off my suit case until check in time.  Instead,  they offered me a room to check into, so comforting. Staff remained exceptionally accommodating throughout my 6 day stay.
