The 'view' room looked out to a street, a large grass field and other buildings. It was quiet and bright, size was just adequate for one, small for two.The room had a modern design, Bathroom was very small, shower only, no bathtub and little space to put toiletries. 
I really enjoyed the expansive breakfast. It had something for everyone, from little omelets and sausages to waffles to fruit and yoghurt, albeit all consumed on paper plates with plastic utensils. Being a tropical fruit fan, I especially liked the cut assortment of melon and cantalope.  The hotel is a safe and easy ten minute walk from Columbus Circle,  which is a major metro station and shopping Center next to Central Park. I was surprised to find a huge Whole Foods market there. Columbus circle has easy subway JFK connections. I took the subway both ways. The short Walk to Central Park and the walking distance to major attractions in and around Central Park, to Broadway, to major shoipping areas etc. really made the trip enjoyable. I bought a 7 day metro pass and ended up using it very little, as I walked almost everywhere. I would definitely stay at this hotel and this area of New York again.

title: Loved it.. Excellent service
text:
We stayed here for one night. The customer service was top notch. From check in to the bar service. They kept us informed as to when our room would be ready and holding luggae until our room was ready.

We got a late check out, so could come back before our train ride home.

The room was nice, bed was very comfortable.

Our only issue was the rude people that would smoke right outside of the bar and it would drift over to the patio area. Mentioned it to the staff and they said something right away!

title: Great find near Port
text: Just stayed one night but staff was friendly and helpful and room, all be it small, was contemporary and comfortable. Our only complaint was how loud the air conditioning was. It worked just fine, but boy, was it blowing really loud all night. We had nice laminate wood floors, a sleek bathroom and a small fridge. Breakfast was included but it was mass produced cheap food. It is exactly what you should expect at a Fairfield but we still went around the corner for Starbucks. Overall, this was pleasant stay and I would recommend this place for a decent experience. Also, great views from the top floors!

title: Close to 59th and Columbus Circle Subway
text:
Excellent stay , Hotwire Paid 500$/ 4 nights includes all taxes and fees. Bought an unlimited subway pass at LGA and rode the Subway like a lot of other New Yorkers. At rush hours the trains are very busy just like anywhere else. Just be prepared to ride the Subway  Still better than sitting in a Parking Lot with an UBER ride. Saw a lot in four days,maybe 25% of all the things to see in the NYC.Went to Yankee Stadium, also Citi Field for the Amazing Mets. First trip to NYC,would not change a thing.
 
  Have zero complaints about the hotel. Staff,rooms,everything was excellent. 
 Yes the WIFI was slow during peak times,to be expected.

title: Nice friendly stay over n the Big Apple
text: Nice and friendly check in by Daniel. Room on the 15th floor away from the hustle and bustle that us New York. Nice selection for breakfast with everything you need to set you up for a day exploring. True lifts struggled but on holiday so no rush. We walked to Times Square. All in all a good stay. Only one niggle was, for a new hotel, why is the air con so LOUD - we had to turn it off so we could sleep and then we got hot.

title: Disappointing, not up to Marriott usual standards
text: We were surprised at they inadequacy of this facility based on reviews we read and the Marriott brand. The hotel admitted to us they were still working out the kinks because they had been open less than a year, but some will never be resolved. The rooms are small, even by New York standards. Shockingly, their is only very limited space for clothing. There is a wardrobe, about 15 inches wide to hang clothes, that you have to share with the ironing board. Maybe you can hang 5 or 6 things in there. But even more shocking they have no bureau to put your folded clothes!!!. Look at site photos carefully. The room is so small, one can't fit. The TV rests on a long narrow table. You have to pile your clothes on it. In all my trips to NY I have never anything like it. The bathroom is also small. And there was room for my wife's toiletries, not mine. The bed is comfortable, but the AC is extremely loud. The breakfast buffet is average, by NY standards, I have had better and worse. The breakfast room was poorly organized. And, they used paper plates, napkins and cups, and plastic utensils, all of that going into the landfill. Not environmentally friendly at all. We were disappointed in the maid service. One afternoon we came back to our room at 3:20pm and the room had not been made up. When we called the desk, they said rooms were cleaned in random order from 9 am to 4:30 pm. Never heard of that either. Elevators were slow, only 2 for 18 floors, 226 rooms, and no staff elevator. Lobby was small too, when a big group came in, we had trouble getting thru to the elevator. Everything mentioned in here would be echoed with the other couple we traveled with and by other people we spoke with and overheard. The glowing reviews make no sense to us. Oh and by the way, don't let the hotel name fool you. There are no suites, we asked, so you can't upgrade. The name is their trade name. The average rate we paid with taxes was $400 a night. Not bad for NY, but the value is not there.

title: Fantastico
text:
He estado en este hotel la semana pasada y la experiencia ha sido fabulosa.
Cuenta con todas las comodidades.

Un Gimnasio muy bien equipado y nuevo
Habitaciones nuevas y comodas, con camada muy comoda.

La atención de 10, y sobretodo Daniel, un chico en recepción que me ayudó en todo lo que necesité.
Como punto menos favorable diria que la boca de metro más cercana esta un poco alejada pero se peude ir andando sin problemas,
La zona con mucho restaurantes y centrica.
Desayuno gratuito y abundante.

Volvería sin dudar

title: Very clean and friendly staff
text: Stayed here a total of 6 nights. A lot of things were great; the comfy bed, the super-friendly staff and the cleanliness of it all. Some annoying points were the very slow elevators, the rooms were cramped even though the bed was king size but it took most of the room, the air-condition was loud and the breakfast selection was very basic. Location is a little off to the corner I felt but it was a few blocks to columbus circle which was ok. I'd recommend getting a room on a lower floor since you can easily walk down without having to resort to the elevator and there aren't amazing views anyway. And again, the staff, cleaning, breakfast and lobby, were all friendly and nice and always helped in any request I had. Also, laundry may be a little expensive for some so I'd suggest getting it down on your own outside the hotel.

title: Bed bug bites!
text:
While concierge who checked us in was nice, the stay was far from pleasant. I woke up with bed bug bites all over from sleeping in the room beds. Hotel room was on cellar/basement floor, which made it damp and prime location for insects. Stay away if you're at any way claustrophobic!

I've emailed the GM, and have still not received a response. Stay at other hotels at all costs!

title: Nuevo y limpio. Excelente atención
text:
Muy buen hotel, a 20 minutos caminando de Central Park y de Time Square, limpio, nuevo y con una excelente atención por parte del personal. Muy buena opción para viajar a Manhatan. Calle tranquila, aunque por la noche se queda muy solitaria.
El desayuno es correcto, pero se echan en falta algunas cosas, como fiambres y quesos.

title: Clean,Friendly staff
text:
Location : 3.5/5 , it is centrally located but neighborhood is not that clean
Rooms:3/5 Rooms are small (we booked a 2 king size bed ) but had all the amenities and are clean
Staff: 4.5/5 Super friendly
Breakfast:4/5 a good protein breakfast but I suggest a change in menu

title: Top notch staff
text:
I am giving this place 5 stars because of the impeccable service and professionalism of the staff.

Mainly, housekeeping gets a huge nod. I left an item in the room, and didn't even realize it until the next day. Normally, when I call I get a blank "we looked but didn't find anything" response. But this time, the head of housekeeping, Janet Yarde, confirmed the item I had left was returned and in her care. She even shipped it back to me, once she received the mailing label. 

A huge thank you to housekeeping staff and Janet for their honesty and their help! 

Everyone from the front desk staff, bell boy, and breakfast attendants were wonderful.

Other positives: location was ideal. Very close to West Side highway for easy access, and very close to Columbus Circle/Central Park. I've stayed in Times Sq/Penn station area, and this location is so much nicer.

The rooms are clean, although very small. But who stays in their hotel room while in NYC?
 
This hotel has such a great value for free breakfast, location, and service!

My family and I would love to stay here again!

title: Nice, Clean, friendly staff!
text: The hotel is nice and clean with friendly staff. We enjoyed our stay however I would give five star if this could be little more closer to Times Square such as Double Tree by Hilton. The breakfast is pretty nice too!

title: rien à dire
text: cet hôtel est parfait je le recommande, , chambre nettoyée tous les jours, petit déjeuner copieux , le personnel agréable et serviable ,emplacement ideal, l'hotel est neuf nous avons vraiment apprécié  notre séjour a New york

title: Excellent service
text: Stayed one night. The customer service was excellent. The gentleman at the front desk was very kind to switch our rooms when we discovered after settling in for the night that the king bed would not work for us and he switched us to a room with double beds. Very grateful. Rooms are definitely small but clean and modern and had everything you need. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly especially the breakfast staff. One gentleman who was cleaning up was especially helpful and cheery in the morning. Again I don't remember his name . Shame on me I really should write everyone's names down next time. The breakfast room was surprisingly large given it was NYC and I have stayed at many other Fairfield Inns, so even though there were a lot of people in the room it didn't feel too crowded. Location was perfect for us. Right near where we needed to be. Easy walk to Columbus Circle. I would definitely stay here again.

title: Great find in Manhattan near Central Park
text: I've stayed a few places in Manhattan and this place is a great value and looks new. The rooms are updated an new. Very clean and comfortable. The breakfast that is included is great too! About a 40 minute Uber ride from LaGuardia. I've made this my "go to" hotel when I com to NY. Staff is always super accommodating and friendly! This hotel is a great find!

title: Impressed
text:
First of all, I am surprised to see how clean it is. We came in the morning as I requested since my daughter was going to watch a concert two blocks away at Terminal 5. She needed to get in line real quick before the line became impossible.  After leaving her in line, I went back and was able to get a room as early as 12 noon.  Of course being a Marriott member helped tremendously.  Now remember. For Manhattan, NY, space is a commodity.  My room was small but I am impressed with how the amenities of the room were up to Marriott Standards.  Service. Impeccable. the front desk esp Melissa at the front desk was very helpful when my daughter had her emergency - 2 hours before checkout time.  She knew where to point me to.  The Bathroom was very clean and I do love the shower head as it was large enough.  Breakfast was plentiful and one did have a lot of choices - the menu was continental.  Oh and there was also a pot of coffee beside the front desk for the better part of the morning.  My room also had three to four of those electrical plugs that also had a USB port for charging and the switch for the lamp beside it.  I really find these very handy!!  The bed was most especially comfortable and the thermostat worked fine. My daughter slept for 12 hours!!  There were also food and drinks (soda and water) available from the fridge beside the front desk and a microwave behind the front desk.  As my daughter missed breakfast, I was able to get a lasagna from the fridge, heat it up and bring it to her.  

All in all, in a city where there are almost 400+ hotels competing.  I think I will be coming back here.  The hotel employees I notice are working hard to keep this hotel competitive. Kudos to all of them

title: Nice, Modern hotel!
text: This hotel is really nice! The staff was very helpful despite how busy they were when we arrived. The rooms were small, but the staff let us know in advanced so it wasn't a shock to us. It's a decent location but nothing a little walking couldn't fix. We were there for a concert and the venue was only a five minute walk so that was a BIG plus! Overall, I would stay here again.

title: NYC trip with grandkids
text: Getting to the hotel was real easy for half of the group uber and otherhalf left hanging for 1 hr and finally taking taxi because uber became obnoxious. when ot to hotel staff was great they pared rooms right next to each other even not requested when we had made reservations separately. They gave our birthday girl a few cuocakes and later the next day when we got a cake for her and were outside on their deck they came with plates and utensils and also gave us ice cream for the group. the rooms were always neat clean organized. Great breakfast every morning and the staff were always helpful and very polite.

title: Great Value for NYC
text:
We found this hotel to be a great value for the location and the breakfast which is included. Although our room was small, we did have a view with a large window. New hotel so furnishings are very clean and working well. Full tub/shower but sink is airplane bathroom size. Front desk very friendly and helpful. Only 2 elevators, so a long wait to get one. We gave up waiting for one after breakfast and climbed the 11 flights of stairs back to our room. Breakfast was good with scrambled eggs and make your own waffles. A little crowded and noisy for just waking up but at least we left the hotel already fed.
 Mt. Sinai Hospital is a few blocks away so can here the ambulance sirens with windows closed. You do need to walk past what looks like a homeless shelter to get to midtown  but the rest of the area was fine. This is NYC and probably a good lesson to remember there are many people who have far bigger problems than walking a few blocks to midtown for dinner. Overall a great stay.

title: Winner on the West Side
text:
New hotel and bargain-priced for NYC.  Rooms are European-size (small), but this is the trend among recently built hotels in destination cities.  Rooms were Marriott standard clean (very clean).  The staff was professional, but too many standing around with seemingly nothing to do.  Bar/lounge is very small, but there is an outdoor patio to enjoy a cocktail. 
Downside:2 elevators for a 17-floor hotel makes no sense to me

title: Excellence
text: My wife, son and I stayed here July 16th and 17th.  This was truly one of the best experiences I have had staying at a hotel.  All the staff at this hotel were wonderful and made sure we had everything we needed to enjoy our stay.  The room was a little small but I expected that going to New York where space is at a premium.  The room was very clean and comfortable.  The included breakfast was very good as well.  The location is very convenient to Times Square, Central Park, the Intrepid, etc.  This Fairfield Inn will be our first choice when we return in the fall.

title: Atrocious Customer Service
text: We booked this hotel expecting they would offer the minimal courtesy and great service you get from other Marriott hotels around the world. Well, this was a huge disappointment. Some at front desk seemed purposefully rude and condescending at every chance (a male named Axel; a female african-american (no name badge) on Aug. 9 in the morning; another person named Castellano, to mention a few). They stood in sharp contrast with their more afable and courteous colleagues (namely breakfast staff, housekeeping) in their lack of courtesy and unprofessional behavior. We will not book this hotel ever again nor will we recommend it to colleagues or friends. Very disappointing stay.

title: Ok for the money
text:
Place is new. Rooms are small but clean. Stayed 2 nights. Sheets were not changed.
One of the elevators did not work. Had to wait for 10 minutes and than walk 10 floors down.
Breakfast is included in the rate. If you are not picky, you can find something to eat. 
Location is good. Very close to 5th avenue, Central Park and Times Square.

title: Good Value
text:
Nice modern rooms but fair from main attractions. 

Rooms are well decorated and rate is good compared to other hotels in the same level., specially if you are staying on business or on short stay. 

I stay only for 1 night as lay over due to flight cancellation.

title: Great experience
text: The staff was absolutely amazing.  The only issue we had was a very rowdy room with more than several people in it next to us who partied into the early morning (probably due to the Phish tour at MSG).  We understand this type of situation is hard to control, especially in New York.  But it did impact our otherwise excellent experience.  We will definitely stay there again when we return to the city.

title: Great hotel to a great price
text: Great hotel to a good price. Wonderful staff! Nice and clean. Would  absolutely recommend it, and I will definitely stay there next time I visit New York. Big plus that breakfast is included, and the fitness room is very nice and clean.

title: Wonderful Stay
text:
We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights on July 28 to the 31, 2017. 

Our flight into the city was very early and we were very happy they could accommodate us upon check in. Our room was very clean, updated and comfortable. The room was also very quiet. 

The location of the hotel is perfect! Really close to train station, Central Park and Time Square, Broadway. 

The hotel also has a bar in the lobby and a very nice patio where guests can enjoy a drink while sitting outside. My husband and I both really appreciated this area as it was a quiet place to unwind while being outdoors. 

The breakfast at the hotel was simply wonderful and delicious. There is plenty of food and options for everyone. 

The highest compliment I have on this hotel is for the staff. The staff were so very nice and polite! Always ready to help, smile and have a pleasant comment to say. I don't know how they can be in such a happy mood all the time, but they were and it was very welcoming. 

I would definetly recommend this hotel to anyone planning a trip to the city.

title: Great staff and clean rooms
text:
I was staying here for 10 days, when I checked into the hotel the receptionist was amazing and the manager was even more helpful as I had a baby cot with me. They moved me to a bigger room the very next day as some of the room can be small. 
Every staff member we spoke to were amazing, happy to help with a smile. 

The hotel is located in a quiet street which is nice as the city can get noisy. We were situated near Hell's Kitchen which is great as there are many good restaurants within 10 mins walk. 

Central Park and whole foods are about 10 min walk, the subway is close by also. 
Other reviewers said that there are homeless people but your going to find them everywhere and all over the world, they didn't bother us at all. 

The breakfast is included, where they have hot dishes like bacon, eggs, sausages and waffles. 

I would highly recommend this hotel for anyone, it's not a 5 star hotel but it has 5 star staff. 

Thank you guys for making our stay amazing.

title: Very nice and great location
text: Front desk staff is very friendly and efficient ! Rooms are nice, though small but normal for New York. Breakfast is included and good, breakfast staff gives exceptional service. There are various restaurants within Walking distance as well as shopping locations. I would definitely stay here again or recommend !

title: Comfort and value in NYC
text:
My family (husband, myself, and 2 boys) stayed here for 2 nights on a July weekend.  We were extremely happy with our stay and would ABSOLUTELY stay here again!  The location is wonderful- close to the subway at Columbus Circle and close to Central Park.  There are great restaurants nearby as well.  
The hotel was extremely clean and the staff was friendly.  They also had a great breakfast!  Yes, the rooms are a bit small- it's NYC.

title: Nice modern clean hotel
text:
This was a nice new hotel in a decent location near Columbus Circle. Very clean, staff was very friendly at check in and in breakfast area. Breakfast had something for all. Eggs, meats, waffles, yogurts, muffins, etc.

   Check in and breakfast staff was very friendly and helpful.  Breakfast 
was nice, something for everyone.  

As pointed out in the reviews, these are very small rooms...we have had cruise ship cabins bigger.  Not a lot of room for luggage. Don't think about sneaking a third child in the room unless a small child that can fit in double bed.  They can not offer rollaway, as there is no room to put a rollaway.

We felt safe walking in this area, there is a block on 58th with some homeless people, but never felt unsafe. Quite a few decent restaurants within walking distance.

We were able to load and unload at curb both time with no problem.  Parking was available with a hotel discount around corner, do not forget to have hotel validate something at check out. 

 We totally forgot and my husband picked up van and didnt realize what rate should have been and was charged $150 for less than 48 hours.  We didn't realize this until we we on way home.  Would be nice if they validated at check in and you could put with your car claim ticket so you wouldn't forget.

Elevator service needs to be improved. I am not sure if there is a way for housekeeping to get their supplies to their floors before breakfast time.  There was a huge line for elevator only for them to use a whole elevator for employees while large group of guests had to wait.  

Next elevator was another 5-7 minutes, we got on but there were still at least a dozen behind us that were still waiting. Also, the design on bathrooms, not a good one.  Glass shower windows look nice, but not family friendly when one in shower and 2 boys needing toliet. 

Other than these few things, if in the area we would definitely stay  here again.

title: Great location
text: Very good location, near the Columbus Circle and Central Park. We could go by foot to  Times Square, Broadway, Juilliard's and many good restaurants, beside this they have the best hotel breakfast we've had in NYC. Very good staff, mainly Daniel, the front desk. He was very funny and lovely. I'd like to stay there the next time I go back to NYC.

title: Modern, clean, organized, location and friendly staff + value for money
text: Recently stayed here for 3 nights and 99% praise. The only catch are that there are only two elevators so during busy times you'll have to wait up to 10 minutes. For the rest - a great place. Clean and new, I had a room on the 18th floor with a nice view - unique for Manhattan in general. And the rate - value for money.

title: Exceptional front desk staff!
text:
I stayed only one night at the hotel but can recommend it.
It is clean and very well located for a reasonable price.

The only shortcoming is the loud  outdoor unit of the AC which can make your stay problematic if you are a light sleeper. 
Front desk staff was very very kind and helped me with everything I needed during my stay and arranging for a taxi to the airport,
Friday afternoon search for a taxi can really be an adventure since they have a flat rate and not all are willing to drive.
Thank you!

title: A essayer
text:
Chambre très propre et assez spacieuse n 1404 mais donnant sur le bloc de climatisation de l'immeuble en face donc très bruyant car nous dormions avec celle de notre chambre éteinte et vu sur un mur mais à New York on ne vit pas dans sa chambre mais moins de bruit aurait été apprécié . 
Le petit déjeuner est très correct et varié.
Et le personnel de la réception très aimable . 
 A 20 mn de la station de métro Colombus, c'est assez loin surtout le soir en rentrant

title: Great Place and Affordable
text: I stayed at the Fairfield for a conference in NYC and I loved the place. Not too presumptuous and the rooms not too small as is the norm in the city. The staff were cordial and very professional and willing to help and answer any questions you may have. Though my stay was short, three nights, I really enjoyed it.   I would recommend this hotel because it also has easy access to both Taxis and the Subway system.

title: Modern and nice hotel
text:
This hotel is from 2014 and therefore very new, modern and clean. 
Lot of positive things . The room is nice and beds excellent. The bathroom nice and the room have everything needed. There is a bar/ and nice sitting options outside . There is wok breakfast - but a lot of people
The staff is nice and servicemindef. The girl in the bar, Daniel at the reception and many more. There is also a fine fitness room 
Some have written it not a safe area. We think for sue it is - and very quiet. But be aware there is 2,5 block to the nearest metro
There is a few issues . The rooms a small . We stay 2 Ina room with two Quenn beds. There was not much space for luggage and for sue NOT additional people in the room. The doors are really "slamming" and the hotel should do something about this
But a really nice stay -and value for money

title: Good deal for NYC
text: This place is so clean, new and welcoming. Of course the rooms are on the small side but they are very user-friendly. Large shower stall. Mini fridge in room. Free breakfast. Within walking distance to Central Park, Lincoln Center, etc. We will definitely stay here again.

title: Great stay!  Great deal!
text: We just returned from a weekend stay in New York at the Fairfield Inn Central Park.  The hotel is new, modern, clean and very conveniently located near Columbus Circle!  We were in a 2-bed room, which was a little tight, but the beds were amazing and the bathroom spotless!  The free breakfast was well stocked with hot and cold options.  Staff was very helpful.  Would definitely stay here again!

title: Summer week in Manhattan
text:
The hotel is clean and the team are friendly, it has a nice little bar with happy hour. Breakfast is included, short hours, but is very popular. Rooms are updated, we stayed on a double, barely enough space for more than 2 pieces of luggage.
The location is good, several dinners and restaurants around, metro is 3 blocks away at Columbus circle. The picture is from our room at the 8th floor.
Very good overall.

title: My new favorite NYC hotel!
text: Rarely do I ever rave about an NYC hotel, but this one is fantastic!  Great location and in a quieter area.  The staff is amazing!  Every employee I came in contact with was personable, extremely nice and very helpful. I love that all the rooms have hardwood floors instead of carpet.  Room was very clean and nice.  Breakfast is included.  They have a huge space in the basement for breakfast.  We were very impressed.  Eggs, waffles, sausage and veggie sausage, cereals...the list goes on and on.  There's only 2 elevators so in the morning it takes awhile, but get some cardio and take the stairs.  No question we will be back and I'll tell everyone I know about this hotel.  Thanks for a fantastic stay!

title: Bom...
text: Em comparação com outros hotéis da rede, meu quarto- 513, era bem compacto. Mas bem iluminado coisa que a maioria nos EUA não é! Tem uma boa TV, frigobar, o banheiro é pequeno, mas funcional e sem banheira!!! Tem cara de ser tudo renovado. A única coisa que não gostei foi que para pegar o elevador vc tem que passar por uma porta e dificulta passar com as malas, principalmente se estiver usando aquele carinho. O hotel está numa zona bem tranquila e tem cvs, duane reade, supermercado e restaurantes ao redor.

title: Excellent staff. Good location.
text:
This is a new, fairly standard Fairfield. Décor is very contemporary. Rooms are small. There is a small lobby bar with nice indoor and outdoor seating area. 

The staff is what distinguishes this Fairfield Inn. Front desk, housekeeping, breakfast room and bar staff were all very helpful and friendly. 

The hotel is close to Columbus Circle and Hell's Kitchen. But as a previous reviewer mentioned, during our visit there were several homeless folks living on the sidewalk on 48th west of 10th Ave. We were there four nights and never had a problem but my wife was uncomfortable having to pass by. That's 2017 in the American city, I suppose.

title: Good location, rooms on the small side
text:
Only stayed one night and picked it due to proximity to Lincoln Center. This is a newly built hotel, which is why I think the rooms are a bit small. Stayed in a King room. The bed does take up a lot of the space. There's only about a foot and a half of space between the bed and the desk/counter area. Only one person can fit there at a time. This is ideal for one or two people who will not be spending much time in the hotel. The free breakfast was good. It does get a bit crowded and there's not enough seats. The location is excellent. It's within short walking distances to Lincoln Center, Columbus Circle, Central Park, Times Square, Hell's kitchen, subway stations.
Like some reviewers have mentioned, there are some homeless people around, but that's not anything new in the city. The hotel is a bit off the beaten path, so it's a bit deserted at night, be aware of your surroundings. This is not a unique or specific situation to this hotel, it applies anywhere in the city. 

I would stay here again, but for a short stay (1-3 nights). The rate was really good especially for this area. Mobile check-in was great. All your paperwork and keys are ready when you get there.

title: A great stay
text: What a great gem in the city.  I chose this hotel after a wonderful stay at a Marriott Courtyard in New Jersey last month, the reviews i read online, its location and price.  It did not disappoint and, in fact, impressed me quite a lot.  Every staff member was friendly and helpful.  When we checked in the woman at the front desk took extra time to find us a room on a higher floor (without me even asking).  Our room was perfect.  Yes, small, but it's NYC.  I thought the space was used well.  Very comfortable bed, clean, nice view.  The fan for the air conditioning was loud, but honestly it was like white noise and I heard no sound from other rooms at all.  Breakfast was great with plenty of room - and included!!!  It's convenient to Lincoln Center and the Metropolitan Opera.  Both my husband and i felt it was a better experience than the other, more expensive places, we have  stayed in the city.  Would definitely recommend and return to - keep up the good work Marriott!

title: Exceptional Customer Service
text: The staff sets this place head and shoulders above the others. We were greeted with a warm welcome every time we passed the front desk, entered the breakfast room, etc. They also held our luggage after checking out, so we could take a tour before heading to the airport.  Then, after returning home, I had a question about my bill. They went out of their way to ensure everything was correct. I will certainly stay here if I ever have the opportunity to return to New York. I highly recommend staying here.

title: Good value for money
text: Clean and well maintained. Staff is great. Location isn't the best and the elevators are really slow. But it's brand new and the staff -- especially the front desk staff -- couldn't be friendly. And the woman I called when I made the initial reservation was also great.

title: Excellent Property but Don't Recommend
text: The Fairfield Inn is modern and clean and the staff is very helpful, specifically Nash, Marx and breakfast room attendants.  However, those things do not make up for the location.  It is not safe to walk to after dark because of the homeless who are staying in one doorway on this dark block that feels like an alley.  Unfortunately, just one block east feels safe but this block does not.  I am a city girl and my daughter lives in Manhattan but neither of us felt safe walking on this block after dark (58th between 10th Ave and 11th Ave).  Also, the rooms are very tiny even by NYC standards.  The bed takes up the entire room. There is a desk chair that only fits in its spot.  There are not any drawers to unpack clothes in.  There is a very small armoire to hang clothes in, no room to store luggage.  The night tables each have one drawer that will hold about two paperback books.  There is a safe but it is not reachable because it is on the floor right next to the bed (no place to bend down to it).  The bathroom is nicely laid out but again no where to put things.  There is barely a counter that will only hold a small cosmetic bag.  I stayed for 5 nights so I really missed being able to unpack and put my things away and hated having to leave my suticase out.  As much as I appreciated how clean and modern the hotel is and how nice the staff is, I won't be back.  The negatives are too many for me.

title: Confortable y limpio
text: Las habitaciones son "amplias" para el promedio de los hoteles en NY, el closet es pequeño (pero hay). La habitación y el baño permanecieron siempre limpios, lo cual dice mucho de los empleados. En el desayuno nunca faltó nada, siempre reponían hasta último minuto. Si bien, esta "relativamente" cerca del metro, cuando uno ha caminado todo el día, 2 cuadras y media se hacen una eternidad. La espera del ascensor en horarios pic puede ser un tema cuando tienes prisa (parece que ser normal en hoteles de NY)

title: Hotel Novo e próximo ao Central Park
text:
O Hotel é bastante novo e fica a umas 4 quadras do central park. 
Tivemos um atendimento espetacular, fomos muito bem recebidos por todos no hotel. Ficamos encantados com o tratamento.
O Hotel inclui café da manhã e é muito bom.
O quarto é pequeno com 2 camas de casal e o armário é bem pequeno, mas tudo novo impecável.
No hotel não há room service, mas possui um bar na recepção com vários tipos de bebidas, biscoitos, salgadinhos, doces para uma emergência. Caso precise de uma refeição no hotel, possui restaurante no térreo e funciona se não me engano até às 22h.
Gostamos muito, tem um bom custo benefício e vale pelo atendimento.

title: Clean, great location, and terrific service!
text: We found this Fairfield Inn tucked away but so close by Columbus Circle so jumping on the subway is a breeze. It's rooms are small but sparkling clean and the staff was pleasant, engaged, and so much fun. I highly recommend it for families as they worked very hard to provide a well rounded breakfast which was included in our price. That saves a family a lot of $$ in NYC.

title: brand new, good value
text: This is a second tier brand of Marriot, with a reasonable price for NYC standards, but contrary to all other value hotels in NYC, brand new.  Loacation is also great, its 5 min from Columbus Circle, Central Park, etc.  The room is quite tight but decent and well decorated.  Be aware if you have lots of lugagge. There is also a free breakfast buffet included, which is rare in NYC. Overall, its a good option.

title: PERFECT !
text:
We travelled to New York from may 28th through june 2nd.  We chose the FAIRFIELD INN & SUITES MANHATTAN/CENTRAL PARK because the price was good, specially for an hotel located near Central Park and Times Square.  We are from Canada and with the exchange rate, we just couldn't afford the 4 stars hotels directly in Times Square anymore.

What a good move we made !  Everything was perfect and worth a lot more than what we payed for.

The entire hotel was renovated in 2016, which means that the furniture, the decorations, the carpets, the bathrooms, the lobby, the hallways and even more are all in perfect condition.  

The rooms are not super spacious, but hey : this is NYC !  They are still perfectly equiped and totally functional.  Glass showers, modern faucet, beautiful neutral colors, comfortable bedding... Everything was clean and tidy.

The staff was the best part of our stay : always helpful, smilling and polite.  They even saluted us and called us by our names every night when we came back in. There is always hot coffee and flavored water in the lobby.  Special mention to DANIEL at the front desk who is super friendly and funny, yet still professional and efficient.

The included breakfast was a surprise for us : there was something for every taste.  From scrambled eggs to cereals, oatmeal to sausages, bread, fresh fruits, cake, hard boiled eggs and yogourt, you were garanteed to find something good to sustain you.  This can easily save you 10 to 15$ US every day if you get up early enough to take advantage of it (from 6h30 to 9h on weekdays).

Besides the included breakfast, you also have a refrigerator in your room, as well as a safe, without extra fees.  That is not so common in 3 stars hotels in NYC.

The hotel is located on 58th street, between 10th and 11h avenue, a bit set back from the main touristy sites.  But you can get to 59th/Colombus Circle metro station in 5 minutes by foot.  Times Square is at about 10 to 15 minutes by foot also.  Yellow cabs pass in front of the hotel or at the closest corners every minute, and the hotel staff will even hail them for you if you ask for it.  Nothing to keep you from choosing this place.

I would definitly go back at this hotel on my next trip !

title: Great Service
text: Everyone here was soooo nice, when I say everyone I mean everyone! This was the best customer service I've received in a while. Room is compact, as are most NYC hotels and we were good with that. Hotel is newer and furnishing reflected as such. Easy walk to Columbus Circle (mall, subway, central park, lincoln center etc).

title: Our First time at Fairfield
text:
This is a very nice hotel. The attention is prime. I think the building is new so everything is neat and shiny. The design of the guest rooms is modern and very pleasing. Love the pictures on the walls and the Room is clean and very tidy. 
Everyone is very nice and the location is very convenient and quiet. 
There's a small bar in the lobby. The room for the breakfast is very big and it is in the lower level and it's complementary. Overall I would recommend this hotel very much.

title: Algumas deficiências
text:
O quarto que ficamos era pequeno com duas camas de casal (estávamos em 3), não tinha espaço para malas. O roupeiro é bem pequeno.É um hotel adequado para quem vai a negócios, mas não chega a ser ruim para turistas pois a localização é boa. É possível ir a vários pontos turísticos a pé. O café da manhã é bom e é servido entre 6:30h e 9:00h. muito cedo para terminar. Ocorreu um congestionamento no elevador e no restaurante (no fim de semana que ficamos).
Atenção: Na saída podem lhe oferecer um carro especial para levar ao aeroporto a um determinado preço. Confira o valor com o motorista antes de embarcar.

title: 30th Birthday Trip
text:
For the most part we have really enjoyed our stay here! I would recommend this hotel. I forgot to take pictures when we got here.

Pros:
*The staff is so friendly! The night Front Office Supervisor, Senia, and Daniel are truly a delight! They give recommendations freely. They make you feel so welcome when you walk through the door, it makes you feel like your going "home" and not just a hotel. We had so much fun talking to them every night!

*While the rooms are small (it is NY), even with a king size bed it doesn't feel cramped. They've done a good job with making it comfortable and inviting. I love the art above the bed.

*The beds are so incredibly comfortable! After all the walking you need a great place to land, and these beds and pillows do not disappoint.

*The shades allow for total darkness in the room!

*Its so quiet! I was told NYC would be so loud at night and to take earplugs. This hotel is in the residential area, and it makes for a very comfortable sleep. It also gives you a great place to decompress from the day.

*Huge breakfast selection of your typical eggs, meat, cereal, yogurt, waffles, bagels, juice, coffee, oatmeal, etc.

*The bar area has a nice seating area and a good alcohol selection. It has couches and a table separate from the actual bar so anyone can sit.

*Decent size gym, but we didn't use it because all the walking wore us out.

*The shower is a pretty good size.

Things that are a positive, but also a con

*The quiet, means it's a walk everywhere. Including to the subway. The first day it wasn't bad, but after all the walking you do (if you aren't used it), all you want to do is sit down and you have a decent walk back.

*Ice makers - only in the lobby. You can get ice on your way in, because they have extra ice buckets downstairs. I think you have to take your extras back down because housekeeping doesn't take them. I think they'll bring ice up to your room if you ask

Cons
*The elevators are very slow. There are too many people in this hotel for the 2 small elevators they have. They have a 10 people max and trust me everyone fills that capacity so it makes for a tight fit with 10 average sized individuals.

*The breakfast ends at 9 during the week which feels early after exploring all night, but again it's the residential area.

*The breakfast area isn't big enough for the amount of people in the hotel. We had to bring our food back up to the room to eat because there wasn't even standing room. Because the elevators are so slow, our food was cold by the time we got up to the room.

*Housekeeping never refilled our coffee with regular coffee, only decaf, and didn't give us new cups. 

The cons aren't deal breakers, but I think things that they could improve. Overall the pros would bring me back. I'll just bring better walking shoes!

title: Bien
text:
Chambre spacieuse  lits twin confortables près de Central Park et de la station de métro Columbus Circle et de la station de bus top off top on 

Les petits déjeuners en formule buffet sont copieux et bien achalandés on peut même se faire des crêpes

title: Wonderful stay!
text: Reservations were made for us here for a family wedding.  LOVED IT!  We are New York Newbies and the staff here were very helpful!  Custom directions on how to get where we needed to be, options for shopping, meals, etc.  Breakfast was consistently delicious!  I would recommend getting to breakfast early as it fills up quick!  Also, with the high traffic to get to breakfast, elevators fill quick, plan accordingly and don't wait until the last minute.  Beds were super comfortable and just what we needed after long days on our feet!  Room was bright and clean!  Photo is the view from the front of the hotel down to the river.

title: 4 nuits à New York 😀
text:
Proche de colombus circle, de central park, des transports, donc bien situé. 
Une chambre avec lit king size, refaite à neuf comme l'hotel, propre, confortable avec un petit réfrigérateur. Bémol , côté rue bruyant.
Bon accueil,  personnel à l'écoute.  Prestation petit déjeuner au top.

title: Chambres neuves et confortables. Petit déjeuner nullissime !
text:
Hôtel tout neuf ou presque avec des chambres très confortables même si elles ne sont pas tres grandes. Salle de bain nickel. 
Par contre éviter le petit déjeuner ! Jamais vu ça : salle au sous sol, self bas de gamme, tablées façon cantine avec des couverts en carton et plastique. Cohue indescriptible. N'importe quoi! Le problème de cet hôtel neuf sont les parties communes ont été sous dimensionnées... outre la salle de restaurant il y a que 2 pauvres ascenseur pour je ne sais combien de chambre (on passe son temps à attendre).. dommage car la chambre en tant que telle est très sympa.

title: viaje  N Y
text:
hotel  correcto  habitacion   bien pero  un  armario un poco  mas grande  seria   mejor
el hotel  esta  bien plazado  para visitar  NY  cerca  de  central park et Times Square

Un  saludo  para  Senia  Pena  por  su  simpatía y competencia  y también  para
Daniel

title: Excelente ubicación !
text:
Ideal para estar en New York ! 
Ubicado al lado de Columbus Circle, acceso varias líneas del Metro y Central Park. 
Pasear por Columbus St es un placer, agradable , lindos lugares , tiendas,  Lincoln Center !
Un hotel nuevo con  las comodidades básicas , personal agradabilísimo. Solo ofrece una cafetería minina  pero al lado está Time Warner Center  donde hay un agradable cafeteria Bouchon ideal para un delicioso desayuno!
Muy recomendable , precio valor sobretodo para NY !

title: Solid Stay
text:
This was my fourth trip to NYC and I stayed in this hotel over Mother's Day weekend with my mom. We received a warm welcome from the front desk staff and customer service was good throughout our stay. 

We stayed in a room with two double beds on the 9th floor. The room was clean and bright with just enough room to get around and store our luggage. The bathroom lacked storage but we made do. The beds were VERY comfortable! 

I was a bit disappointed with the housekeeping as I felt just the bare minimum was done on a daily basis. Furthermore, our bathroom didn't have a bath mat until the second day, they kept throwing out our barely used soap from the sink everyday (which seemed quite wasteful) and they were giving us new towels everyday even though we had hung them to be re-used. 

The in-room Wifi was easy to connect to and very reliable. The in-room smart tvs were a nice touch and worked well. 

The daily breakfast was great and certainly adds value! The buffet had a very nice selection and the food was good. My only complaint is that all of the dishes and cutlery were disposable. For the quality of this hotel, it felt a bit cheesy and again, very wasteful.    

The hotel is located on a quiet street near many amenities and is about a 10 minute walk to the Columbus Cirlce (59th St.) subway station and an entrance to Central Park. 

I have stayed in other parts of the city and at other Mariott properties that I preferred over this one so although it wouldn't be my first pick, this hotel is largely in line with my expectations of the Marriott brand and I would consider staying here again.

title: Great place to stay at low cost
text:
This Marriott, Fairfield hotel, was a wonderful choice for staying in the heart of New York city at a remarkably low cost...very clean and comfortable rooms. Good breakfast and great location....
very kind and helpful staff.  The Wi Fi works good.  all in all it is very highly recommanded to stay in this hotel.

title: Too compact
text: The hotel is really small, but the room is ok. The hotel bar, common area and lobby are all together. It feels like there is a bar in the lobby, and it's kinda of weird. The room is nicely furnished, but the house keeping is poor. They don't clean the floor at all, especially the bathroom. I tried to request a service to get a full house keeping clean up, but they didn't do it, and the pillow cases are not so clean. The bathroom floor was dirty for 4 days during my stay.

title: Location good...rooms tiny.
text:
I know it's NYC so expect small hotel rooms but this was smaller than small.  Even the halls were narrow and claustrophobic feeling.  The newly remodeled rooms were clean and modern.  It's nice to stay at a small hotel where it's not super busy.  We took the subway everywhere so the location worked for us.  The breakfast was decent and the hotel staff were accommodating.  

Our kids stayed occupied in the cramped space with Youtube available on TV but otherwise it would not have worked out.  I would recommend this hotel for singles or couples but not for families.

title: Quiet.  Good Value.
text: Location a bit far west on 58th bet. 9th and 10th avenues.  Super clean, quiet with no street noise (yeah!), and decent free breakfast buffet.  Price more than reasonable for newly renovated hotel.  Weekend stay and will stay again.

title: Fantastic hotel near Central Park
text:
This hotel impressed me through and through.
This was my first trip to NYC in 30+ years and I am so glad this hotel added to my wonderful experience.
Check in was a breeze as front desk personnel was cordial and speedy.
One front desk lady that impressed me the most was Melissa.
She was so kind and friendly, professional.
The staff here definitely has been trained well and it shows.

Room
Room is small(it is in Manhattan where real estate is prime) but well appointed with amenities. Everything you need is present. Bed is firm and comfortable and so is the bedding. Cleanliness is also immaculate. Room is quite functional and cozy.

Breakfast
Standard chain hotel breakfast but with a lot more choices and staff refills everything quite often. Dining area is also very clean and well kept.

Location
It is about 5 minutes away from Central Park and subway station which is on the outskirts of the park. Close to Time Square, The Metropolitan, MOMA, etc. It is just distant enough so that it is quiet.

Would I stay here again on my next visit. 
No doubt.

Kudos to management and staff for a wonderful stay.
Look forward to visiting again in the fall.

title: WOW! Really impressed!!
text:
This hotel is very central. It's about 5 minutes to Central Park, and 15 minutes from Time Square... and the walk itself is really pleasant. 
The staff at the hotel are really friendly and helpful, and I was impressed by the service. The rooms were modern and really nice. There isn't a lot of baggage space, but there is more than enough room if you know how to pack efficiently. 
The breakfast (included in the room price) offers a large variety and the food itself is really nice. 

Overall, it was a really great experience!

title: Great experience
text: We stayed 2 nights in a room with 2 double beds, with a lovely view facing W 58th St. Beds were very comfortable--in fact, I've just placed an order for the pillow I enjoyed so much while there. All the bed linens were wonderful. We were pleased that the window was "openable" a few inches for fresh air. The shower was super. Staff members are true hospitality professionals--every single one we interacted with. We were welcomed by name with a big smile at check-in, and greeted each time we passed the front desk. The included breakfast is extensive, and the breakfast staff is most cheerful and helpful; Guillermo in particular made a positive impression on us. Our 1st evening we came downstairs looking for a quick snack and the desk staff microwaved our food, making a point to have each of our snacks ready at the same time so we could eat together. Staff also recommended a wonderful Greek restaurant 1/2 a block up the street where we had an excellent dinner, sitting in a glassed-in area along the sidewalk--great for people-watching. The only downside was the fan which was part of the room temperature control--it was a bit loud for us, even on a low setting. I recommend this hotel and hope to stay here next time I'm in NYC.

title: Fantastic hotel with affordable rates
text: Really impressed with this little gem! Check in was friendly and courteous, though she informed me at first that the room is not ready yet, she doubled checked and found us a room that is ready. Room is clean and comfortable. Really nice bed and pillow. Nice shower and Paul Mitchell toiletries. New and modern furniture. Convenient to the upper west side, central park and columbus circle. I've stayed at more expensive hotels around the city that is far less superior in terms of comfort and customer service. Will definitely be back!

title: Consigliato
text:
Hotel molto pulito e abbastanza nuovo. Non molto vicino alla metropolitana (10-15 min a piedi dalla columbus circle che comunque è collegata a tutte le linee).
Le camere sono piccole ma molto pulite. I letti King comodissimi. Niente moquette per terra. Il personale e molto gentile e disponibile. La colazione è varia, abbondantissima ed è buonissima.
Lo consiglio.

title: Excelente ubicación
text:
Estuve tres noches en el hotel Fairfield Inn & Suites de Manhattan que está ubicado a pocas cuadras del Central Park, pude recorrer caminando la Quinta Avenida y Times Square.
La atención en la recepción estuvo excelente y además el servicio de desayuno es muy variado.

title: Never disappointed at Marriot
text:
They have a parking garage close to the hotel but I suggest you to drop the luggage off at the lobby before leaving the car there especially if you have kids and a lot of stuff with you. 
This is a nice hotel, small rooms as usual in Manhattan. The positive thing is that the curtains can obscure almost completely the room. 
No swimming pool and this was like a bad news for my kids ;-) but they have a 24h fitness center: good news for me ;-)
We had a margaritas at the bar: well done!
Breakfast is good you can find almost everything and the service is friendly and nice.
Even if it was crowded we found a good spot to seat all together! 
Never disappointed when I stay at Marriott.

title: Our stay was AMAZING!
text: The hotel is nice and clean. Rooms are a bit small but the location and the staff there made it a amazing stay. We were very close to Central Park and Times Square. We moved all over the city in the subway and the Columbus Circle station is very close. The staff at this place was very welcoming... they told us where to eat/drink and how to get to locations. They were like family.... Special thanks and shout outs to the amazing service from Senia, Justin and Robert! You guys were simply awesome! Thank you for all! I guarantee you will have a fantastic stay here. Breakfast was beyond what I expected with many options... the only con was that it ends too early. M-F until 9am, Weekends until 9:30am.

title: Small
text:
I generally love Fairfield Inn's and have some Pros and Cons for this location.

PROS

- Great location.
- Very friendly staff.
- Clean.
- Breakfast included.
- Potentially great view depending on room.
- Bar and small menu available.
- TV has streaming.

CONS

- Incredibly small rooms. The bed fills the room.
- Elevator traffic made for very frustrated guests. (Staff should have a separate elevator or only use elevators after high traffics times like breakfast).
- Breakfast is 6-9, ends earlier than I've seen so far at a Fairfield.
- Our room wasn't made up without asking to have it done.

We really appreciated the friendly staff. However, wouldn't likely come back to this location.

title: Its all about the location.
text:
Let me start with the pros- the rooms are very modern, with most basic amenities. Coffee pots,fridge, iron, flat-screen etc. The bed was very comfy, but the shower was fantastic.  It is spacious, with terrific water pressure. (we were only on 9th floor). The location of the hotel was the best part.  We were in NY for an expo, so being centrally located between the piers and central park was key to us.  A 15 minute walk you are in central park, same time to the piers.

Now the cons- I knew staying in Manhattan meant that rooms were not going to be oversized, but this reminded me of college dorm days.  Not smelly socks in a corner  dorm days, but that size and storage is limited.  The king sized bed takes up the majority of the room, while the desk/ entertainment center/ takes up most of what remains.  Our room did not have a dresser, but instead a small closet that got filled up quickly. The bathroom is laid out in a fashion that wastes a lot of space that could have been used in the bedroom.  Overall still a positive experience, and I would certainly stay again.

title: nice clean modern place with insufficient elevator capacity at peak times
text: We stayed a long weekend with another couple (2 rooms).  We found the location good for what we were doing:  partying in Greenwich village, walking in central park, and other touristy things.  The rooms are nice and clean and new.  Mostly its quiet except for the loud slamming of doors and the unnecessarily loud air conditioner.  I was surprised at both because it seems both should be reasonably easy to resolve and it would improve the comfort of stay considerably.  Also, at breakfast time the elevators were really really slow and I think that the usage by cleaning staff contributed to that.  When I was waiting for an elevator (on 8th floor) I noticed that one of the 2 elevators was stopped on the 5th floor for a really long time (like more than 8 minutes).  Anyhow, given the price we paid we were really happy with the place.  There is a little bar in the lobby and a pretty good breakfast downstairs.  I never had a chance to use the little gym but it looked ok.

title: Nice and cozy place to stay.
text:
To our luck, it did not rain during our 4-day stay in NYC at this hotel. Almost everything under the control of the management works fine. Other stuff such as the ticking of the equipment in the bathroom walls (some kind of water pressure gauge) can be nuisance. The ticking sounds like texting on an iphone few inches away from your ear. Also there is the noise emanating from the street.  If you get to choose, do not pick a room facing the street if you are a light sleeper.  That and on the second morning one of the hotel managers was standing at the top of the stairs by the entrance and shouting loud at some guy he knew on the street @ 6:30 am.

The room is kind of tight and feels cramped even for a couple of people. So make reservation accordingly. It is somehow clean because you get the feeling the floor should have been cleaned better.  We could find hair (long different color than ours) in the corner by the bathroom.  The hotel staff is really friendly. The room has a fridge but not a microwave which can be mitigated by asking the front desk to warm up your food or if wishing to do popcorn.

Its location is really good as well. It is 0.2 miles away from the nearest Bus Stop and 0.5 mile from Columbus Circle. Pharmacy and grocery stores are a block or two away to buy water or toothpaste if needed.

It has a decent breakfast. I would surely stay there again.

title: Wonderful modern hotel - centrally located
text: Stayed at this hotel for a night, very clean - modern, located a block away from main streets and close to Central Park (about 10-15 minute) walk. The location is in between 10th Avenue (turns into Amsterdam Avenue) and 11th Avenue, quiet; yet, close to the action.

title: Outstanding Location
text: The Hotel is located just blocks away from Central Park and the Subway entrance at Columbus Circle.  Eateries, grocers, and pharmacies are within the vicinity as well.  The Room is rather small, but hey, it's NYC right? Space is a rare luxury.  Comfortable and clean beds, pristine clean, equipped with a mini fridge, and the city view room, made me feel at home.  You want to hit the breakfast bar as early at 7:00, it gets quite crowded, The excercise room is well equipped and clean. Friendly staff, willing to give you a hand with directions and tips on how to get around. Hassle free check in and check out. It's a shame guests can not visit the balcony on the 18th floor, where I am certain skyline pictures would have come out good.

title: Mycket bra!
text: Rekommenderas varmt. Utmärkt beläget med promenadavstånd till tunnelbanan och i ett lugnt område. Mycket bra frukost med våfflor, färsk frukt, yoghurt, bagels, gott kaffe bl a. Rent fräscht rum med sköna sängar. Gott om matställen i området. Trevlig och serviceminded personal. Vi kommer att återvända.

title: Great Hotel, Great Staff
text:
Location:  This is located close to Lincoln Center but not super close to Central Park.  It is attached to the BMW dealership.

Hotel:  This hotel is only 8 months old so, as you can imagine, super clean and neat.  It is set back a little from the road and has a lower level entrance.

Service:  5 Star service.  Can't say enough about the staff of this place.  They were so accomodating and happy to help from every turn.  Bravo to the staff!

Price:  At $300 a night it is not a bad price for NYC.  Keep in mind that a full hot breakfast is included.  Very reasonable.

Rooms:  Clean and neat but only doubles (no queens even if they say there are).  The rooms are small but it's NYC.

Overall:  Great staff and location and price make this a must stay for business or personal.  Will stay again.

Tips:  Free breakfast.  One block over is an awesome park if you have kids.

title: Agree with others - exceeded my expectations
text: A little difficult to tell it's a hotel from the outside but once you get inside, everything is just great - the customer service, the cleanliness of the room, the free breakfast and wi-fi - everything!  Will definitely stay here again.  Close to attractions.

title: Clean, confortable and modern
text: This inn is a good deal for the price. Great free breakfast with everything hot and cold you would want. Free wi-fi. Room was clean and quiet. I liked that there was no carpet in the room too. Five restaurants on the same block as the hotel. Try the Greek Kitchen tasty Greek food.

title: Exceeded My Expecations
text: I travel to New York City on business at least twice a year.  My company puts me up in different places each time I come, so I have had many good experiences as well as many bad experiences when it comes to hotel accomodations in New York City.  This property exceeded my expectations and I will have my staff book me here from now on.  The rooms were immaculate, very clean and very comfortable.  It is in an excellent location, at least for me, it is.  But the most impressive thing to me is the staff.  Daniel at the front desk was amazing.  He was very friendly, very welcoming, and extremely helpful.  He is a true gem, but really, the entire staff here is terrific.  There will be no more "trial and error" for me.  From now on, I will insist that my staff only books me at this wonderful Fairfield Inn for all my future business trips to New York City.

title: Modern & Reasonably Priced
text:
I'll start off by saying I would rate this more as a 3.5 star experience. The hotel is in a quiet part of the city, right next to BMW. In fact, you use the parking garage attached to the dealership. 

The lobby area is small, but nicely done. The woman who checked us in was very friendly. We were given a room on the second floor, so I expected to hear some noise outside, in which we did. For the most part it was just the emergency vehicles responding to calls.

The room itself is very modern and clean. Bathroom was nice. As others have mentioned, the room is tiny. The closet is almost non-existent (no exaggeration). The bed was not very comfortable to me, but the rest of the family did not mind it. I cannot recommend for a family of four. It's just too cramped inside. If you are single or maybe a couple then this would be perfect.

They have a small bar area and a fitness center, which I did not try. It was rather easy to catch a cab. Regarding places to eat nearby.. there were not many. There is a Greek place within walking distance as well as Starbucks. The complimentary breakfast was good and they had a decent amount to choose from.

I don't think I would return, do to the size of the rooms and location (everything seems to be 10-15 min walk). But, would recommend for business and maybe a couple enjoying NYC together.

title: CORRECT MAIS PAS POUR UN SEJOUR DE PLUSIEURS NUITS
text:
Les points positifs : Hôtel neuf, personnel de la réception très aimable, literie confortable, proximité de Columbus Circle (station de métro qui dessert plusieurs lignes) et de Central Park. Petit déjeuner plutôt correct (surpris de la vaisselle jetable). Plateau de courtoisie et coffre fort. Produits de toilette. Linge de toilette changé tous les jours.
Les points négatifs : chambre petite et sombre vue sur le côté d'un bâtiment, WC dans la salle de douche très petite, une minuscule armoire déjà encombrée d'une table à repasser et fer. A part, les manteaux sur les cintres, les vêtements sont restés dans les valises toute la durée du séjour. Climatisation bruyante + soufflerie extérieure toute la nuit (chambre n°114). Salle du petit déjeuner en sous sol très bruyante le WE.

title: Meets the need for a place to stay
text: Very friendly and helpful staff! Small rooms and the elevators are a problem--lots of folks and luggage waiting, waiting...did I mention WAITING? But, great location sand price for midtown Manhattan. And, the included buffet breakfast is a real bonus!

title: Modern and Conveniently Located Hotel
text:
This hotel is essentially brand new. Its rooms are spotless and clean (with wood floors rather than carpet), with modern furnishings. We had 2 Queen Beds, and were provided with a crib for our baby. This is where my only negative comment comes in, and that is that the room is TINY, especially with the addition of the crib, which takes away even more room to move around. However, if one is travelling and staying in Manhattan, one has to also understand and expect that accommodations are going to be cramped. This is NYC. Staff, especially those at the front desk and in the breakfast room, are friendly and helpful. Being a family of 4 with 2 young children, we really appreciated the daily breakfast buffet. It offered all the basics that you need to start your day: scrambled eggs, bacon and/or sausage, yogurt, coffee, cereal, bread, juice, etc. It even has a waffle station with 4 irons so that you can make your own waffles.

The hotel is conveniently located close to Times Square, the metro stop at Columbus Circle (10 minute walk), and Central Park (13 minute walk). It's kind of tucked away on a quieter section W 58th Street where there isn't a lot of car traffic, though as previous posters mentioned, it is across the street from the hospital.

Happy hour is also every night in the lobby from 4-7PM. It's not a very typical bar/lounge setting, as it's just a long table with some chairs and couches, but it was a nice way to wind down in the evening with a drink.

Overall, we really enjoyed our stay. It was great value, and we were treated very well.

title: A Good Choice For A Stay In Manhattan
text:
New York City is not inexpensive. So, finding a good hotel at a reasonable price can be a challenge. The Fairfield Inn offers an excellent balance for for people who want their creature comforts at a price that won't kill the family budget.

The nightly rate of a hotel room in the Big Apple is dependent on several factors:

1) Location - This Fairfield Inn is far from midtown and a long walk from Central Park. It's located between 10th & 11th Avenue, closer to the Hudson River than the park.

2) Room Size - The rooms, like many Manhattan hotels, are very small...especially compared to suburban or high priced city hotels. I believe the cabin on my last ocean cruise was larger.

So, why am I rating this inn with an Excellent 5 on TripAdvisor?

The reason is that despite these negatives the Fairfield Inn has offsetting benefits that go beyond location and room size.

1) Though small, the rooms are perfectly laid out. They are totally efficient. Every switch and outlet is right where it should be. The bathroom is excellent. It's shower is large. The sink and Toto toilet are first rate.  Lighting throughout the room is far better than most hotels I've stayed at. They even have the most efficient and innovative blackout curtain I've ever seen on a hotel room window.

2) An excellent breakfast is included. It is better than at most Marriott properties we've been at. Given Manhattan prices that complimentary breakfast could cost you $30 for two people; more if you have kids.

3) The staff is super friendly. That's every person from the front desk to the housekeepers. These people actually like their guests.

4) The room and facility are spotlessly clean. The entire hotel is modern and well kept up.

5) Marriott's point programs can be applied...and Marriott rewards its best customers. So, we were able to apply points to pay for one of our two nights.

The bottom line is that if you can allow for the off-the-beaten-track location and the small room you'll have a nice, efficient hotel room at an affordable price.

My one recommendation to Marriott management is that they consider putting an all-in-one workout machine in their fitness room. These used to be in the fitness rooms years ago but have since disappeared in favor of just hand weights and treadmills.  Though hand weights are OK, an exercise machine would add a lot to my stay.

This Fairfield Inn has my full recommendation.

title: Great Location, Friendly & Helpful Staff, Very Nice!
text:
Needed a hotel near Carnegie Hall and decided on this one because we always try to stay at a Fairfield Inn whenever possible. This property is new, having just opened in October 2016. We were not disappointed with any aspect of this hotel. From check-in to check-out the staff was very polite, friendly and helpful. It was great that they arranged a ride for us back to LGA, one less thing for us to worry about.
Yes, the rooms and bathroom are small, but very nice. The beds were comfortable, and the room is nicely decorated. 
We paid extra for a "city view" and it didn't disappoint!
The free breakfast has a nice selection and was good. Breakfast staff was friendly and helpful, too.
Its only a short walk to Columbus Circle, Central Park, and Carnegie Hall, and even the Ambassador Theater (where Chicago is showing) and Times Square are only a 15 to 20 minute walk. 
I would recommend this hotel to everyone.

title: Small and Cozy but effective for business travel
text: Stayed at this Fairfield this week and was very impressed with the staff and amenities despite restricted space. They did a wonderful job with the design of the hotel. Rooms are small like Europe, but nicely designed and effective for a business traveler. Also great breakfast at the bottom floor. Lastly, convenient parking garage in same building.

title: Excelente!
text:
Minha família e eu ficamos muito satisfeitos com nossa experiência no hotel! O quarto não é grande, mas ficamos bem acomodados, mesmo estando com 6 malas! A decoração é moderna, tudo é muito limpo, o café da manhã é muito bom e o atendimento é excelente!
Além disso, o preço é muito bom para o padrão de NY e a localização também é ótima! Fica há uns 10 minutos de caminhada do metro.

title: Interesting location, but uneven service and comfort
text:
I found the location, one block from the Hudson, intriguing. It was quite close to Columbus Circle and Lincoln Center. (And within walking distance of Central Park BUT not within view of it.) There were some nice local restaurants--including the Greek Kitchen. And it was quiet and away from the madness of Times Square. The hotel is brand new construction. However, the design isn't the best. The check-in area is very narrow and tight, so if several people are checking in, it's difficult to navigate around them and their luggage. 

My room was quite small, even by NYC standards. However, I liked the laminate wood (rather than carpet) floor. And overall, the room is well-designed with ample desk space. The bathroom was also small, but there was a shelf to store toiletries. The worst feature of the room was the air vent--it was EXTREMELY noisy (so much so that I turned off the AC and opened the window). There was not a lot of street noise (an occasional ambulance from the nearby Sinai medical center), so the open window arrangement isn't a deal breaker (unless you stay in the summer or are a light sleeper). 

The breakfast room was ample size--enough seating (which isn't always the case in hotels with complimentary breakfast). There was a wide variety of food--eggs, sausage, yogurt, fresh fruit, oatmeal with toppings, bagels and pastries, waffles, cold cereal--an excellent value! 

I have mixed feelings about the front desk staff; they were friendly and cheerful, but not always familiar with the layout of the hotel or the hotel's location (for instance, I was told I was upgraded to a view room, but was actually given a room on the opposite side of the hotel--but I was given an apology and a new room; I asked for some dining recommendations, and the staff member could only give one. When I asked about taxi fare to the airport, the staff member said she wasn't sure.) 

Overall, I'm conflicted about this hotel. I do really like this unique location and I can be forgiving of inexperienced staff, but the AC was so loud it affected my sleep. To me, nothing is worse than feeling sleep deprived on a vacation in a fast-paced city like NYC. 

If you're not a fussy sleeper and you're interested in a less touristy area that is still within walking distance to many sites, then you may really enjoy this budget-friendly FI.

title: SAVE YOUR MONEY
text:
I have never been so disappointed in a hotel before. From the check in to the rude staff, to the tiny spaces they call rooms. We landed at 9pm at night for a three day stay at Fairfield. The staff at reception took their sweet time checking us in. We were a party of two adults and two kids (3, 5). Our room barely had space for one, let alone 4. With two double beds, there was HARDLY any space to walk. When we called for reception and asked for a bigger room, which we were willing to pay for, they very rudely refused. The room next to ours (which we later found out was vacant and bigger, was not given to us). The room was clean but it was NOT COMFORTABLE. too claustrophobic. The free breakfast included in the package was another ordeal. It ends at 9:30 which is a ridiculous time for weekends. Atleast keep it till 11. Furthermore, the breakfast is cold. 

HORRIBLE experience ever. I suggest add a little extra to your budget and stay at the Holiday Inn on 57th and 10th. its ALOT bigger and more accommodating. 

we got ripped off on off-site parking as well, when there was FREE parking at the front of the hotel that they refused to tell us about.

title: Nice and afforadble hotel with an good location
text:
Nice and afforadble hotel with an good location. 

Location is good, you can walk to metro station (columbus circle) or straight to Times Square. 

Rooms are clean and nice. There is enough space for you luggage and stuff. TV has netlifx in it :) Small fridge and a safety box. 

Staff is superfriendly and helpful. 

I really would recommed this hotel 👍🏽

title: Typical American 3 star business hotel
text:
Everything clean and new.
Friendly staff
Windows can be opened - outside street with few traffic, not noisy
Size of room typical New York small size
If you need the ac or heating at night, do not expect to get a silent rest

title: Good value and location for a short stay
text:
Nice, clean and modern hotel - well maintained with friendly and helpful staff. Location is only 10 minutes walk from Central Park. Fairly quiet area just off the main avenues.

Rooms are quite small and compact with fairly limited storage space. OK for a couple of days but would feel quite cramped for longer. The rooms could do with a couple of extra helpful facilities like a kettle and some cutlery or plates for using with takeout. 

The A/C fan is very loud when it comes on. 

Free wi-fi works pretty well.

Breakfast is a self-serve buffet with plenty of choice - cereals, milk, yoghurt, make-your-own waffles, bacon, eggs, bread and bagels, juice, fruit and tea. Only downside was really useless plastic knives - I saw lots of people having trouble spreading butter or even cream cheese with them.

The fitness room is decent. A couple of walking machines, step machines and a bike plus dumb-bells, balls and mats in a reasonably sized room.

title: Terrific for the Price! (But nowhere near Central Park)
text: This hotel is brand new and it looks it. For an incredibly reasonable price in NYC (granted it's February and this is far west 58th St) I got a comfy king bed with comfy pillows, a decent bathroom (shower, no tub, which I never use anyway), a mediocre but free breakfast, and a friendly and helpful staff. The room, though small, was bigger than a pod room and 50% less. I'm a happy camper. Luxury it ain't, but for basic accommodation it was great.

title: famille 2 adultes 2ados
text:
fairfield du 08 au 12 fev 2017.hotel yout neuf et propre ,nous avons eu droit a 2 chambres double 102 e-t 104 au premier etage tres bien 
chambre tres jolie literie tres confortable le seul hic et la climatisation tres tres bruyante nous avons due l'eteindre tout les nuits sinon impossible de dormir.personnel tres attentif a toute les demandes.petit dej tres copieux du chaud et du froid .situation de l'hotel parfaite a 15min a pied de times square .central park tout proche ainsi que columbus circle grand noeud de metro pour toute les destinations ou presque.
pour le depart service bagagerie tres efficace.ordinateur a dispotition pour toute reservation ou checking e billets avion.hotel a recommandé malgré le bruit de la clim qui est vraiment derangeant pour la nuit peut etre que ce n'etait que nos chambres?

title: Very nice Fairfield
text: This Fairfield is a very good value for the great quality you receive. Nice, clean, updated rooms, delicious full complimentary breakfast, quiet sleeping atmosphere, and very friendly staff. I will stay here again my next visit to the city!

title: Very helpful staff
text:
This Fairfield inn and suites is north Hell's Kitchen and adjacent to the BMW showroom. 

The hotel has a small bar with food and a breakfast room. Large breakfast room. The staff was very helpful. I did a webinar from my room. The wifi works well. 

A great alternative to the higher priced hotels in manhattan.

title: Excellent hotel!!
text: This newly opened hotel is a great choice if you want to stay away from the craziness of the main attractions ! I was quite impressed with the quality of the service  & the hotel is very nice and modern! The rooms are on the small size but still comfortable and you get everything you need! The breakfast was very good and although the hotel doesn't offer concierge service I was amazed with how helpful the front desk representatives were! Overall a great stay and I would definitely recommend this hotel! Great value, great service, comfortable bed, close to shopping, subway, good restaurants .. !!!  The hotel provides free high speed wifi, a desk with a computer and a printer in the lobby for the travellers needs.. Kudos to the management team -the excellent service makes a big difference!!

title: Small Rooms, Quiet Location
text: The rooms are very small, with almost no room to walk in between the bed and the desk/TV stand. However, it is a newer, very clean hotel. The location is pretty isolated, but walkable from the Columbus Circle trains, and quieter for those who are sensitive to loud noises when sleeping.

title: Clean and affordable but not so close...
text:
The good:
-Price was very affordable in NYC
-Room was new/clean 
-Check-in was smooth and the staff were pleasant and accommodating (besides the price and cleanliness, this is why I gave the hotel a "very good" rating)
-Nice desk area
