-Large television with ability to watch Netflix, Hulu, YouTube etc (though other channels are few...see below)

The not as good:
-Location (The blocks in that area are not short city blocks; they are rather long blocks (and at least one is hilly). Just be prepared to take a nice stroll to get to anything, activity or eating wise. The restaurant scene is not as plentiful as other areas of the city, and so I spent about $10 each way to get to restaurants.)
-Elevators (Give yourself time because at times they are hard to get.)
-Television channels (For a cold or rainy day, tv fans will be disappointed. They do not have very many channels...e.g. no Bravo.)
-Room size (I felt indifferent about the room size because it was just me, and I'm kind of intrigued by compact living. However, for those not so indifferent, the rooms are pretty small and the bathroom is actually very small.)

title: Très bien
text: Chambre petite mais vu que l on est pas la pour y rester ça suffît.hotel très propre personnels accueillants,salle de sport,et petit dej compris un peu juste quand même dans ce qui est proposé mais toujours mieux que de manger dehors....rien a dire bon hôtel à 2 pas de central park

title: Cool mais expensive
text:
Hi everyone, 

The hotel have all the commodities that you want : a very good bed which is very important after a miles of walk in NYC + The breakfast was excellent (Unfortunately the restaurant is open until 9 A.M, so for those who sleep late must wake-up early to take it even on week-end) + The staff is helpful and welcomed me in arabic language when they saw my algerian passport !! (One of the staff had broken accidentally my perfume give the last night night there for free and gave me some drinks to rearrange the issue) + 15/20 Minutes by walk to Times Square....The only thing on what I can disagree is the price per night there (180 USD) which is very expensive when you can find a hotel in the same standard by paying 100 USD or less (I had choose this just 04 days before traveling so it can be the reason of that high price, may be!!).

title: Small, but clean and well appointed
text:
We were visiting our son this past weekend and wanted to stay on the upper west side. I was looking for a Marriot property (we are reward members) that was low-cost but clean and well situated. 
The hotel is a little off the main drag but just a short walk from Central Park, Columbus Circle and several museums. 
The room is small, the king-sized bed takes up most of the space but it was clean, had a nice shower and better towels than most.
I recommend this hotel for a stay of 1 or 2 days for 2 people. If there is only one person it can be used for a longer stay.

title: Fairfield Inn on 58th Street Is A Great Stay
text: I stayed at the Fairfield Inn - 58th Street - between 10th Avenue and 11th Avenue in January 2017.   This hotel opened in November 2016.   The staff is excellent and the rooms are comfortable.   Because it is so new it has a great feel and is top quality.    The rooms have laminate on the floors instead of carpet giving it a modern feel.   This hotel is convenient for Lincoln Center and the Time Warner Center at Columbus Circle.  Definitely a top shelf Fairfield Inn.

title: Location, location
text: New hotel on 58 St.  Rooms with hot breakfast included in the price. Staff friendly and efficient.  Website has location listed as Central Park, should be listed Hudson River, since you can see the water, but not the park!   Room was tiny, had some issues and was "upgraded" to one even smaller!  My biggest complaint is that there was hardly any room to place personal items,  no real closet, no dresser,  no luggage caddy, same in bathroom,  entirely  too small for two people.

title: Awesome stay!
text:
I stayed for 1 night and it was a great stay! Robert and team made the check in process quick and easy. Robert's suggestions for food and local cuisines were the only place we ate. So yes, the service is great!
As for the room, clean and fresh. The staff was accommodating when I left my tooth paste. They were there in 2 minutes.

Overall, great stay, great hotel. Would definitely stay again

title: Can't really complain
text:
I'm normally a Hyatt loyalist but I was attending a conference two blocks from this location so I chose it instead.

It was absolutely fine. The room was very comfortable and while many review note that it is small, I have stayed in other Manhattan hotel rooms which were MUCH smaller. The room is very cleverly designed, comfortable bed, lots of electrical outlets and USB slots for your devices, and I really liked the fact that the TV could be connected to your personal Netflix and other streaming services without a lot of hassle or special devices needed.

Breakfast was very nice and I appreciated that they served Morningstar Farms Veggie Sausages.

The only reason it's a four is that I found the public spaces and corridors a little cramped and dormitory-like. I realize Fairfield Inn is a budget brand but the hallways left me feeling a little depressed. I realize this is entirely subjective but there you have it.

title: A little further away than I wanted
text: Stay at this property for one night using a discounted family rate. This hotel is nice, rooms were a decent size for NYC. Biggest issue was with proximity to subway and general location. I knew going in that it wasn't terribly close, but the walk wasn't enjoyable after a long day in the city. Front desk staff was fantastic and the breakfast was pretty good.

title: The BEST service!!
text:
We came to see the city and NY for out daughter. .and to get away from Orlando.I am SO impressed with this location and staff.Robert is an asset to this property as he is always equiped with a genuine smile but his engagement embodies the Marriott credo...absolutely impressed.
Axel and the rest of the staff were quite impressive as well!! 
The rooms are cozy and well maintained. .couldn't have asked for a better place to fit our needs for our first time here...

title: Mrs
text: The staff is amazing!  Daniel and Siena were absolutely wonderful to guide us around the city with maps, info and out of the way places.  Siena got our rooms early since we had taken a red eye flight and the GM hosted breakfast one morning by greeting guests and assisting staff.  We had a lesson in exceptional hotel management during our stay.

title: Clean and friendly hotel
text: Although the room is small, it is very clean. The rate is reasonable for its prime location near the Lincoln center, and it is very safe to walk around that area. The staff are very friendly and helpful. Breakfast is plentiful and there are quite varieties of food. I would definitely come back to this hotel again!

title: Excelente relación precio prestación
text:
El hotel es nuevo. Todo básico pero más que suficiente. La atención es muy buena. No falta no sobra nada. 
La relación precio y calidad para Manhattan es excelente. Difícil encontrar algo mejor en esos valores. 
Muy recomendable

title: Great Hotel in good location
text: Brand new hotel in a great location.  yes the rooms are small but they serve their purpose and lets face it who goes to NYC to sit in the hotel room - we were barely there, only to shower and sleep.  We were allocated an adapted room on the 7th floor which had a massive bathroom, but the shower was low but that didnt bother us as neither of us is very tall.  There isnt much hanging space for clothes in the room but as we were on a multi stop holiday we just lived out of our suitcases.  Breakfast was included and was very good - there was a choice of hot items that changed on a daily basis, cerials, yoghurts, bread, bagels, muffins, make your own waffles, a choice of hot drinks and juices.  The staff in the breakfast room were extremely polite and friendly - in fact all of the hotel staff were.  It did get a bit manic in there one morning (Xmas day!) and there werent many empty tables so a lot of people were taking their breakfast back to the rooms which was a good option.  The hotel had a small bar that opened at 4pm and they had a happy hour and they also served bar snacks if you didnt want to go out to eat.  There are only 2 lifts in the property and at these could be slow at busier times.  Nearby is Columbus Circle for the subway and its just a short walk to Central Park, Times Square and Broadway.  Overall a great little hotel in a nice quiet location but close enough to where you want to be - would definately stay here again when in NYC!!

title: Great winter prices, nice staff, and clean new hotel
text:
All Marriott hotels in NYC offer the lowest prices in January. This hotel had the lowest prices. The positives are that it's a new hotel, so everything is clean. The bed, pillows, and linens are comfortable and fresh. All staff members are nice and helpful. I also like that the floors aren't carpet but instead hard floors, which feel cleaner than carpet. The decor is nice and modern with some artsy touches on the wall. The TVs are large and have a great picture. There's a long counter with a chair if you want to work on your computer. Breakfast is very well done, probably one of the better Fairfield Inn breakfast set-ups I've seen. It's in a larger room downstairs and has the same normal options but a few additional items too. 

The negatives are the location is a bit out of the way. You have to walk from mid-10th Avenue to Columbus Circle to get to the subway (which isn't a big deal unless you're exhausted, carrying stuff, and have bad weather.) I didn't notice a simple way to get downtown using the buses, but you can get there with transfers. I didn't mind the location, it's just not as convenient as some other places I've stayed. (The upside to the location is that it's a quiet street and feels safe.) The other negatives are the walls are pretty thin and you have to call the front desk for ice since they don't have ice machines. The rooms are tiny and don't have much storage space. Everything is very compact. The closet only hangs about 4 items. There's only one area to lay-out one suitcase. For one person, it's manageable. Or for short-term stays, it's fine. 

Overall, I'm recommending the hotel because of the cleanliness factor, the current low prices, and the eagerness of the staff to provide good customer service.

title: Staff is amazing!!
text: Can't say enough about the staff!! I was traveling with my 80 year old mother, and they were so helpful in every way!! Breakfast is fantastic! Rooms are small, but quiet. Will definitely stay again!!!

title: Good value for NYC, great staff, brilliant shower
text:
Main observations: 
The front desk staff were brilliant, everybody we spoke to was super friendly and helpful. Daniel who checked us out was also full of local knowledge about where to go nearby and how to get places while avoiding the crowded areas. 

The location is outside of the main tourist/hotel areas and 3 blocks from the subway so be prepared to do a bit more walking. There are some very good food places around Columbus Circle for snacks and drinks - Argo Tea is worth a visit if you want an alternative to Starbucks.

The noise insulation is not great - this is a common New York problem which still isn't fixed here, the windows let noise in and the guest room doors do nothing to keep out noise from the corridor so try to get a room away from the elevators! 1 trade off is that given its location the street noise at night isn't as bad as in some other parts of town.

The rooms are small but again this is a New York thing, by New York standards they seem fine for the price. The shower in the bathroom is brilliant, there is no token bath with a drizzly shower head over it. Instead they've forsaken the bath for a proper double width shower cubicle with a really powerful and high up shower head. 

Paid $140 for 1 night which for Manhattan is actually good value - we normally stay at properties on Lexington Avenue which charge around $200 a night. Having said that do bear in mind that this is the budget Marriott brand and so the building and in particular the free breakfast are basic.

title: Crowded hotel made pleasant by excellent staff
text:
We got a deal through the chain's rewards program and luckily got one of the "executive suites," called a king with a city view on the web site. The other rooms were said to be very small, and this "suite" was small but not so small we could not fit in our carry on luggage. If the regular rooms are much smaller, larger luggage would be a huge problem. We were in room 1505 with a view of a roof top lawn. 
The breakfast room is best before 8:00. After then, it has the noise level and commotion of a school cafeteria. The self service selection is large, from eggs to waffles to cold cereal, juice and fruit. The coffee is good. The staff is exceptionally attentive and will clear your table and make sure you are well served.
The location was good for us. We like to walk and thought nothing of the 10 minute walk to the subway stop at Columbus Circle and the walk of the the same distance to Lincoln Center. For the holiday week, I would certainly prefer this location to Times' Square, which has gotten way too crowded.
The bar area is popular with guests. Wine is about $15 per glass, but the pours are large.
Our favorite thing about the visit was the service. This young staff go out of their way to please. Even the maintenance guy is very involved with the guests, welcoming all and giving advice on restaurants. You would think he was lord of the manor.
Lastly, we had a regular hair dryer, not the usual whimpy hotel wall model, and Paul Mitchell toiletries and good, thick towels in the bathroom.

title: Dan is the Man!
text:
I travel with my wife and two young children, so we are a very particular traveling group. I'm also a cost-conscious traveler, so price is important. When booking in NYC, I put price as a priority, since hotels can get extremely pricey. So I found the new Fairfield Inn for about $107 per night, and though I should give it a shot. Two doubles beds are a must, so that was the room we chose. After check-in, we had to drive around the block to the off-site parking garage ($40 for a normal size car), but that's when trouble started. There was a apartment fire that caused hours of delays, street closures, and general mayhem. We couldn't get back to the garage and wandered for the next two hours in search of 1) a way to the garage, or 2) a place to eat and parking nearby. When we finally got close to the hotel/garage, I tried to get out of our reservation. An employee named Daniel insisted on doing what he needed to to keep our business. In fact, he met us at the corner of 57th and 11th and walked alongside our car until we were safely through the police blockade and into the garage (there was a fire engine blocking the street entrance, so he had to direct us onto the sidewalk). After taking care of us, he did it again for another hotel guest. Daniel deserves Employee of the Month. 

As for the hotel, there's good an bad: 

The good: good complimentary breakfast, contemporary look, friendly staff, and you can park outside the hotel if you check in after 7pm. It's also three blocks from the subway. We went to Rockefeller and it was a three block walk and two stops on the subway to get to our destination. Very easy, even with subway newbies. 

The bad: the room was extremely small, even for NYC standards. There was very little room to do anything besides sleep. I'm torn about the flooring. There was a laminate surface, which looks nicer than carpet, but I'd prefer carpet for my kids. Also, the elevators are excruciatingly slow. They do offer loaner cribs, but it took three attempts to get one to our room. Lastly, our phone wasn't working. The hotel was about two months old, so it's not an issue that I should have to deal with. 

Our experience was tainted by a fire emergency that was out of the hotel's control, but it still did make our stay a bit of a nightmare. I gave the hotel a VERY GOOD rating primarily because of the efforts of one individual who went above and beyond the call of duty.

title: Nice Clean New Hotel, Small Rooms
text:
We had a very good experience at this hotel.  The rate was good compared to other hotel choices.  We wanted to be near Columbus Circle and Central Park, only a two block walk away, so this is a good choice for that location.  I would have given a five star except for the small room sizes. 

Positives:
1)Staff is extremely friendly and welcoming.  
2) Rooms are clean and modern.  
3) Breakfast area is very large and offers a fair assortment of free items.  
4) Exercise room is adequate.   
5) Subway is at Columbus Circle, 8-10 minute walk away
6) Beds are very comfortable
7) Nice sliding door walk in showers
8) Decent lobby area
9) Small outdoor patio area near the street, that would be nice in the summer.   
10) Duane Reade and CVS around the block.   Decent restaurants close by to walk to.  

Negatives
1) Rooms are very small.  Ok for 2 people but any more than that and you would be on top of each other.  You have the space of one person between the bed and window and the bed and the desk.   
2) Elevators are slow with all the stops. So as others have suggested take a lower floor and take the stairs.     

I would also like to offer that I made a suggestion to the manager Axel about a concern I had in the breakfast area.   Axel agreed that the hotel can do better and this was corrected the next day.  Doesn't matter what the issue is, the point is the hotel is responsive.  Thank you Axel for listening to my concern and making this hotel experience better for all guests.  

For parking, you can pull up with your blinkers on and unload your car in front of the hotel.  They do have luggage carts available in the front door.   You may be able to park on the street overnight if you can find a spot.  Don't quote me on that.  The hotel offers $10 off a $50 rate at the garage under the BMW dealership next door.....a one minute walk.   Extra $10 a day mid-size SUVs and up.  I did find a much cheaper parking garage at 507 E 70th Street, only one block over.  The rate is $28 a day $36 for SUV even not having a hotel discount.  So I saved $14 a day over the hotel discount at the BMW garage for 5 days there for a total of $70 savings.    

Overall this is a great hotel is your are not spending time there due to small room size.  The hotel is clean, friendly, and safe.

title: Excellent Value, Negative Reviews are Nonsense
text:
Brand new, shiny hotel. Quiet street close to major subway lines. Smart use of space in king room - all hotel rooms in NYC are tight but the furnishing choices are smart, bright and fun. Hotel staff extremely nice.

Perhaps because it just opened, the price on this hotel was very fair. If you travel regularly, you'll know this was an incredible value. Any negative reviews are simply nonsense.

Source: Regular trips to NYC for business over the past 10 years; long weekends for pleasure.

title: Shiny new hotel, friendly staff, but....
text: We stayed for one night prior to boarding a cruise.  The staff members - front desk, concierge, bell captain were all so friendly and helpful.  The bed was super comfortable and everything was in great shape as it opened earlier in the fall.  Breakfast in the morning was great (and included) and we were able to get to the cruise terminal in about 3 minutes.  The one disappointment was with the parking.  My confirmation indicated there was free public parking but did not clearly state it was street parking in front of the hotel.  The bell captain told us that overnight parking was not allowed on the street and sent us to the garage, which we assumed was free.  The next morning, we found out that there was a $10 discount, so parking cost $40.  We also noticed that the same cars were parked on the street from the night before.  It just felt like a bait and switch and the on site staff were not willing to make it right.  If not for this, I would have given it 5 stars.

title: 2 night stay in December (Marriott Gold)
text:
I booked this room for $140 a night (including tax) in December for 2 nights.

Room: Nice room as it should be considering it's a brand new hotel. Room is extremely small even by NYC standards. I would not recommend getting a double at this hotel; it was just barely manageable in a King. If you have more than 2 people, I'd honestly look elsewhere.

Location: 10-15 minute walk to the subway, which is then 10 minutes to anywhere else you want to go in the city. Subway is decently located, but there are a lot of other hotels where you can find the subway in less than 5 minutes. Was not a big issue since we would leave early in the morning, and didn't get back until late at night. Plenty of restaurants and shopping within 15 minute walk. 

View: There's absolutely no views here as there is simply nothing around the area. It's a developing neighborhood.

Misc: It does come with a free breakfast for everyone. I didn't like that I was not recognized as a gold member (not even a greeting) and there are virtually no benefits to being Gold. Elevators are extremely slow and small, you can wait up to 10 minutes just for an elevator to go down - definitely the most frustrating part of the stay. We just ended up taking the stairs everytime, so get a lower level room!

Overall, it was an average stay. But I would probably look elsewhere especially since there are so many competitively priced hotels in better locations with less problems if I were to do it again.

title: Quick trip with my 15 year old daughter
text: Planned an overnight right after Christmas for my daughter and myself. It turned into 2 nights at the last minute and Daniel at the front desk was so accommodating and personable. He couldn't have been nicer. He even offered to take our bags to our room while we took our car to the garage (i did't use hotel parking). He even phoned the garage to make sure they were still open since we arrived late in the evening. Room was small but typical for NYC. Room was very clean and bed was comfy. The little bar int the lobby made it feel very boutique-y. The bell man, Steven, was a doll. Took our bags to our car upon checkout. They knew us by name on day 2. We loved everything about our stay and will definitely stay again. A little far from Times Square and Rockefeller Center but worth it in the end since we were able to get a good a rate. We always stay at one of the Marriott properties in the city but have never received the service like this time. We are looking forward to staying again.

title: Отель
text: До центрального парка идти минут 15. Нас поселили на первом этаже за ресепшен. Вдоль коридора стояли тележки с грязным бельём. В час ночи кто-то начал пылесосить, номер маленький, вид никакой, темно, солнца не видно. Завтрак очень скудный (странно, что американцы в нём что-то находят). При заселении не взяли наличные в качестве депозита, заморозили значительную сумму на карте.

title: Overnight for Billy Joel concert
text: Decided to stay by Central Park for our overnight after seeing Billy Joel.  Booked room in advance using hotel points. Nice area, staff was extremely helpful as we came early due to the weather.  Close walk to Central Park, can keep car overnight at the BMW dealership next door.  The only downside was the double room was very small.  Staff was great breakfast was included and offered a variety.  Would go back again.

title: New Hotel-Quiet location, reasonable compared to other NY Marriott's
text:
I stayed here for two nights in December.  I selected the hotel ( I am Marriott Platinum) based on location and the fact that it was new and the most inexpensive Marriott in New York City ($118 the first night, $154 the second night).  As usual I will list the PROS and CONS:

PROS:

1. New hotel.  Everything new (obviously), nice king bed, HD TV, nice bathroom.

2.  Very friendly staff.  Received late checkout.

3. Large breakfast area with plenty of choices.(Free)

4. Free internet

5. Decent workout room with new Life Fitness Cardio Equipment and free weights.

6. Quiet location three long blocks from Columbus Circle Metro.

7.  While I can't imagine having a car in New York City there was actually some free parking on the street ( I read the signs) especially on Sunday.

CONS

1.Room was very small.  KIng bed took up almost the entire space.

2. Large TV in workout room did not work (I asked) which was strange considering the hotel just opened.

3. Location while quiet is a hike to sights.  About a 25 minute walk to Rockerfeller Center and 10-15 minutes to the Metro.

In summary, I would stay here again if the rates were the same.

title: Nice and New, but a few issues
text:
I wanted to give this property an excellent rating, but a couple of things stopped me.  Firstly, the hotel is nice and new and the staff was very friendly and helpful. The king room was very tiny, which was fine, but trying to store items was challenging because there was no dresser and just a very tiny closet. However, I did like the coziness of the room.  Apparently, there are some larger rooms available. The other problem we had was with the car service they use when you want to arrange transportation to the airport.  First, the car showed up 50 minutes late which would have been huge if you had not allowed a lot of time to get to the airport. Secondly, the driver changed the price from what the hotel quoted. Third, midway to the airport the driver said he did not take credit cards and proceeded to stop at an ATM. Fourth, the driver said he could not provide a receipt. And lastly, my husband had to direct the driver into the airport because he had no clue how to get to the departure terminal for Delta. The hotel was notified of these issues and were very apologetic, but it left a bad taste in our mouths that they were using such a shady company.  

The hotel is close to Central Park and Columbus Circle.  Lots of decent restaurants within walking distance.

title: The worst experience ever
text: I had the worst experience ever. Being a platinum elite at Marriott and staying more than 130+ nights in a year at Marriott properties I experienced the worst ever service by this hotel. Lack of follow-up, ownership, and bad infrastructure this hotel doesn't stand up to Marriott standards.

title: Amazing Customer Service and Management
text: Decided to go to NYC for my birthday weekend, and needed to be near Lincoln Center for an event.   I waited to book our hotel room with the app "Hotel Tonight," because the prices go down as you get closer to check-in time; that is, if rooms in some hotels remain available.  However, I did not end up using the app because I found this  brand new Fairfield Inn online and the price for one night was less than others found on the app, and they honored triple AAA.  The hotel has excellent front desk help and attention to customers' needs was excellent.   The Manager, Robert Castano was extremely helpful when we ran into a snag with the parking garage next door.  When we called the hotel for advice and to complain of an expensive error at the parking garage, Robert actually left the hotel and CAME to MEET  us in the garage in order to help us resolve the issue.  (The parking  attendant did not honor the price offered by the hotel and the attendant only spoke Spanish--total frustration)!   Robert's professionalism, and his ability to intervene in Spanish to resolve the problem was magical.  He, and the other staff made our stay feel very special.  In the future, I would stay again, except the hotel bar was lacking atmosphere and space; and the hotel ought to consider changing  the sitting area a bit; and try to rearrange bar into a larger, more inviting area rather than going to a window and ordering as if you were at a bank teller's window ordering something to drinkl.  The person I stayed with said the heating system had  a loud fan which did not allow for a great night's sleep, but I found the black out shade and comfort of the bed very nice. I slept fine and even missed my morning workout because I slept soundly-- and we had to be somewhere. The gym I missed trying out at the hotel has brand new treadmills and elliptical machines with attached televisions.  While we missed the free breakfast, we saw the room that  offers breakfast, which is quite large and offers a buffet, if you are there before 9:30 am  on weekends.

title: Excellent staff, clean, but far from Central Park
text: This hotel is new, it is bright and clean.  Rooms are small but not unusual for NYC.  Every single person we dealt with on staff was so friendly and helpful - desk, bellman, breakfast area.  The breakfast included was above average.  The only complaint is the location.  It really is a stretch to call it Central Park, it is quite a long walk away.

title: Thanksgiving/Birthday Celebration
text:
This Fairfield Inn & Suites hotel on W 58th, upper West side near Central Park W, was fantastic!  Everyone associated with the hotel was welcoming & cordial. Enjoyed chatting with Stephen, Cecillia, and Food & Beverage mngr. Complimentary breakfast was great. All stations were clean, the layout is quite different from others we've stayed at. 

Already planning next year's NYC trip,  and definitely will book this hotel again!!!

title: what a great find
text: this is a great property! You can still smell the paint its that new! Location is great with a few minutes walk to Columbus Circle tube station and Central Park. Its about 15minutes walk to Times Square. Rooms although small (typical for NYC) are well appointed and tick all the boxes. Breakfast was a great start to the day and a drink at the small bar went down a treat. The bar menu is small and basic and way overpriced which is my only fault with this hotel. I found my interaction with the staff pleasant. I would recommend this hotel

title: Great Experience at Fairfield Inn Central Park
text: We were looking for a NYC hotel near Central Park over Thanksgiving Weekend and this was a great find. New hotel, only opened 6 weeks. Staff was very friendly and accommodating. Rooms were very small, but comfortable, clean, and nice. Breakfast and Wi-Fi included.  Small bar in the lobby. Parked the car in the garage next door with a hotel discounted price of $40/day. We walked 5 minutes up the street to the major subway hub at Columbus Circle.  Prices were very reasonable for NYC.  Very comfortable stay and with the Marriott brand.

title: Thank you for making our  NYC visit Top Notch!
text: Being that the hotel was brand new, I had some concerns booking prior to it opening and reading reviews. However, once we arrived we were thrilled with our visit and the accommodations. Antonio and Axel were extremely helpful, providing area information and tips, and some laughs when we returned each evening. The rooms are small, but this is NYC, I didn't expect anything more. Although small, they were comfortable. The beds were really comfy and the air and heat worked great, hot water and great water pressure too. Easy access to the city via the M11 and a quick walk to Columbus Circle. We will be back for sure! Thanks for everything!

title: Not Marriott worthy
text: This is a relatively new hotel, which is visible inside. Clean and modern. Service at reception area is very good, Marriott worthy. However, the rooms are very small, certainly for two persons, very hot also, the air conditioning makes a lot of noise ( blows very hard every 5 minutes or so). What the worst experience was however, were the plastic plates and cutlery in the breakfast area. Cheap and bad for the environment.

title: Nice... property & staff
text: Our 3-night stay at the brand new Fairfield Inn & Suites was fantastic! Of course, everything is clean and new, but also the staff was friendly, breakfast included a wide variety of hot and cold items, and location was great. No complaints about the internet access.  Parking is at the deck next door, with discount available when hotel stamps ticket - it was $40 per 24 hrs.  Catching a cab was easy when walking quarter block to 11th Ave or up a little further to 10th Ave. It's a comfortable 20 - 30 minute walk to Rockerfeller Center/Times Square area.  Front desk staff was very friendly and helpful with recommendations & directions.  Housekeeper even offered some suggestions when she heard us talking about where to go while riding the elevator. Only slight complaint was there were noisy guests down the hall -- the sound of the AC fan covered that though.

title: Very nice new hotel
text: We stayed there for one night only . The hotel is new , opened just 1 month ago  . The hotel is very cute , nice design . At the lobby there is a bar area where you can have a drink while wait for the room . The room was very clean and bed comfortable. The only thing we didn't like is that the breakfast finishes very early at 9am . We went down 8:40 and it was just some scrambled eggs left . Also, the 58th st is little hidden a bit difficult to find . Overall our experience was good !

title: New and clean
text: Brand new hotel, clean, staff incredibly attentive, rooms small but expected in NYC but they fit everything in. Coffee maker etc. Breakfast while the standard fare at these places was plentiful and easy, fitness room good. Close to Central Park and an easy 3 blocks to the subway, near Hell's Kitchen so plenty of restaurants. Safe area. Recommend it if you want to be in that area for the price.

title: Horrível
text:
Quarto extremamente pequeno, nao ha lugar para malas, nem para roupas. O ar condicionado faz tanto barulho que é impossível deixa-lo ligado para dormir. Apenas 2 elevadores e nao ha elevador de serviço.
O nome é Central Park mas é bem longe de lá...

title: Just for one night, 2 people !!
text:
Sejour groupe pour 5 nuits dans cet Hotel, neuf propre mais travaux non terminé, les chambres sont extremement petite pour une famille de 4 personnes, aucune places pour laisser les valises, et juste une armoire pour mettre 3 manteaux. Vos affaires restent dans la valise !! Très bonne literie, cet Hotel est destiné plus au "Business" pour 1 ou 2 nuits mais pas pour un long sejour! Les travaux n'étaients pas terminés, peinture dans la baignoire, coffre des chambres ne marchaient pas tous, joint de porte qui pend !et badge qui pouvait ouvrir plusieurs chambres donc visite dans la nuit suite à une erreur de chambre ! 
WC dans la salle de bain ! pour 4 personnes on peut imaginer l'organisation !!
Petit dejeuner au sous-sol sans fenêtre, dommage ! Chambre cote court très sombres lumiere allumée dans la journée ....
Dommage cet Hotel est neuf assez bien situé , proche de Central Park et calme, mais attention par pour une famille de 4 dans les chambres!  et j'oublais la longue attente aux 2 ascenceurs pour tout l'hotel ....

title: Hôtel pour Sejour  une nuit seulement
text:
Chambre extrêmement petite pour 2 personnes, armoire où l'on peut mettre 2 manteaux et c'est tout.
Coffre ne fonctionne pas malgré 2 demandes, peinture sur le fond de la douche, fuite sous les panneaux de la douche lorsque l'on s'en sert, vue sur la cour interne avec bruit de la climatisation externe et l'on ne voit pas le ciel donc chambre absolument pas lumineuse, visite nocturne d'une personne qui doit avoir le double des passes, inquiétant !!! Salle petit dej sans fenêtres et couverts, assiettes en plastique.
Après demande de changement de chambre pour une en solo car trop petite, obligation au départ de payer les taxes alors que celles ci avaient été déjà payées lors de la resa par l'organisateur carrefour du voyage. Personnel gentil malgré tout mais hôtel très décevant et pas très bien situé.

title: A+
text: Wow-what an amazing hotel! The staff was pleasant and helpful, the rooms were clean and comfortable, and the fitness center was perfect! I know this hotel is new, but they doing a great job and making it as close to perfect as possible! Thanks for an easy stay!

title: Brand New
text:
This little hotel is a gem , brand new in every way . On 58th street between 10 th and 11 th . The rooms , while small have everything one could want . The staff is right there to help with any questions one might have . 
        I happen to Love the Metropolitan Opera which is within easy walking distance . There are many good eateries near by . Very well located I think this new Fairfield will be a big hit .

title: Great Stay
text: Great stay in what I would describe as this new off the beaten path hotel. Still felt safe walking to and from, parking is abundant in the area. Arrival is through a sunken courtyard, without outside seating which is very cool, Lobby and Front Desk is Laid out nicely with clean lines and a nice appeal. At Check in and Check out, there is a  Great staff, very friendly and courteous. Very attentive and asking questions to make sure all your needs were met, and expectations exceeded. Rooms were basically brand new at the time of this writing.  Very Clean rooms, although as others have said, the rooms are small, as are the baths. My only comment, which could be both a  positive and negative is that the flooring in the room, is a faux wood material like a pergo, which I appreciate because I know how bad and nasty some hotel carpets can get, so keeping the floors clean should be easier and you won't wind up with black dirty socks. However, I did find the floor a little bit slippery while wearing socks in the room. Overall,  If you are looking for grand hotel rooms with lots of room and a giant bathroom you wont find it here, but you will have an AWESOME stay in a VERY CLEAN room with a SUPER FRIENDLY staff.

title: New & nice
text:
This hotel has only been open for about 2 weeks. Accommodations are nice. Rooms are small, I had a king room and there was no place to put my luggage without being in the way and there is no drawers to put belongings in. Closet was very tiny. Bed was very comfortable. Hotel was very clean and the staff was amazing! Not really close to Central Park (maybe 5 blocks or so).
You DO get FREE breakfast and Wifi!! Had an overall positive experience. Would stay again.

title: one night only....
text:
We stayed in this hotel with a large group for a five days.
I will definitely not recommend this place if you are staying more than one night. 
One family of four stayed in one room with two queen size bed, they had no place to store their luggage, you can imagine 4 towel hanging on the bathroom heater and how crowded it can be.
We had, for a couple, a regular size room but no place to store our clothes and our luggage was taking some space. The iron table had a great cabinet for itself! No space for our clothes.
The air conditioning is also quite noisy, especially if you are having a backside room. It is also quite dark, you can not see the sky if you are on the 4th floor! 
The restaurant for breakfast is located on the basement, no window. It was written asked for gluten free…well I asked and nothing was available. So if you need gluten free, bring your own!
This hotel opened just when we arrive…so many guest had some dysfunctionning: electrical plugs not working correctly, safe not working either, some paint in the bath tube, slippery ground due to detergent.
People at the reception were nice but they could have done more for people crowded in a room knowing that many things were not yet perfect for the price asked.
I would say that if you stay one night it is ok but more than one, check another place. 
Closest subway is Columbus and it will take you at least 10 minutes to go.

title: Good hotel and good location
text: My party and I stayed at the hotel just days after it's grand opening, brand new hotel, we liked the modern decoration and colors of lobby and rooms although a little bit small but hey it's Manhattan!, beds and pillows are very comfortable, wi-fi is good, hotel staff service was great, it is very well located with many restaurants, pharmacys, laundry/cleaners, gym clubs and other locales around, central park is only within minutes of walking distance. The only complaints we had were, number one the elevators, hotel has two but sometimes they were pretty slow and you had to wait a lot for them to come up or down, also they stopped randomly at floors where nobody was waiting. A gentleman from hotel staff told us that the elevators were chinese as if in lower quality and they where having some issues with them because of that, I suppose hotel is new and some glitches had to appear still to be corrected, Issue number two for us were the room closets, for a long stay or for rooms with two people they are small, you just can't hang more than two full suits or winter coats, there is not enough space for hanging more clothes. Down stairs hotel gym is ok, I would have preferred more exercise equipment but it has the basic stuff. Overall is a very nice and brand new hotel (with a new smell) a very nice staff and location. I will come back again.

title: Hôtel neuf, près de Central Park
text: Hôtel bien placé, près de Central Park. Chambres petites mais très propres, literie confortable. Style épuré, contemporain et petit déjeuner varié (fruits, céréales, muffins, bagels...). L'amabilité du personnel est au rendez-vous. Une très bonne adresse à Manhattan.

title: Rated 3 but will be 4 in a few weeks
text: This is a recently opened hotel and once it works out all the kinks it will be a solid property.  It is clean and in good condition.  Complimentary wi-fi and breakfast are nice.  Staff are still learning the systems and procedures; it took a few tries to get a key that worked for my room.  There is still a bit of residual work like minor painting taking place.  The room was tidy, small, but reasonably sized by NYC standards.  It was relatively quiet.  I would try this property again in a few weeks.

title: brand new, clean and good location
text: I stayed there the week it opened and the staff was great, the rooms are small but just like any other NYC hotels. The AC is loud I had to turn mine off to get to sleep. Good breakfast included in price.

title: Clean, Friendly Staff, Breakfast Included, Quiet and NEW!
text: Just opened the week my party of 4 arrived and we found it perfect to stay.  Room is small but that is typical for NYC.  Very clean and the staff is very helpful. From the map it looks like it is out of the way, but we found it accessible to Lincoln Center and Times Square.  After all one should walk in NYC even in the rain.  This hotel has very nice outdoor space which is quite unusual to find in the city.

title: Nice brand new hotel, very small rooms, noisy AC
text:
Fairfield Inn & Suites New York Manhattan/Central Park is a brand-new hotel, opened only few days before my trip.
This hotel is nicely located, not top location, but acceptable. Room are very small and AC is extremely noisy, I felt like I was sleeping with a running airplane engine in my room. I was part of a group and we all experienced the same noisy situation with AC.
Rooms and public areas are perfectly clean.
The entire team is very polite, well trained, proactive and very pleasant.
Due to the noise level of AC, until this problem is fixed, I will probably not stay there again, but I could recommend this hotel.

title: Nuovissimo
text: Nuovissimo e moderno hotel aperto da 10 gg. Camere belle, un po' piccole ma con ottimi materassi e arredi semplici e di buon gusto. Personale molto gentile e accogliente e sempre disponibile. La colazione è un po' scarsa (mancano salumi e formaggi). A parte qualche piccolo disguido dovuto all'apertura appena avvenuta è consigliabile per la posizione e la pulizia. Ottimo.

title: Not that close to Central Park!
text: This hotel is still under construction so I can't comment on it directly. It looks like every other FFI that I've stayed at.   However, I work in the area and can tell you that its not that close to Central Park.  Its probably at least a 6-10 minute walk to Central Park from here.  If you are looking for a park front hotel or a place with lots of activity in the immediate area keep looking.  The area is all the way out on the West Side, a couple of blocks from the Hudson river.  It is a short walk to the bike/walking path along the river.  There is a Citibike dock in front of John Jay College on 11th ave.  There is no on site parking so I guess they will make a deal with a local garage.
